Final Platform Layer  0.5.8.0
final_platform_layer.hpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /***
2 final_platform_layer.hpp
3 
4 A Open source C++ single file header platform abstraction layer library.
5 
6 Final Platform Layer is a cross-platform single-header-file development library designed to abstract the underlying platform to a very simple and easy to use low-level api for accessing input devices, audio playback, window handling, IO handling, multithreading and graphics software or hardware rendering initialization.
7 The main focus is game/simulation development, so the default settings will create a window, setup a opengl rendering context and initialize audio playback on any platform.
8 
9 The only dependencies are built-in operating system libraries, a C++/11 compiler and the C runtime library.
10 
11 Final Platform Layer is released under the following license:
12 
13 MIT License
14 
15 Copyright (c) 2017-2018 Torsten Spaete
16 
17 Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
18 of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
19 in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
20 to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
21 copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
22 furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
23 
24 The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
25 copies or substantial portions of the Software.
26 
27 THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
28 IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
29 FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
30 AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
31 LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
32 OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
33 SOFTWARE.
34 ***/
35

1290 // ****************************************************************************
1291 //
1292 // Header
1293 //
1294 // ****************************************************************************
1295 #ifndef FPL_INCLUDE_HPP
1296 #define FPL_INCLUDE_HPP
1297 
1298 // C++/11 detection
1299 #if !((defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 201103L)) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1900))
1300 # error "You need a C++/11 compatible compiler for this library!"
1301 #endif
1302 
1303 //
1304 // Platform detection
1305 //
1306 #if defined(_WIN32)
1307 # define FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
1308 # define FPL_PLATFORM_NAME "Win32"
1309 #elif defined(__linux__) || defined(__gnu_linux__) || defined(linux)
1310 # define FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX
1311 # define FPL_PLATFORM_NAME "Linux"
1312 # define FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX
1313 #elif defined(__unix__) || defined(_POSIX_VERSION)
1314 # define FPL_PLATFORM_UNIX
1315 # define FPL_PLATFORM_NAME "Unix"
1316 # define FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX
1317 #else
1318 # error "This platform/compiler is not supported!"
1319 #endif
1320 
1321 //
1322 // Architecture detection (x86, x64)
1323 // See: https://sourceforge.net/p/predef/wiki/Architectures/
1324 //
1325 #if defined(_WIN64) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__aarch64__)
1326 # define FPL_ARCH_X64
1327 #elif defined(_WIN32) || defined(__i386__) || defined(__X86__) || defined(_X86_)
1328 # define FPL_ARCH_X86
1329 #else
1330 # error "This architecture/compiler is not supported!"
1331 #endif
1332 
1333 //
1334 // Build configuration and compilers
1335 // See: http://beefchunk.com/documentation/lang/c/pre-defined-c/precomp.html
1336 // See: http://nadeausoftware.com/articles/2012/10/c_c_tip_how_detect_compiler_name_and_version_using_compiler_predefined_macros
1337 //
1338 #if defined(__clang__)
1339 # define FPL_COMPILER_CLANG
1341 #elif defined(__llvm__)
1342 # define FPL_COMPILER_LLVM
1344 #elif defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) || defined(__ICC)
1345 # define FPL_COMPILER_INTEL
1347 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
1348 # define FPL_COMPILER_GCC
1350 #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
1351 # define FPL_COMPILER_MINGW
1353 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
1354 # define FPL_COMPILER_MSVC
1356 #else
1357 # define FPL_COMPILER_UNKNOWN
1359 #endif
1360 
1361 //
1362 // Compiler depended settings and detections
1363 //
1364 #if defined(FPL_COMPILER_MSVC)
1365 # pragma warning( disable : 4577 )
1367 # pragma warning( disable : 4065 )
1369 
1370 # if defined(_DEBUG) || (!defined(NDEBUG))
1371 # define FPL_ENABLE_DEBUG
1373 # else
1374 # define FPL_ENABLE_RELEASE
1376 # endif
1377 #else
1378  // @NOTE(final): Expect all other compilers to pass in FPL_DEBUG manually
1379 # if defined(FPL_DEBUG)
1380 # define FPL_ENABLE_DEBUG
1382 # else
1383 # define FPL_ENABLE_RELEASE
1385 # endif
1386 #endif

1396 # define FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS
1398 # endif
1399 # else
1400 # define FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS
1402 # endif
1403 #endif
1404 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS)
1405 # if !defined(FPL_NO_C_ASSERT)
1406 # define FPL_ENABLE_C_ASSERT
1408 # endif
1409 #endif

1419 # define FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO

1424 # define FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL
1426 # endif
1427 # if !defined(FPL_NO_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
1428 # define FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
1430 # endif
1431 #endif

1433 // Audio
1434 #if !defined(FPL_NO_AUDIO)
1435 # define FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO
1437 #endif
1438 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO)
1439 # if !defined(FPL_NO_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND) && defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
1440 # define FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND
1442 # endif
1443 #endif // FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO
1444 
1445 // Remove video support when window is disabled
1446 #if !defined(FPL_SUPPORT_WINDOW)
1447 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO)
1448 # undef FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO
1449 # endif
1450 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL)
1451 # undef FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL
1452 # endif
1453 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
1454 # undef FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
1455 # endif
1456 #endif
1457

1459 // Enable supports (FPL uses _ENABLE_ internally only)
1460 //

1462 # define FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
1464 #endif
1465 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO)
1466 # define FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
1468 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL)
1469 # define FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
1471 # endif
1472 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
1473 # define FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
1475 # endif
1476 #endif
1477 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO)
1478 # define FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
1480 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
1481 # define FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND
1483 # endif
1484 #endif
1485

1487 # define FPL_ENABLE_ERROR_IN_CONSOLE
1489 #endif

1491 # define FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES

1499 //
1500 // Static/Inline/Extern/Internal
1501 //
1503 #define fpl_globalvar static
1504 #define fpl_localvar static
1506 #define fpl_internal static
1508 #define fpl_inline inline
1510 #define fpl_internal_inline fpl_internal fpl_inline
1512 #define fpl_constant constexpr
1514 
1515 #if defined(FPL_API_AS_PRIVATE)
1516 # define fpl_api static
1518 #else
1519 # define fpl_api extern
1521 #endif // FPL_API_AS_PRIVATE
1522 
1523 //
1524 // Assertions
1525 //
1526 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS)
1527 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_C_ASSERT) && !defined(FPL_FORCE_ASSERTIONS)
1528 # include <assert.h>
1530 # define FPL_ASSERT(exp) assert(exp)
1531 # define FPL_STATICASSERT(exp) static_assert(exp, "static_assert")
1533 # else
1534 # define FPL_ASSERT(exp) if(!(exp)) {*(int *)0 = 0;}
1536 # define FPL_STATICASSERT_(exp, line) \
1538  int fpl_static_assert_##line(int static_assert_failed[(exp)?1:-1])
1539 # define FPL_STATICASSERT(exp) \
1540  FPL_STATICASSERT_(exp, __LINE__)
1541 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_C_ASSERT
1542 #else
1543 # define FPL_ASSERT(exp)
1545 # define FPL_STATICASSERT(exp)
1547 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS
1548 
1550 #define FPL_NOT_IMPLEMENTED {*(int *)0 = 0xBAD;}
1551 
1552 //
1553 // Types & Limits
1554 //
1555 #include <stdint.h> // uint32_t, ...
1556 #include <stddef.h> // size_t
1557 #include <limits.h> // UINT32_MAX, ...
1558 
1559 //
1560 // Macro functions
1561 //
1563 #define FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(arr) (sizeof(arr) / sizeof((arr)[0]))
1564 
1566 #define FPL_OFFSETOF(type, field) ((size_t)(&(((type*)(0))->field)))
1567 
1569 #define FPL_MIN(a, b) ((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b)
1570 #define FPL_MAX(a, b) ((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b)
1572 
1574 #define FPL_KILOBYTES(value) (((value) * 1024ull))
1575 #define FPL_MEGABYTES(value) ((FPL_KILOBYTES(value) * 1024ull))
1577 #define FPL_GIGABYTES(value) ((FPL_MEGABYTES(value) * 1024ull))
1579 #define FPL_TERABYTES(value) ((FPL_GIGABYTES(value) * 1024ull))
1581 
1583 #define FPL_IS_ALIGNED(ptr, alignment) (((uintptr_t)(const void *)(ptr)) % (alignment) == 0)
1584 
1586 #define FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(etype) \
1587  inline etype operator | (etype lhs, etype rhs) { \
1588  return (etype)(static_cast<int>(lhs) | static_cast<int>(rhs)); \
1589  } \
1590  inline bool operator & (const etype lhs, const etype rhs) { \
1591  return (static_cast<int>(lhs) & static_cast<int>(rhs)) == static_cast<int>(rhs); \
1592  } \
1593  inline etype& operator |= (etype &lhs, etype rhs) { \
1594  lhs = (etype)(static_cast<int>(lhs) | static_cast<int>(rhs)); \
1595  return lhs; \
1596  } \
1597  inline etype& operator &= (etype &lhs, etype rhs) { \
1598  lhs = (etype)(static_cast<int>(lhs) & static_cast<int>(rhs)); \
1599  return lhs; \
1600  }
1601 
1602 // ****************************************************************************
1603 //
1604 // Platform includes
1605 //
1606 // ****************************************************************************
1607 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
1608 // @NOTE(final): windef.h defines min/max macros defined in lowerspace, this will break for example std::min/max so we have to tell the header we dont want this!
1609 # if !defined(NOMINMAX)
1610 # define NOMINMAX
1611 # endif
1612 // @NOTE(final): For now we dont want any network, com or gdi stuff at all, maybe later who knows.
1613 # if !defined(WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN)
1614 # define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN 1
1615 # endif
1616 # include <windows.h> // Win32 api, its unfortunate we have to include this in the header as well, but there are structures
1617 #endif
1618 
1619 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX)
1620 # include <stdio.h> // FILE
1621 # include <pthread.h> // pthread_t, pthread_mutex_, pthread_cond_, pthread_barrier_
1622 #endif
1623

1631 namespace fpl {
1633  namespace atomics {
1645  fpl_api void AtomicReadFence();
1650  fpl_api void AtomicWriteFence();
1655  fpl_api void AtomicReadWriteFence();
1656 
1664  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *target, const uint32_t value);
1672  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *target, const uint64_t value);
1680  fpl_api int32_t AtomicExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *target, const int32_t value);
1688  fpl_api int64_t AtomicExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *target, const int64_t value);
1696  fpl_api void *AtomicExchangePtr(volatile void **target, const void *value);
1697 
1705  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicAddU32(volatile uint32_t *value, const uint32_t addend);
1713  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicAddU64(volatile uint64_t *value, const uint64_t addend);
1721  fpl_api int32_t AtomicAddS32(volatile int32_t *value, const int32_t addend);
1729  fpl_api int64_t AtomicAddS64(volatile int64_t *value, const int64_t addend);
1730 
1740  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange);
1750  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange);
1760  fpl_api int32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange);
1770  fpl_api int64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange);
1780  fpl_api void *AtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange);
1781 
1790  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange);
1799  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange);
1808  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange);
1817  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange);
1826  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange);
1827 
1835  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicLoadU32(volatile uint32_t *source);
1843  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicLoadU64(volatile uint64_t *source);
1851  fpl_api int32_t AtomicLoadS32(volatile int32_t *source);
1859  fpl_api int64_t AtomicLoadS64(volatile int64_t *source);
1867  fpl_api void *AtomicLoadPtr(volatile void **source);
1868 
1876  fpl_api void AtomicStoreU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t value);
1884  fpl_api void AtomicStoreU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t value);
1892  fpl_api void AtomicStoreS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t value);
1900  fpl_api void AtomicStoreS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t value);
1908  fpl_api void AtomicStorePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *value);
1909

1914  namespace hardware {
1921  struct MemoryInfos {
1924  size_t totalPhysicalSize;
1926  size_t availablePhysicalSize;
1928  size_t usedPhysicalSize;
1930  size_t totalVirtualSize;
1932  size_t usedVirtualSize;
1934  size_t totalPageSize;
1936  size_t usedPageSize;
1937  };
1938 
1943  fpl_api uint32_t GetProcessorCoreCount();
1951  fpl_api char *GetProcessorName(char *destBuffer, const uint32_t maxDestBufferLen);
1956  fpl_api MemoryInfos GetSystemMemoryInfos();
1957 
1959  }
1960 
1967  enum class InitFlags : int {
1970  None = 0,
1972  Window = 1 << 0,
1974  Video = 1 << 1,
1976  Audio = 1 << 2,
1978  All = Window | Video | Audio
1979  };
1981  FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(InitFlags);
1982 
1984  enum class VideoDriverType {
1986  None,
1988  OpenGL,
1990  Software
1991  };
1992 
1993 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
1994  enum class OpenGLCompabilityFlags : uint32_t {
1997  Legacy = 0,
1999  Core = 1 << 1,
2001  Compability = 1 << 2,
2003  Forward = 1 << 3,
2004  };
2006  FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(OpenGLCompabilityFlags);
2007 #endif
2008 
2010  struct VideoSettings {
2012  VideoDriverType driverType;
2013  union {
2014 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
2015  struct {
2017  OpenGLCompabilityFlags compabilityFlags;
2019  uint32_t majorVersion;
2021  uint32_t minorVersion;
2022  } opengl;
2023 #endif
2024  };
2026  bool isVSync;
2028  bool isAutoSize;
2029  };
2030 
2035  fpl_inline VideoSettings DefaultVideoSettings() {
2036  VideoSettings result = {};
2037 
2038 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
2039  result.opengl.compabilityFlags = OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Legacy;
2040 # endif
2041 
2042  result.isVSync = false;
2043  result.isAutoSize = true;
2044 
2045  // @NOTE(final): Auto detect video driver
2046 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
2047  result.driverType = VideoDriverType::OpenGL;
2048 # elif defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
2049  result.driverType = VideoDriverType::Software;
2050 # else
2051  result.driverType = VideoDriverType::None;
2052 # endif
2053 
2054  return(result);
2055  }
2056 
2058  enum class AudioDriverType {
2060  None,
2062  Auto,
2064  DirectSound
2065  };
2066 
2068  enum class AudioFormatType : uint32_t {
2069  // No audio format
2070  None,
2071  // Unsigned 8-bit integer PCM
2072  U8,
2073  // Signed 16-bit integer PCM
2074  S16,
2075  // Signed 24-bit integer PCM
2076  S24,
2077  // Signed 32-bit integer PCM
2078  S32,
2079  // Signed 64-bit integer PCM
2080  S64,
2081  // 32-bit IEEE_FLOAT
2082  F32,
2083  // 64-bit IEEE_FLOAT
2084  F64,
2085  };
2086 
2088  struct AudioDeviceFormat {
2090  AudioFormatType type;
2092  uint32_t sampleRate;
2094  uint32_t channels;
2096  uint32_t periods;
2098  uint32_t bufferSizeInBytes;
2100  uint32_t bufferSizeInFrames;
2101  };
2102 
2104  struct AudioDeviceID {
2106  char name[256];
2107  union {
2108 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
2109  GUID dshow;
2111 # endif
2112  };
2113  };
2114 
2116  typedef uint32_t(AudioClientReadFunction)(const AudioDeviceFormat &deviceFormat, const uint32_t frameCount, void *outputSamples, void *userData);
2117 
2119  struct AudioSettings {
2121  AudioDeviceFormat deviceFormat;
2123  AudioDeviceID deviceID;
2125  AudioClientReadFunction *clientReadCallback;
2127  AudioDriverType driver;
2129  uint32_t bufferSizeInMilliSeconds;
2131  bool preferExclusiveMode;
2133  void *userData;
2134  };
2135 
2140  fpl_inline AudioSettings DefaultAudioSettings() {
2141  AudioSettings result = {};
2142  result.bufferSizeInMilliSeconds = 25;
2143  result.preferExclusiveMode = false;
2144  result.deviceFormat.channels = 2;
2145  result.deviceFormat.sampleRate = 48000;
2146  result.deviceFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S16;
2147 
2148  result.driver = AudioDriverType::None;
2149 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
2150 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
2151  result.driver = AudioDriverType::DirectSound;
2152 # endif
2153 # endif
2154  return(result);
2155  }
2156 
2158  struct WindowSettings {
2160  char windowTitle[256];
2162  uint32_t windowWidth;
2164  uint32_t windowHeight;
2166  uint32_t fullscreenWidth;
2168  uint32_t fullscreenHeight;
2170  bool isResizable;
2172  bool isFullscreen;
2173  };
2174 
2179  fpl_inline WindowSettings DefaultWindowSettings() {
2180  WindowSettings result = {};
2181  result.windowTitle[0] = 0;
2182  result.windowWidth = 800;
2183  result.windowHeight = 600;
2184  result.fullscreenWidth = 0;
2185  result.fullscreenHeight = 0;
2186  result.isResizable = true;
2187  result.isFullscreen = false;
2188  return(result);
2189  }
2190 
2192  struct InputSettings {
2194  uint32_t controllerDetectionFrequency;
2195  };
2196 
2201  fpl_inline InputSettings DefaultInputSettings() {
2202  InputSettings result = {};
2203  result.controllerDetectionFrequency = 100;
2204  return(result);
2205  }
2206 
2208  struct Settings {
2210  WindowSettings window;
2212  VideoSettings video;
2214  AudioSettings audio;
2216  InputSettings input;
2217  };
2218 
2223  fpl_inline Settings DefaultSettings() {
2224  Settings result = {};
2225  result.window = DefaultWindowSettings();
2226  result.video = DefaultVideoSettings();
2227  result.audio = DefaultAudioSettings();
2228  result.input = DefaultInputSettings();
2229  return(result);
2230  }
2231 
2235  fpl_api const Settings &GetCurrentSettings();
2236

2257  fpl_api void ReleasePlatform();
2258

2285  fpl_api size_t GetPlatformErrorCount();
2290  fpl_api void ClearPlatformErrors();

2294  namespace library {
2302  struct DynamicLibraryHandle {
2305  union {
2306 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
2307  HMODULE win32Handle;
2308 # endif
2309 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX)
2310  void *posixHandle;
2311 # endif
2312  } internalHandle;
2314  bool isValid;
2315  };
2316 
2323  fpl_api DynamicLibraryHandle DynamicLibraryLoad(const char *libraryFilePath);
2330  fpl_api void *GetDynamicLibraryProc(const DynamicLibraryHandle &handle, const char *name);
2335  fpl_api void DynamicLibraryUnload(DynamicLibraryHandle &handle);
2336 
2338  }

2377 
2379  namespace threading {
2386  enum class ThreadState : uint32_t {
2389  Stopped,
2391  Running,
2392  // Thread is suspended
2393  Suspended,
2394  };
2395 
2396  struct ThreadContext;
2398  typedef void (run_thread_function)(const ThreadContext &context, void *data);
2399 
2401  struct ThreadContext {
2403  uint64_t id;
2405  run_thread_function *runFunc;
2407  void *data;
2409  union {
2410 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
2411  HANDLE win32Thread;
2412 # endif
2413 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX)
2414  pthread_t posixThread;
2415  pthread_mutex_t posixWaitMutex;
2416  pthread_cond_t posixWaitCondition;
2417  volatile int32_t posixWaitState;
2418  volatile int32_t posixStopState;
2419 # endif
2420  } internalHandle;
2422  volatile ThreadState currentState;
2425  bool isValid;
2426  };
2427 
2429  struct ThreadMutex {
2431  union {
2432 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
2433  CRITICAL_SECTION win32CriticalSection;
2434 # endif
2435 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX)
2436  pthread_mutex_ posixMutex;
2437 # endif
2438  } internalHandle;
2439  bool isValid;
2440  };
2441 
2443  struct ThreadSignal {
2445  union {
2446 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
2447  HANDLE win32Event;
2448 # endif
2449 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX)
2450  pthread_cond_ posixCondition;
2451 # endif
2452  } internalHandle;
2454  bool isValid;
2455  };
2456 
2467  fpl_api ThreadContext *ThreadCreate(run_thread_function *runFunc, void *data, const bool autoStart = true);
2473  fpl_api void ThreadSleep(const uint32_t milliseconds);
2480  fpl_api bool ThreadSuspend(ThreadContext *context);
2487  fpl_api bool ThreadResume(ThreadContext *context);
2494  fpl_api void ThreadDestroy(ThreadContext *context);
2501  fpl_api bool ThreadWaitForOne(ThreadContext *context, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
2509  fpl_api bool ThreadWaitForAll(ThreadContext *contexts[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
2517  fpl_api bool ThreadWaitForAny(ThreadContext *contexts[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
2518 
2524  fpl_api ThreadMutex MutexCreate();
2529  fpl_api void MutexDestroy(ThreadMutex &mutex);
2536  fpl_api bool MutexLock(ThreadMutex &mutex, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
2542  fpl_api bool MutexUnlock(ThreadMutex &mutex);
2543 
2549  fpl_api ThreadSignal SignalCreate();
2554  fpl_api void SignalDestroy(ThreadSignal &signal);
2562  fpl_api bool SignalWaitForOne(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal &signal, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
2571  fpl_api bool SignalWaitForAll(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal *signals[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
2580  fpl_api bool SignalWaitForAny(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal *signals[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
2586  fpl_api bool SignalWakeUp(ThreadSignal &signal);
2592  fpl_api bool SignalReset(ThreadSignal &signal);
2593 
2595  }

2852  enum class FileAttributeFlags : int {
2854  None = 0,
2856  Normal = 1 << 0,
2858  ReadOnly = 1 << 1,
2860  Hidden = 1 << 2,
2862  Archive = 1 << 3,
2864  System = 1 << 4
2865  };
2867  FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(FileAttributeFlags);

2883  HANDLE win32Handle;
2884 # endif
2885 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX)
2886  void *posixHandle;
2887 # endif
2888  } internalHandle;
2889  };

3118  enum class Key {

3121 
3122  // 0x07: Undefined
3123 
3124  Key_Backspace = 0x08,
3125  Key_Tab = 0x09,
3126 
3127  // 0x0A-0x0B: Reserved
3128 
3129  Key_Clear = 0x0C,
3130  Key_Enter = 0x0D,
3131 
3132  // 0x0E-0x0F: Undefined
3133 
3134  Key_Shift = 0x10,
3135  Key_Control = 0x11,
3136  Key_Alt = 0x12,
3137  Key_Pause = 0x13,
3138  Key_CapsLock = 0x14,
3139 
3140  // 0x15: IME-Keys
3141  // 0x16: Undefined
3142  // 0x17-0x19 IME-Keys
3143  // 0x1A: Undefined
3144 
3145  Key_Escape = 0x1B,
3146 
3147  // 0x1C - 0x1F: IME-Keys
3148

3150  Key_PageUp = 0x21,
3151  Key_PageDown = 0x22,
3152  Key_End = 0x23,

3163  Key_Delete = 0x2E,

3165

3182  Key_D = 0x44,
3183  Key_E = 0x45,

3207  Key_RightWin = 0x5C,

3209

3214  Key_NumPad1 = 0x61,

3248  Key_F20 = 0x83,

3250  Key_F22 = 0x85,
3251  Key_F23 = 0x86,

3253

3255

3257  Key_Scroll = 0x91,
3258 
3259  // 0x92-9x96: OEM specific
3260  // 0x97-0x9F: Unassigned
3261 
3262  Key_LeftShift = 0xA0,
3263  Key_RightShift = 0xA1,
3264  Key_LeftControl = 0xA2,
3265  Key_RightControl = 0xA3,
3266  Key_LeftAlt = 0xA4,
3267  Key_RightAlt = 0xA5,
3268 
3269  // 0xA6-0xFE: Dont care
3270  };

3421  GamepadButton rightShoulder;
3422  };

3425  GamepadButton buttons[14];
3426  };

3622 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)

3631  struct VideoRect {

3640  int32_t height;
3641  };
3642 
3651  inline VideoRect CreateVideoRectFromLTRB(int32_t left, int32_t top, int32_t right, int32_t bottom) {
3652  VideoRect result = { left, top, (right - left) + 1, (bottom - top) + 1 };
3653  return(result);
3654  }

3670  };

3749 //
3750 // Platform specific defines/includes and forward declarations
3751 //
3752 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
3753 // @NOTE(final): Required for access "main" from the actual win32 entry point
3754 fpl_api int main(int argc, char *args[]);
3755 #endif // FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
3756 
3757 // Expand all namespaces if the callers wants this
3758 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUTO_NAMESPACE)
3759 using namespace fpl;
3760 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
3761 using namespace fpl::window;
3762 using namespace fpl::video;
3763 # endif
3764 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
3765 using namespace fpl::audio;
3766 # endif
3767 using namespace fpl::atomics;
3768 using namespace fpl::hardware;
3769 using namespace fpl::memory;
3770 using namespace fpl::timings;
3771 using namespace fpl::paths;
3772 using namespace fpl::files;
3773 using namespace fpl::library;
3774 using namespace fpl::strings;
3775 using namespace fpl::console;
3776 using namespace fpl::threading;
3777 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUTO_NAMESPACE
3778 
3779 #endif // FPL_INCLUDE_HPP
3780 
3781 // ****************************************************************************
3782 //
3783 // Implementation
3784 //
3785 // ****************************************************************************
3786 #if defined(FPL_IMPLEMENTATION) && !defined(FPL_IMPLEMENTED)
3787 #define FPL_IMPLEMENTED
3788 
3789 // ****************************************************************************
3790 //
3791 // Common Functions (Non-Platform specific)
3792 //
3793 // ****************************************************************************
3794 
3795 // Standard includes
3796 #include <stdarg.h> // va_start, va_end, va_list, va_arg
3797 #include <stdio.h> // fprintf, vfprintf, vsprintf
3798 
3799 //
3800 // Macros
3801 //
3802 #define FPL_CLEARMEM(T, memory, size, shift, mask) \
3803  do { \
3804  size_t clearedBytes = 0; \
3805  if (sizeof(T) > sizeof(uint8_t)) { \
3806  T *dataBlock = static_cast<T *>(memory); \
3807  T *dataBlockEnd = static_cast<T *>(memory) + (size >> shift); \
3808  while (dataBlock != dataBlockEnd) { \
3809  *dataBlock++ = 0; \
3810  clearedBytes += sizeof(T); \
3811  } \
3812  } \
3813  uint8_t *data8 = (uint8_t *)memory + clearedBytes; \
3814  uint8_t *data8End = (uint8_t *)memory + size; \
3815  while (data8 != data8End) { \
3816  *data8++ = 0; \
3817  } \
3818  } while (0);
3819 
3820 #define FPL_COPYMEM(T, source, sourceSize, dest, shift, mask) \
3821  do { \
3822  size_t copiedBytes = 0; \
3823  if (sizeof(T) > sizeof(uint8_t)) { \
3824  T *sourceDataBlock = static_cast<T *>(source); \
3825  T *sourceDataBlockEnd = static_cast<T *>(source) + (sourceSize >> shift); \
3826  T *destDataBlock = static_cast<T *>(dest); \
3827  while (sourceDataBlock != sourceDataBlockEnd) { \
3828  *destDataBlock++ = *sourceDataBlock++; \
3829  copiedBytes += sizeof(T); \
3830  } \
3831  } \
3832  uint8_t *sourceData8 = (uint8_t *)source + copiedBytes; \
3833  uint8_t *sourceData8End = (uint8_t *)source + sourceSize; \
3834  uint8_t *destData8 = (uint8_t *)dest + copiedBytes; \
3835  while (sourceData8 != sourceData8End) { \
3836  *destData8++ = *sourceData8++; \
3837  } \
3838  } while (0);
3839 
3840 namespace fpl {
3841  namespace platform {
3842  //
3843  // Platform constants
3844  //
3845 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
3846  fpl_constant char PATH_SEPARATOR = '\\';
3847  fpl_constant char FILE_EXT_SEPARATOR = '.';
3848 # else
3849  fpl_constant char PATH_SEPARATOR = '/';
3850  fpl_constant char FILE_EXT_SEPARATOR = '.';
3851 # endif
3852  } // platform
3853 
3854  namespace common {
3855  //
3856  // Internal types and functions
3857  //
3858  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH = 1024;
3859 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
3860  fpl_constant size_t MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT = 256;
3861 # else
3862  fpl_constant size_t MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT = 1;
3863 # endif
3864 
3865  struct ErrorState {
3866  char errors[MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT][MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH];
3867  size_t count;
3868  };
3869 
3870  fpl_globalvar ErrorState global__LastErrorState;
3871 
3872 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
3873  fpl_internal_inline void PushError_Formatted(const char *format, va_list &argList) {
3874  ErrorState &state = global__LastErrorState;
3875  FPL_ASSERT(format != nullptr);
3876  char buffer[MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH];
3877  vsnprintf(buffer, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(buffer), format, argList);
3878  uint32_t messageLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(buffer);
3879  FPL_ASSERT(state.count < MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT);
3880  size_t errorIndex = state.count;
3881  state.count = (state.count + 1) % MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT;
3882  strings::CopyAnsiString(buffer, messageLen, state.errors[errorIndex], MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH);
3883 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ERROR_IN_CONSOLE)
3884  console::ConsoleFormatError("FPL Error: %s\n", buffer);
3885 # endif
3886  }
3887 # else
3888  fpl_internal_inline void PushError_Formatted(const char *format, va_list &argList) {
3889  ErrorState &state = global__LastErrorState;
3890  FPL_ASSERT(format != nullptr);
3891  char buffer[MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH];
3892  vsnprintf(buffer, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(buffer), format, argList);
3893  uint32_t messageLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(buffer);
3894  state.count = 1;
3895  strings::CopyAnsiString(buffer, messageLen, state.errors[0], MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH);
3896 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ERROR_IN_CONSOLE)
3897  console::ConsoleFormatError("FPL Error: %s\n", buffer);
3898 # endif
3899  }
3900 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES
3901 
3902  fpl_internal_inline void PushError(const char *format, ...) {
3903  va_list valist;
3904  va_start(valist, format);
3905  PushError_Formatted(format, valist);
3906  va_end(valist);
3907  }
3908 
3909  // Maximum number of threads you can have in your process
3910  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_THREAD_COUNT = 64;
3911 
3912  // Maximum number of signals you can wait for
3913  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_SIGNAL_COUNT = 256;
3914 
3915  struct ThreadState {
3916  threading::ThreadContext mainThread;
3917  threading::ThreadContext threads[MAX_THREAD_COUNT];
3918  };
3919 
3920  fpl_globalvar ThreadState global__ThreadState = {};
3921 
3922  fpl_internal_inline threading::ThreadContext *GetThreadContext() {
3923  threading::ThreadContext *result = nullptr;
3924  for (uint32_t index = 0; index < MAX_THREAD_COUNT; ++index) {
3925  threading::ThreadContext *thread = global__ThreadState.threads + index;
3926  uint32_t state = atomics::AtomicLoadU32((volatile uint32_t *)&thread->currentState);
3927  if (state == (uint32_t)threading::ThreadState::Stopped) {
3928  result = thread;
3929  break;
3930  }
3931  }
3932  return(result);
3933  }
3934 
3935  } // common
3936 
3937  //
3938  // Common Audio
3939  //
3940 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
3941  namespace audio {
3942  struct CommonAudioState {
3943  AudioDeviceFormat internalFormat;
3944  AudioClientReadFunction *clientReadCallback;
3945  void *clientUserData;
3946  };
3947 
3948  fpl_internal_inline uint32_t GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(const AudioFormatType format) {
3949  switch (format) {
3950  case AudioFormatType::U8:
3951  return 1;
3952  case AudioFormatType::S16:
3953  return 2;
3954  case AudioFormatType::S24:
3955  return 3;
3956  case AudioFormatType::S32:
3957  case AudioFormatType::F32:
3958  return 4;
3959  case AudioFormatType::S64:
3960  case AudioFormatType::F64:
3961  return 8;
3962  default:
3963  return 0;
3964  }
3965  }
3966 
3967  // @NOTE(final): Order must be equal to the AudioFormatType enum!
3968  fpl_constant char *AUDIO_FORMAT_TYPE_STRINGS[] = {
3969  "None",
3970  "U8",
3971  "S16",
3972  "S24",
3973  "S32",
3974  "S64",
3975  "F32",
3976  "F64",
3977  };
3978  fpl_internal_inline const char *GetAudioFormatString(AudioFormatType format) {
3979  uint32_t index = (uint32_t)format;
3980  FPL_ASSERT(index < FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(AUDIO_FORMAT_TYPE_STRINGS));
3981  const char *result = AUDIO_FORMAT_TYPE_STRINGS[index];
3982  return(result);
3983  }
3984 
3985  fpl_constant char *AUDIO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS[] = {
3986  "None",
3987  "Auto",
3988  "DirectSound",
3989  };
3990  fpl_internal_inline const char *GetAudioDriverString(AudioDriverType driver) {
3991  uint32_t index = (uint32_t)driver;
3992  FPL_ASSERT(index < FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(AUDIO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS));
3993  const char *result = AUDIO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS[index];
3994  return(result);
3995  }
3996 
3997  fpl_internal_inline uint32_t GetAudioBufferSizeInFrames(uint32_t sampleRate, uint32_t bufferSizeInMilliSeconds) {
3998  uint32_t result = (sampleRate / 1000) * bufferSizeInMilliSeconds;
3999  return(result);
4000  }
4001 
4002  fpl_internal_inline uint32_t ReadAudioFramesFromClient(const CommonAudioState &commonAudio, uint32_t frameCount, void *pSamples) {
4003  uint32_t outputSamplesWritten = 0;
4004  if (commonAudio.clientReadCallback != nullptr) {
4005  outputSamplesWritten = commonAudio.clientReadCallback(commonAudio.internalFormat, frameCount, pSamples, commonAudio.clientUserData);
4006  }
4007  return outputSamplesWritten;
4008  }
4009 
4010  // Forward declarations
4011  fpl_internal void ReleaseAudio();
4012  fpl_internal AudioResult InitAudio(const AudioSettings &audioSettings);
4013  } // audio
4014 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
4015 
4016  //
4017  // Common Strings
4018  //
4019  namespace strings {
4020  fpl_api bool IsStringEqual(const char *a, const uint32_t aLen, const char *b, const uint32_t bLen) {
4021  if ((a == nullptr) || (b == nullptr)) {
4022  return (a == b);
4023  }
4024  if (aLen != bLen) {
4025  return false;
4026  }
4027  FPL_ASSERT(aLen == bLen);
4028  bool result = true;
4029  for (uint32_t index = 0; index < aLen; ++index) {
4030  char aChar = a[index];
4031  char bChar = b[index];
4032  if (aChar != bChar) {
4033  result = false;
4034  break;
4035  }
4036  }
4037  return(result);
4038  }
4039 
4040  fpl_api bool IsStringEqual(const char *a, const char *b) {
4041  if ((a == nullptr) || (b == nullptr)) {
4042  return (a == b);
4043  }
4044  bool result = true;
4045  for (;;) {
4046  const char aChar = *(a++);
4047  const char bChar = *(b++);
4048  if (aChar == 0 || bChar == 0) {
4049  result = (aChar == bChar);
4050  break;
4051  }
4052  if (aChar != bChar) {
4053  result = false;
4054  break;
4055  }
4056  }
4057  return(result);
4058  }
4059 
4060  fpl_api uint32_t GetAnsiStringLength(const char *str) {
4061  uint32_t result = 0;
4062  if (str != nullptr) {
4063  while (*str++) {
4064  result++;
4065  }
4066  }
4067  return(result);
4068  }
4069 
4070  fpl_api uint32_t GetWideStringLength(const wchar_t *str) {
4071  uint32_t result = 0;
4072  if (str != nullptr) {
4073  while (*str++) {
4074  result++;
4075  }
4076  }
4077  return(result);
4078  }
4079 
4080  fpl_api char *CopyAnsiString(const char *source, const uint32_t sourceLen, char *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4081  char *result = nullptr;
4082  if ((source != nullptr && dest != nullptr) && ((sourceLen + 1) <= maxDestLen)) {
4083  result = dest;
4084  uint32_t index = 0;
4085  while (index++ < sourceLen) {
4086  *dest++ = *source++;
4087  }
4088  *dest = 0;
4089  } else {
4090  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4091  }
4092  return(result);
4093  }
4094 
4095  fpl_api char *CopyAnsiString(const char *source, char *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4096  char *result = nullptr;
4097  if (source != nullptr) {
4098  uint32_t sourceLen = GetAnsiStringLength(source);
4099  char *result = CopyAnsiString(source, sourceLen, dest, maxDestLen);
4100  } else {
4101  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4102  }
4103  return(result);
4104  }
4105 
4106  fpl_api wchar_t *CopyWideString(const wchar_t *source, const uint32_t sourceLen, wchar_t *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4107  wchar_t *result = nullptr;
4108  if ((source != nullptr && dest != nullptr) && ((sourceLen + 1) <= maxDestLen)) {
4109  result = dest;
4110  uint32_t index = 0;
4111  while (index++ < sourceLen) {
4112  *dest++ = *source++;
4113  }
4114  *dest = 0;
4115  } else {
4116  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4117  }
4118  return(result);
4119  }
4120 
4121  fpl_api wchar_t *CopyWideString(const wchar_t *source, wchar_t *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4122  wchar_t *result = nullptr;
4123  if (source != nullptr) {
4124  uint32_t sourceLen = GetWideStringLength(source);
4125  result = CopyWideString(source, sourceLen, dest, maxDestLen);
4126  } else {
4127  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4128  }
4129  return(result);
4130  }
4131  } // strings
4132 
4133  //
4134  // Common Memory
4135  //
4136  namespace memory {
4137  fpl_api void *MemoryAlignedAllocate(const size_t size, const size_t alignment) {
4138  if (size == 0) {
4139  common::PushError("Memory size parameter must be greater than zero");
4140  return nullptr;
4141  }
4142  if ((alignment == 0) || (alignment & (alignment - 1))) {
4143  common::PushError("Alignment '%zu' must be greater than zero and a power of two", alignment);
4144  return nullptr;
4145  }
4146 
4147  // Allocate empty memory to hold a size of a pointer + the actual size + alignment padding
4148  size_t newSize = sizeof(void *) + size + (alignment << 1);
4149  void *basePtr = fpl::memory::MemoryAllocate(newSize);
4150 
4151  // The resulting address starts after the stored base pointer
4152  void *alignedPtr = (void *)((uint8_t *)basePtr + sizeof(void *));
4153 
4154  // Move the resulting address to a aligned one when not aligned
4155  uintptr_t mask = alignment - 1;
4156  if ((alignment > 1) && (((uintptr_t)alignedPtr & mask) != 0)) {
4157  uintptr_t offset = ((uintptr_t)alignment - ((uintptr_t)alignedPtr & mask));
4158  alignedPtr = (uint8_t *)alignedPtr + offset;
4159  }
4160 
4161  // Write the base pointer before the alignment pointer
4162  *(void **)((void *)((uint8_t *)alignedPtr - sizeof(void *))) = basePtr;
4163 
4164  // Ensure alignment
4165  FPL_ASSERT(FPL_IS_ALIGNED(alignedPtr, alignment));
4166 
4167  return(alignedPtr);
4168  }
4169 
4170  fpl_api void MemoryAlignedFree(void *ptr) {
4171  if (ptr == nullptr) {
4172  common::PushError("Memory pointer parameter are not allowed to be null");
4173  return;
4174  }
4175 
4176  // Free the base pointer which is stored to the left from the given pointer
4177  void *basePtr = *(void **)((void *)((uint8_t *)ptr - sizeof(void *)));
4178  FPL_ASSERT(basePtr != nullptr);
4179  MemoryFree(basePtr);
4180  }
4181 
4182  fpl_constant size_t MEM_SHIFT_64 = 3;
4183  fpl_constant size_t MEM_MASK_64 = 0x00000007;
4184  fpl_constant size_t MEM_SHIFT_32 = 2;
4185  fpl_constant size_t MEM_MASK_32 = 0x00000003;
4186  fpl_constant size_t MEM_SHIFT_16 = 1;
4187  fpl_constant size_t MEM_MASK_16 = 0x00000001;
4188 
4189  fpl_api void MemoryClear(void *mem, const size_t size) {
4190  if (mem == nullptr) {
4191  common::PushError("Memory parameter are not allowed to be null");
4192  return;
4193  }
4194  if (size == 0) {
4195  common::PushError("Size parameter must be greater than zero");
4196  return;
4197  }
4198  if (size % 8 == 0) {
4199  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint64_t, mem, size, MEM_SHIFT_64, MEM_MASK_64);
4200  } else if (size % 4 == 0) {
4201  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint32_t, mem, size, MEM_SHIFT_32, MEM_MASK_32);
4202  } else if (size % 2 == 0) {
4203  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint16_t, mem, size, MEM_SHIFT_16, MEM_MASK_16);
4204  } else {
4205  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint8_t, mem, size, 0, 0);
4206  }
4207  }
4208 
4209  fpl_api void MemoryCopy(void *sourceMem, const size_t sourceSize, void *targetMem) {
4210  if (sourceMem == nullptr) {
4211  common::PushError("Source memory parameter are not allowed to be null");
4212  return;
4213  }
4214  if (sourceSize == 0) {
4215  common::PushError("Source size parameter must be greater than zero");
4216  return;
4217  }
4218  if (targetMem == nullptr) {
4219  common::PushError("Target memory parameter are not allowed to be null");
4220  return;
4221  }
4222  if (sourceSize % 8 == 0) {
4223  FPL_COPYMEM(uint64_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, MEM_SHIFT_64, MEM_MASK_64);
4224  } else if (sourceSize % 4 == 0) {
4225  FPL_COPYMEM(uint32_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, MEM_SHIFT_32, MEM_MASK_32);
4226  } else if (sourceSize % 2 == 0) {
4227  FPL_COPYMEM(uint16_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, MEM_SHIFT_32, MEM_MASK_32);
4228  } else {
4229  FPL_COPYMEM(uint8_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, 0, 0);
4230  }
4231  }
4232  } // memory
4233 
4234  //
4235  // Common Atomics
4236  //
4237  namespace atomics {
4238  fpl_api void *AtomicExchangePtr(volatile void **target, const void *value) {
4239  FPL_ASSERT(target != nullptr);
4240 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4241  void *result = (void *)AtomicExchangeU64((volatile uint64_t *)target, (uint64_t)value);
4242 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4243  void *result = (void *)AtomicExchangeU32((volatile uint32_t *)target, (uint32_t)value);
4244 # else
4245 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4246 # endif
4247  return (result);
4248  }
4249 
4250  fpl_api void *AtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange) {
4251  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
4252 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4253  void *result = (void *)AtomicCompareAndExchangeU64((volatile uint64_t *)dest, (uint64_t)comparand, (uint64_t)exchange);
4254 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4255  void *result = (void *)AtomicCompareAndExchangeU32((volatile uint32_t *)dest, (uint32_t)comparand, (uint32_t)exchange);
4256 # else
4257 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4258 # endif
4259  return (result);
4260  }
4261 
4262  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange) {
4263  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
4264 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4265  bool result = IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU64((volatile uint64_t *)dest, (uint64_t)comparand, (uint64_t)exchange);
4266 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4267  bool result = IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU32((volatile uint32_t *)dest, (uint32_t)comparand, (uint32_t)exchange);
4268 # else
4269 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4270 #endif
4271  return (result);
4272  }
4273 
4274  fpl_api void *AtomicLoadPtr(volatile void **source) {
4275 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4276  void *result = (void *)AtomicLoadU64((volatile uint64_t *)source);
4277 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4278  void *result = (void *)AtomicLoadU32((volatile uint32_t *)source);
4279 # else
4280 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4281 # endif
4282  return(result);
4283  }
4284 
4285  fpl_api void AtomicStorePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *value) {
4286 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4287  AtomicStoreU64((volatile uint64_t *)dest, (uint64_t)value);
4288 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4289  AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)dest, (uint32_t)value);
4290 # else
4291 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4292 # endif
4293  }
4294  } // atomics
4295 
4296  //
4297  // Common Paths
4298  //
4299  namespace paths {
4300  fpl_api char *ExtractFilePath(const char *sourcePath, char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4301  if (sourcePath == nullptr) {
4302  return nullptr;
4303  }
4304  uint32_t sourceLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(sourcePath);
4305  if (sourceLen == 0) {
4306  return nullptr;
4307  }
4308  if (destPath == nullptr) {
4309  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
4310  return nullptr;
4311  }
4312  if (maxDestLen < (sourceLen + 1)) {
4313  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, sourceLen + 1);
4314  return nullptr;
4315  }
4316 
4317  char *result = nullptr;
4318  if (sourcePath) {
4319  int copyLen = 0;
4320  char *chPtr = (char *)sourcePath;
4321  while (*chPtr) {
4322  if (*chPtr == platform::PATH_SEPARATOR) {
4323  copyLen = (int)(chPtr - sourcePath);
4324  }
4325  ++chPtr;
4326  }
4327  if (copyLen) {
4328  result = strings::CopyAnsiString(sourcePath, copyLen, destPath, maxDestLen);
4329  }
4330  }
4331  return(result);
4332  }
4333 
4334  fpl_api char *ExtractFileExtension(const char *sourcePath) {
4335  char *result = (char *)nullptr;
4336  if (sourcePath != nullptr) {
4337  char *filename = ExtractFileName(sourcePath);
4338  if (filename) {
4339  char *chPtr = filename;
4340  char *firstSeparatorPtr = (char *)nullptr;
4341  while (*chPtr) {
4342  if (*chPtr == platform::FILE_EXT_SEPARATOR) {
4343  firstSeparatorPtr = chPtr;
4344  break;
4345  }
4346  ++chPtr;
4347  }
4348  if (firstSeparatorPtr != nullptr) {
4349  result = firstSeparatorPtr;
4350  }
4351  }
4352  }
4353  return(result);
4354  }
4355 
4356  fpl_api char *ExtractFileName(const char *sourcePath) {
4357  char *result = (char *)nullptr;
4358  if (sourcePath) {
4359  result = (char *)sourcePath;
4360  char *chPtr = (char *)sourcePath;
4361  char *lastPtr = (char *)nullptr;
4362  while (*chPtr) {
4363  if (*chPtr == platform::PATH_SEPARATOR) {
4364  lastPtr = chPtr;
4365  }
4366  ++chPtr;
4367  }
4368  if (lastPtr != nullptr) {
4369  result = lastPtr + 1;
4370  }
4371  }
4372  return(result);
4373  }
4374 
4375  fpl_api char *ChangeFileExtension(const char *filePath, const char *newFileExtension, char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4376  if (filePath == nullptr) {
4377  return nullptr;
4378  }
4379  if (newFileExtension == nullptr) {
4380  return nullptr;
4381  }
4382  uint32_t pathLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(filePath);
4383  if (pathLen == 0) {
4384  return nullptr;
4385  }
4386  uint32_t extLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(newFileExtension);
4387 
4388  if (destPath == nullptr) {
4389  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
4390  return nullptr;
4391  }
4392  if (maxDestLen < (pathLen + extLen + 1)) {
4393  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, pathLen + extLen + 1);
4394  return nullptr;
4395  }
4396 
4397  char *result = nullptr;
4398  if (filePath != nullptr) {
4399  // Find last path
4400  char *chPtr = (char *)filePath;
4401  char *lastPathSeparatorPtr = nullptr;
4402  while (*chPtr) {
4403  if (*chPtr == platform::PATH_SEPARATOR) {
4404  lastPathSeparatorPtr = chPtr;
4405  }
4406  ++chPtr;
4407  }
4408 
4409  // Find last ext separator
4410  if (lastPathSeparatorPtr != nullptr) {
4411  chPtr = lastPathSeparatorPtr + 1;
4412  } else {
4413  chPtr = (char *)filePath;
4414  }
4415  char *lastExtSeparatorPtr = nullptr;
4416  while (*chPtr) {
4417  if (*chPtr == platform::FILE_EXT_SEPARATOR) {
4418  lastExtSeparatorPtr = chPtr;
4419  }
4420  ++chPtr;
4421  }
4422 
4423  uint32_t copyLen;
4424  if (lastExtSeparatorPtr != nullptr) {
4425  copyLen = (uint32_t)((uintptr_t)lastExtSeparatorPtr - (uintptr_t)filePath);
4426  } else {
4427  copyLen = pathLen;
4428  }
4429 
4430  // Copy parts
4431  strings::CopyAnsiString(filePath, copyLen, destPath, maxDestLen);
4432  char *destExtPtr = destPath + copyLen;
4433  strings::CopyAnsiString(newFileExtension, extLen, destExtPtr, maxDestLen - copyLen);
4434  result = destPath;
4435  }
4436  return(result);
4437  }
4438 
4439  fpl_api char *CombinePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestPathLen, const uint32_t pathCount, ...) {
4440  if (pathCount == 0) {
4441  return nullptr;
4442  }
4443  if (destPath == nullptr) {
4444  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
4445  return nullptr;
4446  }
4447  if (maxDestPathLen == 0) {
4448  common::PushError("Max dest path len parameter must be greater than zero");
4449  return nullptr;
4450  }
4451 
4452  uint32_t curDestPosition = 0;
4453  char *currentDestPtr = destPath;
4454  va_list vargs;
4455  va_start(vargs, pathCount);
4456  for (uint32_t pathIndex = 0; pathIndex < pathCount; ++pathIndex) {
4457  char *path = va_arg(vargs, char *);
4458  uint32_t pathLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(path);
4459  bool requireSeparator = pathIndex < (pathCount - 1);
4460  uint32_t requiredPathLen = requireSeparator ? pathLen + 1 : pathLen;
4461  FPL_ASSERT(curDestPosition + requiredPathLen <= maxDestPathLen);
4462  strings::CopyAnsiString(path, pathLen, currentDestPtr, maxDestPathLen - curDestPosition);
4463  currentDestPtr += pathLen;
4464  if (requireSeparator) {
4465  *currentDestPtr++ = platform::PATH_SEPARATOR;
4466  }
4467  curDestPosition += requiredPathLen;
4468  }
4469  *currentDestPtr = 0;
4470  va_end(vargs);
4471  return destPath;
4472  }
4473 
4474  } // paths
4475 
4476 } // fpl
4477 
4478 // ****************************************************************************
4479 //
4480 // WIN32 Platform
4481 //
4482 // ****************************************************************************
4483 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
4484 # include <windowsx.h> // Macros for window messages
4485 # include <shlobj.h> // SHGetFolderPath
4486 # include <intrin.h> // Interlock*
4487 
4488 # include <xinput.h> // XInputGetState
4489 
4490 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4491 # define FPL_MEMORY_BARRIER() \
4492  LONG barrier; \
4493  _InterlockedOr(&barrier, 0);
4494 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4495  // @NOTE(final): No need for hardware memory fence on X64 because the hardware guarantees memory order always.
4496 # define FPL_MEMORY_BARRIER()
4497 # endif
4498 
4499  // @NOTE(final): Little macro to not write 5 lines of code all the time
4500 # define FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(libHandle, libName, target, type, name) \
4501  target = (type *)GetProcAddress(libHandle, name); \
4502  if (target == nullptr) { \
4503  fpl::common::PushError("Failed getting '%s' from library '%s'", name, libName); \
4504  return false; \
4505  }
4506 
4507 namespace fpl {
4508  namespace platform {
4509  //
4510  // XInputGetState
4511  //
4512 # define FPL_XINPUT_GET_STATE(name) DWORD WINAPI name(DWORD dwUserIndex, XINPUT_STATE *pState)
4513  typedef FPL_XINPUT_GET_STATE(win32_func_XInputGetState);
4514  FPL_XINPUT_GET_STATE(Win32XInputGetStateStub) {
4515  return(ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED);
4516  }
4517 # define FPL_XINPUT_GET_CAPABILITIES(name) DWORD WINAPI name(DWORD dwUserIndex, DWORD dwFlags, XINPUT_CAPABILITIES* pCapabilities)
4518  typedef FPL_XINPUT_GET_CAPABILITIES(win32_func_XInputGetCapabilities);
4519  FPL_XINPUT_GET_CAPABILITIES(Win32XInputGetCapabilitiesStub) {
4520  return(ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED);
4521  }
4522

4529  };

4748  typedef FPL_FUNC_GET_MONITOR_INFO_W(win32_func_GetMonitorInfoW);
4749 # define FPL_FUNC_MONITOR_FROM_RECT(name) HMONITOR WINAPI name(LPCRECT lprc, DWORD dwFlags)
4750  typedef FPL_FUNC_MONITOR_FROM_RECT(win32_func_MonitorFromRect);
4751 # define FPL_FUNC_MONITOR_FROM_WINDOW(name) HMONITOR WINAPI name(HWND hwnd, DWORD dwFlags)
4752  typedef FPL_FUNC_MONITOR_FROM_WINDOW(win32_func_MonitorFromWindow);
4753 
4754  //
4755  // OLE32
4756  //
4757 # define FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_INITIALIZE_EX(name) HRESULT WINAPI name(LPVOID pvReserved, DWORD dwCoInit)
4758  typedef FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_INITIALIZE_EX(win32_func_CoInitializeEx);
4759 # define FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_UNINITIALIZE(name) void WINAPI name(void)
4760  typedef FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_UNINITIALIZE(win32_func_CoUninitialize);
4761 # define FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_CREATE_INSTANCE(name) HRESULT WINAPI name(REFCLSID rclsid, LPUNKNOWN pUnkOuter, DWORD dwClsContext, REFIID riid, LPVOID *ppv)
4762  typedef FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_CREATE_INSTANCE(win32_func_CoCreateInstance);
4763 # define FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_TASK_MEM_FREE(name) void WINAPI name(LPVOID pv)
4764  typedef FPL_FUNC_WIN32_CO_TASK_MEM_FREE(win32_func_CoTaskMemFree);
4765 # define FPL_FUNC_WIN32_PROP_VARIANT_CLEAR(name) HRESULT WINAPI name(PROPVARIANT *pvar)
4766  typedef FPL_FUNC_WIN32_PROP_VARIANT_CLEAR(win32_func_PropVariantClear);
4767 
4768  struct Win32APIFunctions {
4769  struct {
4770  HMODULE gdiLibrary;
4771  win32_func_ChoosePixelFormat *choosePixelFormat;
4772  win32_func_SetPixelFormat *setPixelFormat;
4773  win32_func_DescribePixelFormat *describePixelFormat;
4774  win32_func_GetDeviceCaps *getDeviceCaps;
4775  win32_func_StretchDIBits *stretchDIBits;
4776  win32_func_DeleteObject *deleteObject;
4777  win32_func_SwapBuffers *swapBuffers;
4778  } gdi;
4779 
4780  struct {
4781  HMODULE shellLibrary;
4782  win32_func_CommandLineToArgvW *commandLineToArgvW;
4783  win32_func_SHGetFolderPathA *shGetFolderPathA;
4784  win32_func_SHGetFolderPathW *shGetFolderPathW;
4785  } shell;
4786 
4787  struct {
4788  HMODULE userLibrary;
4789  win32_func_RegisterClassExA *registerClassExA;
4790  win32_func_RegisterClassExW *registerClassExW;
4791  win32_func_UnregisterClassA *unregisterClassA;
4792  win32_func_UnregisterClassW *unregisterClassW;
4793  win32_func_ShowWindow *showWindow;
4794  win32_func_DestroyWindow *destroyWindow;
4795  win32_func_UpdateWindow *updateWindow;
4796  win32_func_TranslateMessage *translateMessage;
4797  win32_func_DispatchMessageA *dispatchMessageA;
4798  win32_func_DispatchMessageW *dispatchMessageW;
4799  win32_func_PeekMessageA *peekMessageA;
4800  win32_func_PeekMessageW *peekMessageW;
4801  win32_func_DefWindowProcA *defWindowProcA;
4802  win32_func_DefWindowProcW *defWindowProcW;
4803  win32_func_CreateWindowExA *createWindowExA;
4804  win32_func_CreateWindowExW *createWindowExW;
4805  win32_func_SetWindowPos *setWindowPos;
4806  win32_func_GetWindowPlacement *getWindowPlacement;
4807  win32_func_SetWindowPlacement *setWindowPlacement;
4808  win32_func_GetClientRect *getClientRect;
4809  win32_func_GetWindowRect *getWindowRect;
4810  win32_func_AdjustWindowRect *adjustWindowRect;
4811  win32_func_GetAsyncKeyState *getAsyncKeyState;
4812  win32_func_MapVirtualKeyA *mapVirtualKeyA;
4813  win32_func_MapVirtualKeyW *mapVirtualKeyW;
4814  win32_func_SetCursor *setCursor;
4815  win32_func_GetCursor *getCursor;
4816  win32_func_LoadCursorA *loadCursorA;
4817  win32_func_LoadCursorW *loadCursorW;
4818  win32_func_LoadIconA *loadIconA;
4819  win32_func_LoadIconW *loadIconW;
4820  win32_func_SetWindowTextA *setWindowTextA;
4821  win32_func_SetWindowTextW *setWindowTextW;
4822  win32_func_SetWindowLongA *setWindowLongA;
4823  win32_func_SetWindowLongW *setWindowLongW;
4824  win32_func_GetWindowLongA *getWindowLongA;
4825  win32_func_GetWindowLongW *getWindowLongW;
4826 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4827  win32_func_SetWindowLongPtrA *setWindowLongPtrA;
4828  win32_func_SetWindowLongPtrW *setWindowLongPtrW;
4829  win32_func_GetWindowLongPtrA *getWindowLongPtrA;
4830  win32_func_GetWindowLongPtrW *getWindowLongPtrW;
4831 # endif
4832  win32_func_ReleaseDC *releaseDC;
4833  win32_func_GetDC *getDC;
4834  win32_func_ChangeDisplaySettingsA *changeDisplaySettingsA;
4835  win32_func_ChangeDisplaySettingsW *changeDisplaySettingsW;
4836  win32_func_EnumDisplaySettingsA *enumDisplaySettingsA;
4837  win32_func_EnumDisplaySettingsW *enumDisplaySettingsW;
4838 
4839  win32_func_OpenClipboard *openClipboard;
4840  win32_func_CloseClipboard *closeClipboard;
4841  win32_func_EmptyClipboard *emptyClipboard;
4842  win32_func_IsClipboardFormatAvailable *isClipboardFormatAvailable;
4843  win32_func_SetClipboardData *setClipboardData;
4844  win32_func_GetClipboardData *getClipboardData;
4845 
4846  win32_func_GetDesktopWindow *getDesktopWindow;

4848  win32_func_IsZoomed *isZoomed;
4849  win32_func_SendMessageA *sendMessageA;
4850  win32_func_SendMessageW *sendMessageW;
4851  win32_func_GetMonitorInfoA *getMonitorInfoA;
4852  win32_func_GetMonitorInfoW *getMonitorInfoW;
4853  win32_func_MonitorFromRect *monitorFromRect;
4854  win32_func_MonitorFromWindow *monitorFromWindow;
4855  } user;
4856 
4857  struct {
4858  HMODULE oleLibrary;
4859  win32_func_CoInitializeEx *coInitializeEx;
4860  win32_func_CoUninitialize *coUninitialize;
4861  win32_func_CoCreateInstance *coCreateInstance;
4862  win32_func_CoTaskMemFree *coTaskMemFree;
4863  win32_func_PropVariantClear *propVariantClear;
4864  } ole;
4865  };
4866  fpl_globalvar Win32APIFunctions global__Win32__API__Functions = {};
4867 
4868  // Unicode dependent function calls and types
4869 # if !defined(UNICODE)
4870 # define FPL_WIN32_CLASSNAME "FPLWindowClassA"
4871 # define FPL_WIN32_UNNAMED_WINDOW "Unnamed FPL Ansi Window"
4872  typedef char win32_char;
4873 # define win32_copyString strings::CopyAnsiString
4874 # define win32_getStringLength strings::GetAnsiStringLength
4875 # define win32_ansiToString strings::CopyAnsiString
4876 # define win32_wndclassex WNDCLASSEXA
4877 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4878 # define win32_setWindowLongPtr global__Win32__API__Functions.user.setWindowLongPtrA
4879 # else
4880 # define win32_setWindowLongPtr global__Win32__API__Functions.user.setWindowLongA
4881 # endif
4882 # define win32_setWindowLong global__Win32__API__Functions.user.setWindowLongA
4883 # define win32_getWindowLong global__Win32__API__Functions.user.getWindowLongA
4884 # define win32_peekMessage global__Win32__API__Functions.user.peekMessageA
4885 # define win32_dispatchMessage global__Win32__API__Functions.user.dispatchMessageA
4886 # define win32_defWindowProc global__Win32__API__Functions.user.defWindowProcA
4887 # define win32_registerClassEx global__Win32__API__Functions.user.registerClassExA
4888 # define win32_unregisterClass global__Win32__API__Functions.user.unregisterClassA
4889 # define win32_createWindowEx global__Win32__API__Functions.user.createWindowExA
4890 # define win32_loadIcon global__Win32__API__Functions.user.loadIconA
4891 # define win32_loadCursor global__Win32__API__Functions.user.loadCursorA
4892 # define win32_sendMessage global__Win32__API__Functions.user.sendMessageA
4893 # define win32_getMonitorInfo global__Win32__API__Functions.user.getMonitorInfoA
4894 # else
4895 # define FPL_WIN32_CLASSNAME L"FPLWindowClassW"
4896 # define FPL_WIN32_UNNAMED_WINDOW L"Unnamed FPL Unicode Window"
4897  typedef wchar_t win32_char;
4898 # define win32_copyString strings::CopyWideString
4899 # define win32_getStringLength strings::GetWideStringLength
4900 # define win32_ansiToString strings::AnsiStringToWideString
4901 # define win32_wndclassex WNDCLASSEXW
4902 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4903 # define win32_setWindowLongPtr global__Win32__API__Functions.user.setWindowLongPtrW
4904 # else
4905 # define win32_setWindowLongPtr global__Win32__API__Functions.user.setWindowLongW
4906 # endif
4907 # define win32_setWindowLong global__Win32__API__Functions.user.setWindowLongW
4908 # define win32_getWindowLong global__Win32__API__Functions.user.getWindowLongW
4909 # define win32_peekMessage global__Win32__API__Functions.user.peekMessageW
4910 # define win32_dispatchMessage global__Win32__API__Functions.user.dispatchMessageW
4911 # define win32_defWindowProc global__Win32__API__Functions.user.defWindowProcW
4912 # define win32_registerClassEx global__Win32__API__Functions.user.registerClassExW
4913 # define win32_unregisterClass global__Win32__API__Functions.user.unregisterClassW
4914 # define win32_createWindowEx global__Win32__API__Functions.user.createWindowExW
4915 # define win32_loadIcon global__Win32__API__Functions.user.loadIconW
4916 # define win32_loadCursor global__Win32__API__Functions.user.loadCursorW
4917 # define win32_sendMessage global__Win32__API__Functions.user.sendMessageW
4918 # define win32_getMonitorInfo global__Win32__API__Functions.user.getMonitorInfoW
4919 # endif // UNICODE

4921 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)

4928  bool wasResolutionChanged;

4949  struct Win32VideoState {
4950  VideoDriverType activeVideoDriver;
4951  union {
4952 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
4953  struct {
4954  HGLRC renderingContext;
4955  } opengl;
4956 # endif
4957 
4958 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
4959  struct {
4960  video::VideoBackBuffer context;
4961  BITMAPINFO bitmapInfo;

4964  };

4970  LARGE_INTEGER performanceFrequency;

4972  fpl_globalvar Win32ApplicationState global__Win32__AppState = {};
4973 
4974  struct Win32State {
4975  Settings initSettings;
4976  Settings currentSettings;
4977  Win32WindowState window;
4978  Win32VideoState video;
4979  Win32XInputState xinput;
4980  InitFlags initFlags;
4981  };
4982  fpl_globalvar Win32State *global__Win32__State = nullptr;
4983 
4984 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
4985  fpl_internal bool Win32InitVideoOpenGL(platform::Win32State *state, const VideoSettings &videoSettings) {
4986  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
4987  platform::Win32OpenGLFunctions &glFuncs = platform::global__Win32__OpenGL_Functions;
4988 
4989  //
4990  // Load OpenGL Library
4991  //
4992  {
4993  const char *openglLibraryName = "opengl32.dll";
4994  glFuncs.openglLibrary = LoadLibraryA("opengl32.dll");
4995  if (glFuncs.openglLibrary == nullptr) {
4996  common::PushError("Failed loading opengl library '%s'", openglLibraryName);
4997  return false;
4998  }
4999 
5000  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress, platform::win32_func_wglGetProcAddress, "wglGetProcAddress");
5001  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglCreateContext, platform::win32_func_wglCreateContext, "wglCreateContext");
5002  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglDeleteContext, platform::win32_func_wglDeleteContext, "wglDeleteContext");
5003  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent, platform::win32_func_wglMakeCurrent, "wglMakeCurrent");
5004  }
5005 
5006  //
5007  // Prepare window for Opengl
5008  //
5009  HDC deviceContext = state->window.deviceContext;
5010  HWND handle = state->window.windowHandle;
5011 
5012  PIXELFORMATDESCRIPTOR pfd = {};
5013  pfd.nSize = sizeof(pfd);
5014  pfd.nVersion = 1;
5015  pfd.dwFlags = PFD_DOUBLEBUFFER | PFD_SUPPORT_OPENGL | PFD_DRAW_TO_WINDOW;
5016  pfd.iPixelType = PFD_TYPE_RGBA;
5017  pfd.cColorBits = 32;
5018  pfd.cDepthBits = 24;
5019  pfd.cAlphaBits = 8;
5020  pfd.iLayerType = PFD_MAIN_PLANE;
5021 
5022  int pixelFormat = wapi.gdi.choosePixelFormat(deviceContext, &pfd);
5023  if (!pixelFormat) {
5024  common::PushError("Failed choosing RGBA Legacy Pixelformat for Color/Depth/Alpha (%d,%d,%d) and DC '%x'", pfd.cColorBits, pfd.cDepthBits, pfd.cAlphaBits, deviceContext);
5025  return false;
5026  }
5027 
5028  if (!wapi.gdi.setPixelFormat(deviceContext, pixelFormat, &pfd)) {
5029  common::PushError("Failed setting RGBA Pixelformat '%d' for Color/Depth/Alpha (%d,%d,%d and DC '%x')", pixelFormat, pfd.cColorBits, pfd.cDepthBits, pfd.cAlphaBits, deviceContext);
5030  return false;
5031  }
5032 
5033  wapi.gdi.describePixelFormat(deviceContext, pixelFormat, sizeof(pfd), &pfd);
5034 
5035  //
5036  // Create opengl rendering context
5037  //
5038  HGLRC legacyRenderingContext = glFuncs.wglCreateContext(deviceContext);
5039  if (!legacyRenderingContext) {
5040  common::PushError("Failed creating Legacy OpenGL Rendering Context for DC '%x')", deviceContext);
5041  return false;
5042  }
5043 
5044  if (!glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext)) {
5045  common::PushError("Failed activating Legacy OpenGL Rendering Context for DC '%x' and RC '%x')", deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
5046  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(legacyRenderingContext);
5047  return false;
5048  }
5049 
5050  // Load WGL Extensions
5051  glFuncs.wglSwapIntervalExt = (platform::win32_func_wglSwapIntervalEXT *)glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress("wglSwapIntervalEXT");
5052  glFuncs.wglChoosePixelFormatArb = (platform::win32_func_wglChoosePixelFormatARB *)glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress("wglChoosePixelFormatARB");
5053  glFuncs.wglCreateContextAttribsArb = (platform::win32_func_wglCreateContextAttribsARB *)glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress("wglCreateContextAttribsARB");
5054 
5055  // Disable legacy context
5056  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(nullptr, nullptr);
5057 
5058  HGLRC activeRenderingContext;
5059  if (videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags != OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Legacy) {
5060  // @NOTE(final): This is only available in OpenGL 3.0+
5061  if (!(videoSettings.opengl.majorVersion >= 3 && videoSettings.opengl.minorVersion >= 0)) {
5062  common::PushError("You have not specified the 'majorVersion' and 'minorVersion' in the VideoSettings");
5063  return false;
5064  }
5065 
5066  if (glFuncs.wglChoosePixelFormatArb == nullptr) {
5067  common::PushError("wglChoosePixelFormatARB is not available, modern OpenGL is not available for your video card");
5068  return false;
5069  }
5070  if (glFuncs.wglCreateContextAttribsArb == nullptr) {
5071  common::PushError("wglCreateContextAttribsARB is not available, modern OpenGL is not available for your video card");
5072  return false;
5073  }
5074 
5075  int profile = 0;
5076  int flags = 0;
5077  if (videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags & OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Core) {
5078  profile = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_CORE_PROFILE_BIT_ARB;
5079  } else if (videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags & OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Compability) {
5080  profile = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_COMPATIBILITY_PROFILE_BIT_ARB;
5081  } else {
5082  common::PushError("No opengl compability profile selected, please specific Core OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Core or OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Compability");
5083  return false;
5084  }
5085  if (videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags & OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Forward) {
5086  flags = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_FORWARD_COMPATIBLE_BIT_ARB;
5087  }
5088 
5089  int contextAttribIndex = 0;
5090  int contextAttribList[20 + 1] = {};
5091  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_MAJOR_VERSION_ARB;
5092  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = (int)videoSettings.opengl.majorVersion;
5093  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_MINOR_VERSION_ARB;
5094  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = (int)videoSettings.opengl.minorVersion;
5095  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_MASK_ARB;
5096  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = profile;
5097  if (flags > 0) {
5098  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_FLAGS_ARB;
5099  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = flags;
5100  }
5101 
5102  // Create modern opengl rendering context
5103  HGLRC modernRenderingContext = glFuncs.wglCreateContextAttribsArb(deviceContext, 0, contextAttribList);
5104  if (modernRenderingContext) {
5105  if (!glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, modernRenderingContext)) {
5106  common::PushError("Warning: Failed activating Modern OpenGL Rendering Context for version (%d.%d) and compability flags (%d) and DC '%x') -> Fallback to legacy context", videoSettings.opengl.majorVersion, videoSettings.opengl.minorVersion, videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags, deviceContext);
5107 
5108  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(modernRenderingContext);
5109  modernRenderingContext = nullptr;
5110 
5111  // Fallback to legacy context
5112  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
5113  activeRenderingContext = legacyRenderingContext;
5114  } else {
5115  // Destroy legacy rendering context
5116  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(legacyRenderingContext);
5117  legacyRenderingContext = nullptr;
5118  activeRenderingContext = modernRenderingContext;
5119  }
5120  } else {
5121  common::PushError("Warning: Failed creating Modern OpenGL Rendering Context for version (%d.%d) and compability flags (%d) and DC '%x') -> Fallback to legacy context", videoSettings.opengl.majorVersion, videoSettings.opengl.minorVersion, videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags, deviceContext);
5122 
5123  // Fallback to legacy context
5124  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
5125  activeRenderingContext = legacyRenderingContext;
5126  }
5127  } else {
5128  // Caller wants legacy context
5129  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
5130  activeRenderingContext = legacyRenderingContext;
5131  }
5132 
5133  FPL_ASSERT(activeRenderingContext != nullptr);
5134 
5135  state->video.opengl.renderingContext = activeRenderingContext;
5136 
5137  // Set vertical syncronisation if available
5138  if (glFuncs.wglSwapIntervalExt != nullptr) {
5139  int swapInterval = videoSettings.isVSync ? 1 : 0;
5140  glFuncs.wglSwapIntervalExt(swapInterval);
5141  }
5142 
5143  return true;
5144  }
5145 
5146  fpl_internal void Win32ReleaseVideoOpenGL(platform::Win32State *state) {
5147  platform::Win32OpenGLFunctions &glFuncs = platform::global__Win32__OpenGL_Functions;
5148  if (state->video.opengl.renderingContext) {
5149  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(nullptr, nullptr);
5150  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(state->video.opengl.renderingContext);
5151  state->video.opengl.renderingContext = nullptr;
5152  }
5153  if (glFuncs.openglLibrary != nullptr) {
5154  FreeLibrary(glFuncs.openglLibrary);
5155  glFuncs = {};
5156  }
5157  }
5158 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
5159 
5160 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
5161  fpl_internal bool Win32InitVideoSoftware(platform::Win32State *state, const uint32_t width, const uint32_t height) {
5162  platform::Win32VideoState &videoState = state->video;
5163 
5164  // Allocate memory/fill context
5165  videoState.software = {};
5166  videoState.software.context.width = width;
5167  videoState.software.context.height = height;
5168  videoState.software.context.stride = videoState.software.context.width * sizeof(uint32_t);
5169  size_t size = videoState.software.context.stride * videoState.software.context.height;
5170  videoState.software.context.pixels = (uint32_t *)memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(size, 16);
5171 
5172  // Clear to black by default
5173  // @NOTE(final): Bitmap is top-down, 0xAABBGGRR
5174  uint32_t *p = videoState.software.context.pixels;
5175  for (uint32_t y = 0; y < videoState.software.context.height; ++y) {
5176  uint32_t color = 0xFF000000;
5177  for (uint32_t x = 0; x < videoState.software.context.width; ++x) {
5178  *p++ = color;
5179  }
5180  }
5181 
5182  // Create DIB section from bitmapinfo
5183  videoState.software.bitmapInfo = {};
5184  videoState.software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biSize = sizeof(BITMAPINFOHEADER);
5185  videoState.software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biWidth = (LONG)videoState.software.context.width;
5186  videoState.software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biHeight = (LONG)videoState.software.context.height;
5187  videoState.software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biBitCount = 32;
5188  videoState.software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biCompression = BI_RGB;
5189  videoState.software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biPlanes = 1;
5190  videoState.software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biSizeImage = (DWORD)size;
5191 
5192  return true;
5193  }
5194 
5195  fpl_internal void Win32ReleaseVideoSoftware(platform::Win32State *state) {
5196  platform::Win32VideoState &videoState = state->video;
5197  FPL_ASSERT(videoState.software.context.pixels != nullptr);
5198  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(videoState.software.context.pixels);
5199  videoState.software = {};
5200  }
5201 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
5202 
5203 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
5204  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_EVENT_COUNT = 32768;
5205  struct EventQueue {
5206  window::Event events[MAX_EVENT_COUNT];
5207  volatile uint32_t pollIndex;
5208  volatile uint32_t pushCount;
5209  };
5210  fpl_globalvar EventQueue *global__EventQueue = nullptr;
5211 
5212  fpl_internal_inline void PushEvent(const window::Event &event) {
5213  EventQueue *eventQueue = global__EventQueue;
5214  FPL_ASSERT(eventQueue != nullptr);
5215  if (eventQueue->pushCount < MAX_EVENT_COUNT) {
5216  uint32_t eventIndex = atomics::AtomicAddU32(&eventQueue->pushCount, 1);
5217  FPL_ASSERT(eventIndex < MAX_EVENT_COUNT);
5218  eventQueue->events[eventIndex] = event;
5219  }
5220  }
5221 
5222  struct Win32WindowStyle {
5223  DWORD style;
5224  DWORD exStyle;
5225  };
5226 
5227  fpl_constant DWORD Win32ResizeableWindowStyle = WS_THICKFRAME | WS_SYSMENU | WS_MINIMIZEBOX | WS_MAXIMIZEBOX | WS_VISIBLE;
5228  fpl_constant DWORD Win32ResizeableWindowExtendedStyle = WS_EX_LEFT;
5229 
5230  fpl_constant DWORD Win32NonResizableWindowStyle = WS_CAPTION | WS_SYSMENU | WS_MINIMIZEBOX | WS_VISIBLE;
5231  fpl_constant DWORD Win32NonResizableWindowExtendedStyle = WS_EX_LEFT;
5232 
5233  fpl_constant DWORD Win32FullscreenWindowStyle = WS_POPUP | WS_VISIBLE;
5234  fpl_constant DWORD Win32FullscreenWindowExtendedStyle = WS_EX_APPWINDOW | WS_EX_TOPMOST;
5235 
5236  fpl_internal bool Win32LeaveFullscreen() {
5237  // @TODO(final): The old window rect may be wrong when the display was changed (Turn off, Orientation, Grid Position, Screen res).
5238 
5239  FPL_ASSERT(global__Win32__State != nullptr);
5240  Win32State *state = global__Win32__State;
5241  Win32APIFunctions &wapi = global__Win32__API__Functions;
5242  WindowSettings &settings = state->currentSettings.window;
5243  Win32LastWindowInfo *fullscreenInfo = &global__Win32__State->window.lastFullscreenInfo;
5244 
5245  HWND windowHandle = state->window.windowHandle;
5246 
5247  FPL_ASSERT(fullscreenInfo->style > 0 && fullscreenInfo->exStyle > 0);
5248  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_STYLE, fullscreenInfo->style);
5249  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_EXSTYLE, fullscreenInfo->exStyle);
5250  wapi.user.setWindowPlacement(windowHandle, &fullscreenInfo->placement);
5251  wapi.user.setWindowPos(windowHandle, nullptr, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE | SWP_FRAMECHANGED);
5252  //wapi.user.setWindowPos(windowHandle, nullptr, fullscreenInfo->rect.left, fullscreenInfo->rect.top, (fullscreenInfo->rect.right - fullscreenInfo->rect.left) + 1, (fullscreenInfo->rect.bottom - fullscreenInfo->rect.top) + 1, SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE | SWP_FRAMECHANGED);
5253 
5254  if (fullscreenInfo->isMaximized) {
5255  win32_sendMessage(windowHandle, WM_SYSCOMMAND, SC_MAXIMIZE, 0);
5256  }
5257 
5258  bool result;
5259  if (fullscreenInfo->wasResolutionChanged) {
5260  result = (wapi.user.changeDisplaySettingsA(nullptr, CDS_RESET) == DISP_CHANGE_SUCCESSFUL);
5261  } else {
5262  result = true;
5263  }
5264 
5265  return(result);
5266  }
5267 
5268  fpl_internal bool Win32EnterFullscreen(const uint32_t fullscreenWidth, const uint32_t fullscreenHeight, const uint32_t refreshRate, const uint32_t colorBits) {
5269  FPL_ASSERT(global__Win32__State != nullptr);
5270  WindowSettings &settings = global__Win32__State->currentSettings.window;
5271 
5272  HWND windowHandle = global__Win32__State->window.windowHandle;
5273  HDC deviceContext = global__Win32__State->window.deviceContext;
5274  Win32APIFunctions &wapi = global__Win32__API__Functions;
5275  Win32LastWindowInfo *fullscreenInfo = &global__Win32__State->window.lastFullscreenInfo;
5276 
5277  FPL_ASSERT(fullscreenInfo->style > 0 && fullscreenInfo->exStyle > 0);
5278  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_STYLE, fullscreenInfo->style & ~(WS_CAPTION | WS_THICKFRAME));
5279  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_EXSTYLE, fullscreenInfo->exStyle & ~(WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME | WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE | WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE | WS_EX_STATICEDGE));
5280 
5281  MONITORINFO monitor = {};
5282  monitor.cbSize = sizeof(monitor);
5283  win32_getMonitorInfo(wapi.user.monitorFromWindow(windowHandle, MONITOR_DEFAULTTONEAREST), &monitor);
5284 
5285  bool result;
5286  if (fullscreenWidth > 0 && fullscreenHeight > 0) {
5287  DWORD useFullscreenWidth = fullscreenWidth;
5288  DWORD useFullscreenHeight = fullscreenHeight;
5289 
5290  DWORD useRefreshRate = refreshRate;
5291  if (!useRefreshRate) {
5292  useRefreshRate = wapi.gdi.getDeviceCaps(deviceContext, VREFRESH);
5293  }
5294 
5295  DWORD useColourBits = colorBits;
5296  if (!useColourBits) {
5297  useColourBits = wapi.gdi.getDeviceCaps(deviceContext, BITSPIXEL);
5298  }
5299 
5300  // @TODO(final): Is this correct to assume the fullscreen rect is at (0, 0, w - 1, h - 1)?
5301  RECT windowRect;
5302  windowRect.left = 0;
5303  windowRect.top = 0;
5304  windowRect.right = windowRect.left + (useFullscreenWidth - 1);
5305  windowRect.bottom = windowRect.left + (useFullscreenHeight - 1);
5306 
5307  WINDOWPLACEMENT placement = {};
5308  placement.length = sizeof(placement);
5309  placement.rcNormalPosition = windowRect;
5310  placement.showCmd = SW_SHOW;
5311  wapi.user.setWindowPlacement(windowHandle, &placement);
5312  wapi.user.setWindowPos(windowHandle, nullptr, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE | SWP_FRAMECHANGED);
5313 
5314  DEVMODEA fullscreenSettings = {};
5315  wapi.user.enumDisplaySettingsA(nullptr, 0, &fullscreenSettings);
5316  fullscreenSettings.dmPelsWidth = useFullscreenWidth;
5317  fullscreenSettings.dmPelsHeight = useFullscreenHeight;
5318  fullscreenSettings.dmBitsPerPel = useColourBits;
5319  fullscreenSettings.dmDisplayFrequency = useRefreshRate;
5320  fullscreenSettings.dmFields = DM_PELSWIDTH | DM_PELSHEIGHT | DM_BITSPERPEL | DM_DISPLAYFREQUENCY;
5321  result = (wapi.user.changeDisplaySettingsA(&fullscreenSettings, CDS_FULLSCREEN) == DISP_CHANGE_SUCCESSFUL);
5322  fullscreenInfo->wasResolutionChanged = true;
5323  } else {
5324  RECT windowRect = monitor.rcMonitor;
5325 
5326  WINDOWPLACEMENT placement = {};
5327  placement.length = sizeof(placement);
5328  placement.rcNormalPosition = windowRect;
5329  placement.showCmd = SW_SHOW;
5330  wapi.user.setWindowPlacement(windowHandle, &placement);
5331  wapi.user.setWindowPos(windowHandle, nullptr, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE | SWP_FRAMECHANGED);
5332 
5333  result = true;
5334  fullscreenInfo->wasResolutionChanged = false;
5335  }
5336 
5337  return(result);
5338  }
5339 
5340  fpl_internal_inline float Win32XInputProcessStickValue(SHORT value, SHORT deadZoneThreshold) {
5341  float result = 0;
5342  if (value < -deadZoneThreshold) {
5343  result = (float)((value + deadZoneThreshold) / (32768.0f - deadZoneThreshold));
5344  } else if (value > deadZoneThreshold) {
5345  result = (float)((value - deadZoneThreshold) / (32767.0f - deadZoneThreshold));
5346  }
5347  return(result);
5348  }
5349 
5350  fpl_internal void Win32PollControllers(Win32State *win32State) {
5351  using namespace window;
5352  Win32InputFunctions &inputFuncs = global__Win32__Input__Functions;
5353  if (inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetState != nullptr) {
5354  //
5355  // Detect new controller (Only in a fixed frequency)
5356  //
5357  if (win32State->xinput.lastDeviceSearchTime.QuadPart == 0) {
5358  QueryPerformanceCounter(&win32State->xinput.lastDeviceSearchTime);
5359  }
5360  LARGE_INTEGER currentDeviceSearchTime;
5361  QueryPerformanceCounter(&currentDeviceSearchTime);
5362  uint64_t deviceSearchDifferenceTimeInMs = ((currentDeviceSearchTime.QuadPart - win32State->xinput.lastDeviceSearchTime.QuadPart) / (global__Win32__AppState.performanceFrequency.QuadPart / 1000));
5363  if ((win32State->currentSettings.input.controllerDetectionFrequency == 0) || (deviceSearchDifferenceTimeInMs > win32State->currentSettings.input.controllerDetectionFrequency)) {
5364  win32State->xinput.lastDeviceSearchTime = currentDeviceSearchTime;
5365  for (DWORD controllerIndex = 0; controllerIndex < XUSER_MAX_COUNT; ++controllerIndex) {
5366  XINPUT_STATE controllerState = {};
5367  if (inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetState(controllerIndex, &controllerState) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
5368  if (!win32State->xinput.isConnected[controllerIndex]) {
5369  // Connected
5370  win32State->xinput.isConnected[controllerIndex] = true;
5371  Event ev = {};
5372  ev.type = EventType::Gamepad;
5373  ev.gamepad.type = GamepadEventType::Connected;
5374  ev.gamepad.deviceIndex = controllerIndex;
5375  PushEvent(ev);
5376  }
5377  } else {
5378  if (win32State->xinput.isConnected[controllerIndex]) {
5379  // Disonnected
5380  win32State->xinput.isConnected[controllerIndex] = false;
5381  Event ev = {};
5382  ev.type = EventType::Gamepad;
5383  ev.gamepad.type = GamepadEventType::Disconnected;
5384  ev.gamepad.deviceIndex = controllerIndex;
5385  PushEvent(ev);
5386  }
5387  }
5388  }
5389  }
5390 
5391  //
5392  // Update controller state when connected only
5393  //
