5394  for (DWORD controllerIndex = 0; controllerIndex < XUSER_MAX_COUNT; ++controllerIndex) {
5395  if (win32State->xinput.isConnected[controllerIndex]) {
5396  XINPUT_STATE controllerState = {};
5397  if (inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetState(controllerIndex, &controllerState) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
5398  // State changed
5399  Event ev = {};
5400  ev.type = EventType::Gamepad;
5401  ev.gamepad.type = GamepadEventType::StateChanged;
5402  ev.gamepad.deviceIndex = controllerIndex;
5403 
5404  XINPUT_GAMEPAD *pad = &controllerState.Gamepad;
5405 
5406  // Analog sticks
5407  ev.gamepad.state.leftStickX = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbLX, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_LEFT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
5408  ev.gamepad.state.leftStickY = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbLY, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_LEFT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
5409  ev.gamepad.state.rightStickX = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbRX, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_RIGHT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
5410  ev.gamepad.state.rightStickY = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbRY, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_RIGHT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
5411 
5412  // Triggers
5413  ev.gamepad.state.leftTrigger = (float)pad->bLeftTrigger / 255.0f;
5414  ev.gamepad.state.rightTrigger = (float)pad->bRightTrigger / 255.0f;
5415 
5416  // Digital pad buttons
5417  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_UP)
5418  ev.gamepad.state.dpadUp = { true };
5419  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_DOWN)
5420  ev.gamepad.state.dpadDown = { true };
5421  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_LEFT)
5422  ev.gamepad.state.dpadLeft = { true };
5423  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_RIGHT)
5424  ev.gamepad.state.dpadRight = { true };
5425 
5426  // Action buttons
5427  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_A)
5428  ev.gamepad.state.actionA = { true };
5429  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_B)
5430  ev.gamepad.state.actionB = { true };
5431  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_X)
5432  ev.gamepad.state.actionX = { true };
5433  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_Y)
5434  ev.gamepad.state.actionY = { true };
5435 
5436  // Center buttons
5437  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_START)
5438  ev.gamepad.state.start = { true };
5439  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_BACK)
5440  ev.gamepad.state.back = { true };
5441 
5442  // Shoulder buttons
5443  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_LEFT_SHOULDER)
5444  ev.gamepad.state.leftShoulder = { true };
5445  if (pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_RIGHT_SHOULDER)
5446  ev.gamepad.state.rightShoulder = { true };
5447 
5448  PushEvent(ev);
5449  }
5450  }
5451  }
5452  }
5453  }
5454 
5455  fpl_internal_inline void Win32PushMouseEvent(const window::MouseEventType &mouseEventType, const window::MouseButtonType mouseButton, const LPARAM lParam, const WPARAM wParam) {
5456  using namespace window;
5457  Event newEvent = {};
5458  newEvent.type = EventType::Mouse;
5459  newEvent.mouse.type = mouseEventType;
5460  newEvent.mouse.mouseX = GET_X_LPARAM(lParam);
5461  newEvent.mouse.mouseY = GET_Y_LPARAM(lParam);
5462  newEvent.mouse.mouseButton = mouseButton;
5463  if (mouseEventType == MouseEventType::Wheel) {
5464  short zDelta = GET_WHEEL_DELTA_WPARAM(wParam);
5465  newEvent.mouse.wheelDelta = (zDelta / (float)WHEEL_DELTA);
5466  }
5467  PushEvent(newEvent);
5468  }
5469 
5470  fpl_internal window::Key Win32MapVirtualKey(const uint64_t keyCode) {
5471  using namespace window;
5472  switch (keyCode) {
5473  case VK_BACK:
5474  return Key::Key_Backspace;
5475  case VK_TAB:
5476  return Key::Key_Tab;
5477 
5478  case VK_CLEAR:
5479  return Key::Key_Clear;
5480  case VK_RETURN:
5481  return Key::Key_Enter;
5482 
5483  case VK_SHIFT:
5484  return Key::Key_Shift;
5485  case VK_CONTROL:
5486  return Key::Key_Control;
5487  case VK_MENU:
5488  return Key::Key_Alt;
5489  case VK_PAUSE:
5490  return Key::Key_Pause;
5491  case VK_CAPITAL:
5492  return Key::Key_CapsLock;
5493 
5494  case VK_ESCAPE:
5495  return Key::Key_Escape;
5496  case VK_SPACE:
5497  return Key::Key_Space;
5498  case VK_PRIOR:
5499  return Key::Key_PageUp;
5500  case VK_NEXT:
5501  return Key::Key_PageDown;
5502  case VK_END:
5503  return Key::Key_End;
5504  case VK_HOME:
5505  return Key::Key_Home;
5506  case VK_LEFT:
5507  return Key::Key_Left;
5508  case VK_UP:
5509  return Key::Key_Up;
5510  case VK_RIGHT:
5511  return Key::Key_Right;
5512  case VK_DOWN:
5513  return Key::Key_Down;
5514  case VK_SELECT:
5515  return Key::Key_Select;
5516  case VK_PRINT:
5517  return Key::Key_Print;
5518  case VK_EXECUTE:
5519  return Key::Key_Execute;
5520  case VK_SNAPSHOT:
5521  return Key::Key_Snapshot;
5522  case VK_INSERT:
5523  return Key::Key_Insert;
5524  case VK_DELETE:
5525  return Key::Key_Delete;
5526  case VK_HELP:
5527  return Key::Key_Help;
5528 
5529  case 0x30:
5530  return Key::Key_0;
5531  case 0x31:
5532  return Key::Key_1;
5533  case 0x32:
5534  return Key::Key_2;
5535  case 0x33:
5536  return Key::Key_3;
5537  case 0x34:
5538  return Key::Key_4;
5539  case 0x35:
5540  return Key::Key_5;
5541  case 0x36:
5542  return Key::Key_6;
5543  case 0x37:
5544  return Key::Key_7;
5545  case 0x38:
5546  return Key::Key_8;
5547  case 0x39:
5548  return Key::Key_9;
5549 
5550  case 0x41:
5551  return Key::Key_A;
5552  case 0x42:
5553  return Key::Key_B;
5554  case 0x43:
5555  return Key::Key_C;
5556  case 0x44:
5557  return Key::Key_D;
5558  case 0x45:
5559  return Key::Key_E;
5560  case 0x46:
5561  return Key::Key_F;
5562  case 0x47:
5563  return Key::Key_G;
5564  case 0x48:
5565  return Key::Key_H;
5566  case 0x49:
5567  return Key::Key_I;
5568  case 0x4A:
5569  return Key::Key_J;
5570  case 0x4B:
5571  return Key::Key_K;
5572  case 0x4C:
5573  return Key::Key_L;
5574  case 0x4D:
5575  return Key::Key_M;
5576  case 0x4E:
5577  return Key::Key_N;
5578  case 0x4F:
5579  return Key::Key_O;
5580  case 0x50:
5581  return Key::Key_P;
5582  case 0x51:
5583  return Key::Key_Q;
5584  case 0x52:
5585  return Key::Key_R;
5586  case 0x53:
5587  return Key::Key_S;
5588  case 0x54:
5589  return Key::Key_T;
5590  case 0x55:
5591  return Key::Key_U;
5592  case 0x56:
5593  return Key::Key_V;
5594  case 0x57:
5595  return Key::Key_W;
5596  case 0x58:
5597  return Key::Key_X;
5598  case 0x59:
5599  return Key::Key_Y;
5600  case 0x5A:
5601  return Key::Key_Z;
5602 
5603  case VK_LWIN:
5604  return Key::Key_LeftWin;
5605  case VK_RWIN:
5606  return Key::Key_RightWin;
5607  case VK_APPS:
5608  return Key::Key_Apps;
5609 
5610  case VK_SLEEP:
5611  return Key::Key_Sleep;
5612  case VK_NUMPAD0:
5613  return Key::Key_NumPad0;
5614  case VK_NUMPAD1:
5615  return Key::Key_NumPad1;
5616  case VK_NUMPAD2:
5617  return Key::Key_NumPad2;
5618  case VK_NUMPAD3:
5619  return Key::Key_NumPad3;
5620  case VK_NUMPAD4:
5621  return Key::Key_NumPad4;
5622  case VK_NUMPAD5:
5623  return Key::Key_NumPad5;
5624  case VK_NUMPAD6:
5625  return Key::Key_NumPad6;
5626  case VK_NUMPAD7:
5627  return Key::Key_NumPad7;
5628  case VK_NUMPAD8:
5629  return Key::Key_NumPad8;
5630  case VK_NUMPAD9:
5631  return Key::Key_NumPad9;
5632  case VK_MULTIPLY:
5633  return Key::Key_Multiply;
5634  case VK_ADD:
5635  return Key::Key_Add;
5636  case VK_SEPARATOR:
5637  return Key::Key_Separator;
5638  case VK_SUBTRACT:
5639  return Key::Key_Substract;
5640  case VK_DECIMAL:
5641  return Key::Key_Decimal;
5642  case VK_DIVIDE:
5643  return Key::Key_Divide;
5644  case VK_F1:
5645  return Key::Key_F1;
5646  case VK_F2:
5647  return Key::Key_F2;
5648  case VK_F3:
5649  return Key::Key_F3;
5650  case VK_F4:
5651  return Key::Key_F4;
5652  case VK_F5:
5653  return Key::Key_F5;
5654  case VK_F6:
5655  return Key::Key_F6;
5656  case VK_F7:
5657  return Key::Key_F7;
5658  case VK_F8:
5659  return Key::Key_F8;
5660  case VK_F9:
5661  return Key::Key_F9;
5662  case VK_F10:
5663  return Key::Key_F10;
5664  case VK_F11:
5665  return Key::Key_F11;
5666  case VK_F12:
5667  return Key::Key_F12;
5668  case VK_F13:
5669  return Key::Key_F13;
5670  case VK_F14:
5671  return Key::Key_F14;
5672  case VK_F15:
5673  return Key::Key_F15;
5674  case VK_F16:
5675  return Key::Key_F16;
5676  case VK_F17:
5677  return Key::Key_F17;
5678  case VK_F18:
5679  return Key::Key_F18;
5680  case VK_F19:
5681  return Key::Key_F19;
5682  case VK_F20:
5683  return Key::Key_F20;
5684  case VK_F21:
5685  return Key::Key_F21;
5686  case VK_F22:
5687  return Key::Key_F22;
5688  case VK_F23:
5689  return Key::Key_F23;
5690  case VK_F24:
5691  return Key::Key_F24;
5692 
5693  case VK_LSHIFT:
5694  return Key::Key_LeftShift;
5695  case VK_RSHIFT:
5696  return Key::Key_RightShift;
5697  case VK_LCONTROL:
5698  return Key::Key_LeftControl;
5699  case VK_RCONTROL:
5700  return Key::Key_RightControl;
5701  case VK_LMENU:
5702  return Key::Key_LeftAlt;
5703  case VK_RMENU:
5704  return Key::Key_RightAlt;
5705 
5706  default:
5707  return Key::Key_None;
5708  }
5709  }
5710 
5711  fpl_internal_inline void Win32PushKeyboardEvent(const window::KeyboardEventType keyboardEventType, const uint64_t keyCode, const window::KeyboardModifierFlags modifiers, const bool isDown) {
5712  using namespace window;
5713  Event newEvent = {};
5714  newEvent.type = EventType::Keyboard;
5715  newEvent.keyboard.keyCode = keyCode;
5716  newEvent.keyboard.mappedKey = Win32MapVirtualKey(keyCode);
5717  newEvent.keyboard.type = keyboardEventType;
5718  newEvent.keyboard.modifiers = modifiers;
5719  PushEvent(newEvent);
5720  }
5721 
5722  fpl_internal_inline bool Win32IsKeyDown(const uint64_t keyCode) {
5723  Win32APIFunctions &api = global__Win32__API__Functions;
5724  bool result = (api.user.getAsyncKeyState((int)keyCode) & 0x8000) > 0;
5725  return(result);
5726  }
5727 
5728  LRESULT CALLBACK Win32MessageProc(HWND hwnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam) {
5729  using namespace window;
5730 
5731  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
5732  platform::Win32State *win32State = platform::global__Win32__State;
5733  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
5734 
5735  if (!win32State->window.windowHandle) {
5736  return win32_defWindowProc(hwnd, msg, wParam, lParam);
5737  }
5738 
5739  LRESULT result = 0;
5740  switch (msg) {
5741  case WM_DESTROY:
5742  case WM_CLOSE:
5743  {
5744  win32State->window.isRunning = false;
5745  } break;
5746 
5747  case WM_SIZE:
5748  {
5749 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
5750  if (win32State->video.activeVideoDriver == VideoDriverType::Software) {
5751  if (win32State->initSettings.video.isAutoSize) {
5752  uint32_t w = LOWORD(lParam);
5753  uint32_t h = HIWORD(lParam);
5754  if ((w != win32State->video.software.context.width) ||
5755  (h != win32State->video.software.context.height)) {
5756  platform::Win32ReleaseVideoSoftware(win32State);
5757  platform::Win32InitVideoSoftware(win32State, w, h);
5758  }
5759  }
5760  }
5761 # endif
5762 
5763  Event newEvent = {};
5764  newEvent.type = EventType::Window;
5765  newEvent.window.type = WindowEventType::Resized;
5766  newEvent.window.width = LOWORD(lParam);
5767  newEvent.window.height = HIWORD(lParam);
5768  platform::PushEvent(newEvent);
5769  } break;
5770 
5771  case WM_SYSKEYDOWN:
5772  case WM_SYSKEYUP:
5773  case WM_KEYDOWN:
5774  case WM_KEYUP:
5775  {
5776  uint64_t keyCode = wParam;
5777  bool wasDown = ((lParam & (1 << 30)) != 0);
5778  bool isDown = ((lParam & (1 << 31)) == 0);
5779 
5780  bool altKeyWasDown = platform::Win32IsKeyDown(VK_MENU);
5781  bool shiftKeyWasDown = platform::Win32IsKeyDown(VK_LSHIFT);
5782  bool ctrlKeyWasDown = platform::Win32IsKeyDown(VK_LCONTROL);
5783  bool superKeyWasDown = platform::Win32IsKeyDown(VK_LMENU);
5784 
5785  KeyboardEventType keyEventType = isDown ? KeyboardEventType::KeyDown : KeyboardEventType::KeyUp;
5786  KeyboardModifierFlags modifiers = KeyboardModifierFlags::None;
5787  if (altKeyWasDown) {
5788  modifiers |= KeyboardModifierFlags::Alt;
5789  }
5790  if (shiftKeyWasDown) {
5791  modifiers |= KeyboardModifierFlags::Shift;
5792  }
5793  if (ctrlKeyWasDown) {
5794  modifiers |= KeyboardModifierFlags::Ctrl;
5795  }
5796  if (superKeyWasDown) {
5797  modifiers |= KeyboardModifierFlags::Super;
5798  }
5799  platform::Win32PushKeyboardEvent(keyEventType, keyCode, modifiers, isDown);
5800 
5801  if (wasDown != isDown) {
5802  if (isDown) {
5803  if (keyCode == VK_F4 && altKeyWasDown) {
5804  win32State->window.isRunning = 0;
5805  }
5806  }
5807  }
5808  } break;
5809 
5810  case WM_CHAR:
5811  {
5812  uint64_t keyCode = wParam;
5813  KeyboardModifierFlags modifiers = KeyboardModifierFlags::None;
5814  platform::Win32PushKeyboardEvent(KeyboardEventType::Char, keyCode, modifiers, 0);
5815  } break;
5816 
5817  case WM_ACTIVATE:
5818  {
5819  Event newEvent = {};
5820  newEvent.type = EventType::Window;
5821  if (wParam == WA_INACTIVE) {
5822  newEvent.window.type = WindowEventType::LostFocus;
5823  } else {
5824  newEvent.window.type = WindowEventType::GotFocus;
5825  }
5826  platform::PushEvent(newEvent);
5827  } break;
5828 
5829  case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
5830  case WM_LBUTTONUP:
5831  {
5832  MouseEventType mouseEventType;
5833  if (msg == WM_LBUTTONDOWN) {
5834  mouseEventType = MouseEventType::ButtonDown;
5835  } else {
5836  mouseEventType = MouseEventType::ButtonUp;
5837  }
5838  platform::Win32PushMouseEvent(mouseEventType, MouseButtonType::Left, lParam, wParam);
5839  } break;
5840  case WM_RBUTTONDOWN:
5841  case WM_RBUTTONUP:
5842  {
5843  MouseEventType mouseEventType;
5844  if (msg == WM_RBUTTONDOWN) {
5845  mouseEventType = MouseEventType::ButtonDown;
5846  } else {
5847  mouseEventType = MouseEventType::ButtonUp;
5848  }
5849  platform::Win32PushMouseEvent(mouseEventType, MouseButtonType::Right, lParam, wParam);
5850  } break;
5851  case WM_MBUTTONDOWN:
5852  case WM_MBUTTONUP:
5853  {
5854  MouseEventType mouseEventType;
5855  if (msg == WM_MBUTTONDOWN) {
5856  mouseEventType = MouseEventType::ButtonDown;
5857  } else {
5858  mouseEventType = MouseEventType::ButtonUp;
5859  }
5860  platform::Win32PushMouseEvent(mouseEventType, MouseButtonType::Middle, lParam, wParam);
5861  } break;
5862  case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
5863  {
5864  platform::Win32PushMouseEvent(MouseEventType::Move, MouseButtonType::None, lParam, wParam);
5865  } break;
5866  case WM_MOUSEWHEEL:
5867  {
5868  platform::Win32PushMouseEvent(MouseEventType::Wheel, MouseButtonType::None, lParam, wParam);
5869  } break;
5870 
5871  case WM_SETCURSOR:
5872  {
5873  // @TODO(final): This is not right to assume default cursor always, because the size cursor does not work this way!
5874  if (win32State->window.isCursorActive) {
5875  HCURSOR cursor = wapi.user.getCursor();
5876  wapi.user.setCursor(cursor);
5877  } else {
5878  wapi.user.setCursor(nullptr);
5879  return 1;
5880  }
5881  } break;
5882 
5883  case WM_ERASEBKGND:
5884  {
5885  // Prevent erase background always
5886  return 1;
5887  } break;
5888 
5889  default:
5890  break;
5891  }
5892  result = win32_defWindowProc(hwnd, msg, wParam, lParam);
5893  return (result);
5894  }
5895 
5896  fpl_internal bool Win32InitWindow(Win32State &win32State, const Settings &initSettings) {
5897  Win32APIFunctions &wapi = global__Win32__API__Functions;
5898 
5899  // Register window class
5900  win32_wndclassex windowClass = {};
5901  windowClass.cbSize = sizeof(win32_wndclassex);
5902  windowClass.hInstance = GetModuleHandleA(nullptr);
5903  windowClass.hbrBackground = (HBRUSH)(COLOR_WINDOW + 1);
5904  windowClass.cbSize = sizeof(windowClass);
5905  windowClass.style = CS_HREDRAW | CS_VREDRAW;
5906  windowClass.hCursor = win32_loadCursor(nullptr, IDC_ARROW);
5907  windowClass.hIcon = win32_loadIcon(nullptr, IDI_APPLICATION);
5908  windowClass.hIconSm = win32_loadIcon(nullptr, IDI_APPLICATION);
5909  windowClass.lpszClassName = FPL_WIN32_CLASSNAME;
5910  windowClass.lpfnWndProc = Win32MessageProc;
5911  if (initSettings.video.driverType == VideoDriverType::OpenGL) {
5912  windowClass.style |= CS_OWNDC;
5913  }
5914  win32_copyString(windowClass.lpszClassName, win32_getStringLength(windowClass.lpszClassName), win32State.window.windowClass, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(win32State.window.windowClass));
5915  if (win32_registerClassEx(&windowClass) == 0) {
5916  common::PushError("Failed Registering Window Class '%s'", win32State.window.windowClass);
5917  return false;
5918  }
5919 
5920  // Allocate event queue
5921  size_t eventQueueMemorySize = sizeof(EventQueue);
5922  void *eventQueueMemory = memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(eventQueueMemorySize, 16);
5923  if (eventQueueMemory == nullptr) {
5924  common::PushError("Failed Allocating Event Queue Memory with size '%zu'", eventQueueMemorySize);
5925  return false;
5926  }
5927  global__EventQueue = (EventQueue *)eventQueueMemory;
5928 
5929  // Create window
5930  platform::win32_char windowTitleBuffer[1024];
5931  platform::win32_char *windowTitle = FPL_WIN32_UNNAMED_WINDOW;
5932  WindowSettings &currentWindowSettings = win32State.currentSettings.window;
5933  currentWindowSettings.isFullscreen = false;
5934  if (strings::GetAnsiStringLength(initSettings.window.windowTitle) > 0) {
5935  win32_ansiToString(initSettings.window.windowTitle, strings::GetAnsiStringLength(initSettings.window.windowTitle), windowTitleBuffer, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(windowTitleBuffer));
5936  windowTitle = windowTitleBuffer;
5937  strings::CopyAnsiString(initSettings.window.windowTitle, strings::GetAnsiStringLength(initSettings.window.windowTitle), currentWindowSettings.windowTitle, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(currentWindowSettings.windowTitle));
5938  }
5939 
5940  DWORD style;
5941  DWORD exStyle;
5942  if (initSettings.window.isResizable) {
5943  style = Win32ResizeableWindowStyle;
5944  exStyle = Win32ResizeableWindowExtendedStyle;
5945  currentWindowSettings.isResizable = true;
5946  } else {
5947  style = Win32NonResizableWindowStyle;
5948  exStyle = Win32NonResizableWindowExtendedStyle;
5949  currentWindowSettings.isResizable = false;
5950  }
5951 
5952  int windowX = CW_USEDEFAULT;
5953  int windowY = CW_USEDEFAULT;
5954  int windowWidth;
5955  int windowHeight;
5956  if ((initSettings.window.windowWidth > 0) &&
5957  (initSettings.window.windowHeight > 0)) {
5958  RECT windowRect;
5959  windowRect.left = 0;
5960  windowRect.top = 0;
5961  windowRect.right = initSettings.window.windowWidth;
5962  windowRect.bottom = initSettings.window.windowHeight;
5963  wapi.user.adjustWindowRect(&windowRect, style, false);
5964  windowWidth = windowRect.right - windowRect.left;
5965  windowHeight = windowRect.bottom - windowRect.top;
5966  } else {
5967  // @NOTE(final): Operating system decide how big the window should be.
5968  windowWidth = CW_USEDEFAULT;
5969  windowHeight = CW_USEDEFAULT;
5970  }
5971 
5972 
5973  // Create window
5974  win32State.window.windowHandle = win32_createWindowEx(exStyle, windowClass.lpszClassName, windowTitle, style, windowX, windowY, windowWidth, windowHeight, nullptr, nullptr, windowClass.hInstance, nullptr);
5975  if (win32State.window.windowHandle == nullptr) {
5976  common::PushError("Failed creating window for class '%s' and position (%d x %d) with size (%d x %d)", win32State.window.windowClass, windowWidth, windowHeight, windowWidth, windowHeight);
5977  return false;
5978  }
5979 
5980  // Get actual window size and store results
5981  currentWindowSettings.windowWidth = windowWidth;
5982  currentWindowSettings.windowHeight = windowHeight;
5983  RECT clientRect;
5984  if (wapi.user.getClientRect(global__Win32__State->window.windowHandle, &clientRect)) {
5985  currentWindowSettings.windowWidth = clientRect.right - clientRect.left;
5986  currentWindowSettings.windowHeight = clientRect.bottom - clientRect.top;
5987  }
5988 
5989  // Get device context so we can swap the back and front buffer
5990  win32State.window.deviceContext = wapi.user.getDC(win32State.window.windowHandle);
5991  if (win32State.window.deviceContext == nullptr) {
5992  common::PushError("Failed aquiring device context from window '%d'", win32State.window.windowHandle);
5993  return false;
5994  }
5995 
5996  // Enter fullscreen if needed
5997  if (initSettings.window.isFullscreen) {
5998  window::SetWindowFullscreen(true, initSettings.window.fullscreenWidth, initSettings.window.fullscreenHeight);
5999  }
6000 
6001 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
6002  // Create opengl rendering context if required
6003  win32State.video.activeVideoDriver = VideoDriverType::None;
6004  switch (initSettings.video.driverType) {
6005 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
6006  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
6007  {
6008  bool openglResult = platform::Win32InitVideoOpenGL(&win32State, initSettings.video);
6009  if (!openglResult) {
6010  common::PushError("Failed initializing OpenGL for window '%d'/'%s'", win32State.window.windowHandle, win32State.window.windowClass);
6011  return false;
6012  }
6013  win32State.video.activeVideoDriver = VideoDriverType::OpenGL;
6014  } break;
6015 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
6016 
6017 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
6018  case VideoDriverType::Software:
6019  {
6020  bool softwareResult = platform::Win32InitVideoSoftware(&win32State, windowWidth, windowHeight);
6021  if (!softwareResult) {
6022  common::PushError("Failed creating software rendering buffer for window '%d'/'%s'", win32State.window.windowHandle, win32State.window.windowClass);
6023  return false;
6024  }
6025  win32State.video.activeVideoDriver = VideoDriverType::Software;
6026  } break;
6027 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
6028 
6029  default:
6030  break;
6031  }
6032 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
6033 
6034  // Show window
6035  wapi.user.showWindow(win32State.window.windowHandle, SW_SHOW);
6036  wapi.user.updateWindow(win32State.window.windowHandle);
6037 
6038  // Cursor is visible at start
6039  win32State.window.defaultCursor = windowClass.hCursor;
6040  win32State.window.isCursorActive = true;
6041  win32State.window.isRunning = true;
6042 
6043  return true;
6044  }
6045 
6046  fpl_internal void Win32ReleaseWindow(Win32State &win32State) {
6047  Win32APIFunctions &api = global__Win32__API__Functions;
6048 
6049  if (win32State.window.deviceContext != nullptr) {
6050  api.user.releaseDC(win32State.window.windowHandle, win32State.window.deviceContext);
6051  win32State.window.deviceContext = nullptr;
6052  }
6053 
6054  if (win32State.window.windowHandle != nullptr) {
6055  api.user.destroyWindow(win32State.window.windowHandle);
6056  win32State.window.windowHandle = nullptr;
6057  win32_unregisterClass(win32State.window.windowClass, global__Win32__AppState.appInstance);
6058  }
6059 
6060  if (global__EventQueue != nullptr) {
6061  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(global__EventQueue);
6062  global__EventQueue = nullptr;
6063  }
6064  }
6065 
6066  fpl_internal void Win32LoadXInput() {
6067  // Windows 8
6068  HMODULE xinputLibrary = LoadLibraryA("xinput1_4.dll");
6069  if (!xinputLibrary) {
6070  // Windows 7
6071  xinputLibrary = LoadLibraryA("xinput1_3.dll");
6072  }
6073  if (!xinputLibrary) {
6074  // Windows Generic
6075  xinputLibrary = LoadLibraryA("xinput9_1_0.dll");
6076  }
6077  Win32InputFunctions &inputFuncs = global__Win32__Input__Functions;
6078  if (xinputLibrary) {
6079  inputFuncs.xinput.xinputLibrary = xinputLibrary;
6080  inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetState = (win32_func_XInputGetState *)GetProcAddress(xinputLibrary, "XInputGetState");
6081  inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetCapabilities = (win32_func_XInputGetCapabilities *)GetProcAddress(xinputLibrary, "XInputGetCapabilities");
6082  }
6083  if (inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetState == nullptr) {
6084  inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetState = Win32XInputGetStateStub;
6085  }
6086  if (inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetCapabilities == nullptr) {
6087  inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetCapabilities = Win32XInputGetCapabilitiesStub;
6088  }
6089  }
6090 
6091  fpl_internal void Win32UnloadXInput() {
6092  Win32InputFunctions &inputFuncs = global__Win32__Input__Functions;
6093  if (inputFuncs.xinput.xinputLibrary) {
6094  FreeLibrary(inputFuncs.xinput.xinputLibrary);
6095  inputFuncs.xinput.xinputLibrary = nullptr;
6096  inputFuncs.xinput.xInputGetState = Win32XInputGetStateStub;
6097  }
6098  }
6099 
6100  struct Win32CommandLineUTF8Arguments {
6101  void *mem;
6102  char **args;
6103  uint32_t count;
6104  };
6105  fpl_internal Win32CommandLineUTF8Arguments Win32ParseWideArguments(LPWSTR cmdLine) {
6106  Win32CommandLineUTF8Arguments args = {};
6107 
6108  // @NOTE(final): Temporary load and unload shell32 for parsing the arguments
6109  HMODULE shellapiLibrary = LoadLibraryA("shell32.dll");
6110  if (shellapiLibrary != nullptr) {
6111  win32_func_CommandLineToArgvW *commandLineToArgvW = (win32_func_CommandLineToArgvW *)GetProcAddress(shellapiLibrary, "CommandLineToArgvW");
6112  if (commandLineToArgvW != nullptr) {
6113  // Parse arguments and compute total UTF8 string length
6114  int executableFilePathArgumentCount = 0;
6115  wchar_t **executableFilePathArgs = commandLineToArgvW(L"", &executableFilePathArgumentCount);
6116  uint32_t executableFilePathLen = 0;
6117  for (int i = 0; i < executableFilePathArgumentCount; ++i) {
6118  if (i > 0) {
6119  // Include whitespace
6120  executableFilePathLen++;
6121  }
6122  uint32_t sourceLen = strings::GetWideStringLength(executableFilePathArgs[i]);
6123  uint32_t destLen = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, executableFilePathArgs[i], sourceLen, nullptr, 0, 0, 0);
6124  executableFilePathLen += destLen;
6125  }
6126 
6127  // @NOTE(final): Do not parse the arguments when there are no actual arguments, otherwise we will get back the executable arguments again.
6128  int actualArgumentCount = 0;
6129  wchar_t **actualArgs = nullptr;
6130  uint32_t actualArgumentsLen = 0;
6131  if (cmdLine != nullptr && strings::GetWideStringLength(cmdLine) > 0) {
6132  actualArgs = commandLineToArgvW(cmdLine, &actualArgumentCount);
6133  for (int i = 0; i < actualArgumentCount; ++i) {
6134  uint32_t sourceLen = strings::GetWideStringLength(actualArgs[i]);
6135  uint32_t destLen = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, actualArgs[i], sourceLen, nullptr, 0, 0, 0);
6136  actualArgumentsLen += destLen;
6137  }
6138  }
6139 
6140  // Calculate argument
6141  args.count = 1 + actualArgumentCount;
6142  uint32_t totalStringLen = executableFilePathLen + actualArgumentsLen + args.count;
6143  size_t singleArgStringSize = sizeof(char) * (totalStringLen);
6144  size_t arbitaryPadding = sizeof(char) * 8;
6145  size_t argArraySize = sizeof(char **) * args.count;
6146  size_t totalArgSize = singleArgStringSize + arbitaryPadding + argArraySize;
6147 
6148  args.mem = (uint8_t *)memory::MemoryAllocate(totalArgSize);
6149  char *argsString = (char *)args.mem;
6150  args.args = (char **)((uint8_t *)args.mem + singleArgStringSize + arbitaryPadding);
6151 
6152  // Convert executable path to UTF8
6153  char *destArg = argsString;
6154  {
6155  args.args[0] = argsString;
6156  for (int i = 0; i < executableFilePathArgumentCount; ++i) {
6157  if (i > 0) {
6158  *destArg++ = ' ';
6159  }
6160  wchar_t *sourceArg = executableFilePathArgs[i];
6161  uint32_t sourceArgLen = strings::GetWideStringLength(sourceArg);
6162  uint32_t destArgLen = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, sourceArg, sourceArgLen, nullptr, 0, 0, 0);
6163  WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, sourceArg, sourceArgLen, destArg, destArgLen, 0, 0);
6164  destArg += destArgLen;
6165  }
6166  *destArg++ = 0;
6167  LocalFree(executableFilePathArgs);
6168  }
6169 
6170  // Convert actual arguments to UTF8
6171  if (actualArgumentCount > 0) {
6172  FPL_ASSERT(actualArgs != nullptr);
6173  for (int i = 0; i < actualArgumentCount; ++i) {
6174  args.args[1 + i] = destArg;
6175  wchar_t *sourceArg = actualArgs[i];
6176  uint32_t sourceArgLen = strings::GetWideStringLength(sourceArg);
6177  uint32_t destArgLen = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, sourceArg, sourceArgLen, nullptr, 0, 0, 0);
6178  WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, sourceArg, sourceArgLen, destArg, destArgLen, 0, 0);
6179  destArg += destArgLen;
6180  *destArg++ = 0;
6181  }
6182  LocalFree(actualArgs);
6183  }
6184  }
6185  FreeLibrary(shellapiLibrary);
6186  shellapiLibrary = nullptr;
6187  }
6188  return(args);
6189  }
6190 
6191  fpl_internal Win32CommandLineUTF8Arguments Win32ParseAnsiArguments(LPSTR cmdLine) {
6192  Win32CommandLineUTF8Arguments result;
6193  if (cmdLine != nullptr) {
6194  uint32_t ansiSourceLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(cmdLine);
6195  uint32_t wideDestLen = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, cmdLine, ansiSourceLen, nullptr, 0);
6196  // @TODO(final): Can we use a stack allocation here?
6197  wchar_t *wideCmdLine = (wchar_t *)memory::MemoryAllocate(sizeof(wchar_t) * (wideDestLen + 1));
6198  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, cmdLine, ansiSourceLen, wideCmdLine, wideDestLen);
6199  wideCmdLine[wideDestLen] = 0;
6200  result = Win32ParseWideArguments(wideCmdLine);
6201  memory::MemoryFree(wideCmdLine);
6202  } else {
6203  result = Win32ParseWideArguments(L"");
6204  }
6205  return(result);
6206  }
6207 
6208 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
6209 
6210  fpl_api bool Win32LoadAPI(Win32State &win32State) {
6211  Win32APIFunctions &wapi = global__Win32__API__Functions;
6212 
6213  // Shell32
6214  {
6215  const char *shellLibraryName = "shell32.dll";
6216  HMODULE library = wapi.shell.shellLibrary = LoadLibraryA(shellLibraryName);
6217  if (library == nullptr) {
6218  common::PushError("Failed loading win32 library '%s'", shellLibraryName);
6219  return false;
6220  }
6221  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, shellLibraryName, wapi.shell.commandLineToArgvW, win32_func_CommandLineToArgvW, "CommandLineToArgvW");
6222  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, shellLibraryName, wapi.shell.shGetFolderPathA, win32_func_SHGetFolderPathA, "SHGetFolderPathA");
6223  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, shellLibraryName, wapi.shell.shGetFolderPathW, win32_func_SHGetFolderPathW, "SHGetFolderPathW");
6224  }
6225 
6226  // User32
6227  {
6228  const char *userLibraryName = "user32.dll";
6229  HMODULE library = wapi.user.userLibrary = LoadLibraryA(userLibraryName);
6230  if (library == nullptr) {
6231  common::PushError("Failed loading win32 library '%s'", userLibraryName);
6232  return false;
6233  }
6234 
6235  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.registerClassExA, win32_func_RegisterClassExA, "RegisterClassExA");
6236  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.registerClassExW, win32_func_RegisterClassExW, "RegisterClassExW");
6237  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.unregisterClassA, win32_func_UnregisterClassA, "UnregisterClassA");
6238  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.unregisterClassW, win32_func_UnregisterClassW, "UnregisterClassW");
6239  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.showWindow, win32_func_ShowWindow, "ShowWindow");
6240  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.destroyWindow, win32_func_DestroyWindow, "DestroyWindow");
6241  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.updateWindow, win32_func_UpdateWindow, "UpdateWindow");
6242  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.translateMessage, win32_func_TranslateMessage, "TranslateMessage");
6243  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.dispatchMessageA, win32_func_DispatchMessageA, "DispatchMessageA");
6244  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.dispatchMessageW, win32_func_DispatchMessageW, "DispatchMessageW");
6245  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.peekMessageA, win32_func_PeekMessageA, "PeekMessageA");
6246  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.peekMessageW, win32_func_PeekMessageW, "PeekMessageW");
6247  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.defWindowProcA, win32_func_DefWindowProcA, "DefWindowProcA");
6248  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.defWindowProcW, win32_func_DefWindowProcW, "DefWindowProcW");
6249  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.createWindowExA, win32_func_CreateWindowExA, "CreateWindowExA");
6250  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.createWindowExW, win32_func_CreateWindowExW, "CreateWindowExW");
6251  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowPos, win32_func_SetWindowPos, "SetWindowPos");
6252  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getWindowPlacement, win32_func_GetWindowPlacement, "GetWindowPlacement");
6253  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowPlacement, win32_func_SetWindowPlacement, "SetWindowPlacement");
6254  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getClientRect, win32_func_GetClientRect, "GetClientRect");
6255  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getWindowRect, win32_func_GetWindowRect, "GetWindowRect");
6256  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.adjustWindowRect, win32_func_AdjustWindowRect, "AdjustWindowRect");
6257  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getAsyncKeyState, win32_func_GetAsyncKeyState, "GetAsyncKeyState");
6258  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.mapVirtualKeyA, win32_func_MapVirtualKeyA, "MapVirtualKeyA");
6259  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.mapVirtualKeyW, win32_func_MapVirtualKeyW, "MapVirtualKeyW");
6260  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setCursor, win32_func_SetCursor, "SetCursor");
6261  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getCursor, win32_func_GetCursor, "GetCursor");
6262  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.loadCursorA, win32_func_LoadCursorA, "LoadCursorA");
6263  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.loadCursorW, win32_func_LoadCursorW, "LoadCursorW");
6264  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.loadIconA, win32_func_LoadIconA, "LoadCursorA");
6265  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.loadIconW, win32_func_LoadIconW, "LoadIconW");
6266  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowTextA, win32_func_SetWindowTextA, "SetWindowTextA");
6267  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowTextW, win32_func_SetWindowTextW, "SetWindowTextW");
6268  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowLongA, win32_func_SetWindowLongA, "SetWindowLongA");
6269  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowLongW, win32_func_SetWindowLongW, "SetWindowLongW");
6270  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getWindowLongA, win32_func_GetWindowLongA, "GetWindowLongA");
6271  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getWindowLongW, win32_func_GetWindowLongW, "GetWindowLongW");
6272 
6273 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
6274  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowLongPtrA, win32_func_SetWindowLongPtrA, "SetWindowLongPtrA");
6275  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setWindowLongPtrW, win32_func_SetWindowLongPtrW, "SetWindowLongPtrW");
6276  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getWindowLongPtrA, win32_func_GetWindowLongPtrA, "GetWindowLongPtrA");
6277  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getWindowLongPtrW, win32_func_GetWindowLongPtrW, "GetWindowLongPtrW");
6278 # endif
6279 
6280  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.releaseDC, win32_func_ReleaseDC, "ReleaseDC");
6281  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getDC, win32_func_GetDC, "GetDC");
6282  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.changeDisplaySettingsA, win32_func_ChangeDisplaySettingsA, "ChangeDisplaySettingsA");
6283  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.changeDisplaySettingsW, win32_func_ChangeDisplaySettingsW, "ChangeDisplaySettingsW");
6284  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.enumDisplaySettingsA, win32_func_EnumDisplaySettingsA, "EnumDisplaySettingsA");
6285  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.enumDisplaySettingsW, win32_func_EnumDisplaySettingsW, "EnumDisplaySettingsW");
6286 
6287  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.openClipboard, win32_func_OpenClipboard, "OpenClipboard");
6288  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.closeClipboard, win32_func_CloseClipboard, "CloseClipboard");
6289  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.emptyClipboard, win32_func_EmptyClipboard, "EmptyClipboard");
6290  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.setClipboardData, win32_func_SetClipboardData, "SetClipboardData");
6291  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getClipboardData, win32_func_GetClipboardData, "GetClipboardData");
6292 
6293  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getDesktopWindow, win32_func_GetDesktopWindow, "GetDesktopWindow");
6294  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getForegroundWindow, win32_func_GetForegroundWindow, "GetForegroundWindow");
6295 
6296  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.isZoomed, win32_func_IsZoomed, "IsZoomed");
6297  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.sendMessageA, win32_func_SendMessageA, "SendMessageA");
6298  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.sendMessageW, win32_func_SendMessageW, "SendMessageW");
6299  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getMonitorInfoA, win32_func_GetMonitorInfoA, "GetMonitorInfoA");
6300  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.getMonitorInfoW, win32_func_GetMonitorInfoW, "GetMonitorInfoW");
6301  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.monitorFromRect, win32_func_MonitorFromRect, "MonitorFromRect");
6302  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, userLibraryName, wapi.user.monitorFromWindow, win32_func_MonitorFromWindow, "MonitorFromWindow");
6303  }
6304 
6305  // GDI32
6306  {
6307  const char *gdiLibraryName = "gdi32.dll";
6308  HMODULE library = wapi.gdi.gdiLibrary = LoadLibraryA(gdiLibraryName);
6309  if (library == nullptr) {
6310  common::PushError("Failed loading win32 library '%s'", gdiLibraryName);
6311  return false;
6312  }
6313 
6314  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, gdiLibraryName, wapi.gdi.choosePixelFormat, win32_func_ChoosePixelFormat, "ChoosePixelFormat");
6315  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, gdiLibraryName, wapi.gdi.setPixelFormat, win32_func_SetPixelFormat, "SetPixelFormat");
6316  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, gdiLibraryName, wapi.gdi.describePixelFormat, win32_func_DescribePixelFormat, "DescribePixelFormat");
6317  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, gdiLibraryName, wapi.gdi.stretchDIBits, win32_func_StretchDIBits, "StretchDIBits");
6318  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, gdiLibraryName, wapi.gdi.deleteObject, win32_func_DeleteObject, "DeleteObject");
6319  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, gdiLibraryName, wapi.gdi.swapBuffers, win32_func_SwapBuffers, "SwapBuffers");
6320  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, gdiLibraryName, wapi.gdi.getDeviceCaps, win32_func_GetDeviceCaps, "GetDeviceCaps");
6321  }
6322 
6323  // OLE32
6324  {
6325  const char *oleLibraryName = "ole32.dll";
6326  HMODULE library = wapi.ole.oleLibrary = LoadLibraryA(oleLibraryName);
6327  if (library == nullptr) {
6328  common::PushError("Failed loading win32 library '%s'", oleLibraryName);
6329  return false;
6330  }
6331 
6332  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, oleLibraryName, wapi.ole.coInitializeEx, win32_func_CoInitializeEx, "CoInitializeEx");
6333  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, oleLibraryName, wapi.ole.coUninitialize, win32_func_CoUninitialize, "CoUninitialize");
6334  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, oleLibraryName, wapi.ole.coCreateInstance, win32_func_CoCreateInstance, "CoCreateInstance");
6335  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, oleLibraryName, wapi.ole.coTaskMemFree, win32_func_CoTaskMemFree, "CoTaskMemFree");
6336  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(library, oleLibraryName, wapi.ole.propVariantClear, win32_func_PropVariantClear, "PropVariantClear");
6337  }
6338 
6339 
6340  return true;
6341  }
6342 
6343  fpl_api void Win32UnloadAPI() {
6344  Win32APIFunctions &api = global__Win32__API__Functions;
6345  if (api.ole.oleLibrary != nullptr) {
6346  FreeLibrary(api.ole.oleLibrary);
6347  api.ole = {};
6348  }
6349  if (api.gdi.gdiLibrary != nullptr) {
6350  FreeLibrary(api.gdi.gdiLibrary);
6351  api.gdi = {};
6352  }
6353  if (api.user.userLibrary != nullptr) {
6354  FreeLibrary(api.user.userLibrary);
6355  api.user = {};
6356  }
6357  if (api.shell.shellLibrary != nullptr) {
6358  FreeLibrary(api.shell.shellLibrary);
6359  api.shell = {};
6360  }
6361  }
6362 
6363  fpl_internal bool Win32ThreadWaitForMultiple(threading::ThreadContext *contexts[], const uint32_t count, const bool waitForAll, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6364  if (contexts == nullptr) {
6365  common::PushError("Contexts parameter are not allowed to be null");
6366  return false;
6367  }
6368  if (count > common::MAX_THREAD_COUNT) {
6369  common::PushError("Count parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", count, common::MAX_THREAD_COUNT);
6370  return false;
6371  }
6372  HANDLE threadHandles[common::MAX_THREAD_COUNT];
6373  for (uint32_t index = 0; index < count; ++index) {
6374  threading::ThreadContext *context = contexts[index];
6375  if (context == nullptr) {
6376  common::PushError("Thread context for index '%d' are not allowed to be null", index);
6377  return false;
6378  }
6379  if (context->internalHandle.win32Thread == nullptr) {
6380  common::PushError("Thread handle for index '%d' are not allowed to be null", index);
6381  return false;
6382  }
6383  HANDLE handle = context->internalHandle.win32Thread;
6384  threadHandles[index] = handle;
6385  }
6386  DWORD code = WaitForMultipleObjects(count, threadHandles, waitForAll ? TRUE : FALSE, maxMilliseconds < UINT32_MAX ? maxMilliseconds : INFINITE);
6387  bool result = (code != WAIT_TIMEOUT) && (code != WAIT_FAILED);
6388  return(result);
6389  }
6390 
6391  fpl_internal bool Win32SignalWaitForMultiple(threading::ThreadSignal *signals[], const uint32_t count, const bool waitForAll, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6392  if (signals == nullptr) {
6393  common::PushError("Signals parameter are not allowed to be null");
6394  return false;
6395  }
6396  if (count > common::MAX_SIGNAL_COUNT) {
6397  common::PushError("Count parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", count, common::MAX_SIGNAL_COUNT);
6398  return false;
6399  }
6400  HANDLE signalHandles[common::MAX_SIGNAL_COUNT];
6401  for (uint32_t index = 0; index < count; ++index) {
6402  threading::ThreadSignal *availableSignal = signals[index];
6403  if (availableSignal == nullptr) {
6404  common::PushError("Signal for index '%d' are not allowed to be null", index);
6405  return false;
6406  }
6407  if (availableSignal->internalHandle.win32Event == nullptr) {
6408  common::PushError("Signal handle for index '%d' are not allowed to be null", index);
6409  return false;
6410  }
6411  HANDLE handle = availableSignal->internalHandle.win32Event;
6412  signalHandles[index] = handle;
6413  }
6414  DWORD code = WaitForMultipleObjects(count, signalHandles, waitForAll ? TRUE : FALSE, maxMilliseconds < UINT32_MAX ? maxMilliseconds : INFINITE);
6415  bool result = (code != WAIT_TIMEOUT) && (code != WAIT_FAILED);
6416  return(result);
6417  }
6418 
6419  fpl_internal void Win32ReleasePlatform() {
6420  Win32ApplicationState &appState = global__Win32__AppState;
6421 
6422  if (global__Win32__State != nullptr) {
6423  Win32State &win32State = *global__Win32__State;
6424 
6425 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
6426  audio::ReleaseAudio();
6427 # endif
6428 
6429 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
6430  if (win32State.currentSettings.window.isFullscreen) {
6431  Win32LeaveFullscreen();
6432  }
6433 
6434 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
6435  switch (win32State.video.activeVideoDriver) {
6436 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
6437  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
6438  {
6439  Win32ReleaseVideoOpenGL(&win32State);
6440  } break;
6441 # endif
6442 
6443 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
6444  case VideoDriverType::Software:
6445  {
6446  Win32ReleaseVideoSoftware(&win32State);
6447  } break;
6448 # endif
6449 
6450  default:
6451  break;
6452  }
6453 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
6454 
6455  Win32ReleaseWindow(win32State);
6456 
6457  Win32UnloadXInput();
6458 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
6459 
6460  Win32UnloadAPI();
6461 
6462  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(global__Win32__State);
6463  global__Win32__State = nullptr;
6464  }
6465  appState.isInitialized = false;
6466  }
6467 
6468  fpl_internal bool Win32InitPlatform(const InitFlags initFlags, const Settings &initSettings) {
6469  Win32ApplicationState &appState = global__Win32__AppState;
6470 
6471  appState = {};
6472  appState.appInstance = GetModuleHandleA(nullptr);
6473 
6474  // @NOTE(final): Expect kernel32.lib to be linked always, so VirtualAlloc and LoadLibrary will always work.
6475 
6476  // Allocate win32 state
6477  FPL_ASSERT(global__Win32__State == nullptr);
6478  size_t win32StateSize = sizeof(Win32State);
6479  void *win32StateMemory = memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(win32StateSize, 16);
6480  if (win32StateMemory == nullptr) {
6481  common::PushError("Failed allocating win32 state memory of size '%zu'", win32StateSize);
6482  return false;
6483  }
6484 
6485  FPL_ASSERT(win32StateMemory != nullptr);
6486  global__Win32__State = (Win32State *)win32StateMemory;
6487  Win32State &win32State = *global__Win32__State;
6488  win32State.initSettings = initSettings;
6489  win32State.initFlags = initFlags;
6490  win32State.currentSettings = initSettings;
6491  win32State.video = {};
6492 
6493  // Timing
6494  QueryPerformanceFrequency(&appState.performanceFrequency);
6495 
6496  // Get main thread infos
6497  HANDLE mainThreadHandle = GetCurrentThread();
6498  DWORD mainThreadHandleId = GetCurrentThreadId();
6499  threading::ThreadContext *context = &common::global__ThreadState.mainThread;
6500  *context = {};
6501  context->id = mainThreadHandleId;
6502  context->internalHandle.win32Thread = mainThreadHandle;
6503  context->currentState = threading::ThreadState::Running;
6504 
6505 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
6506  // Window is required for video always
6507  if (win32State.initFlags & InitFlags::Video) {
6508  win32State.initFlags |= InitFlags::Window;
6509  }
6510 # endif
6511 
6512  // Load windows api library
6513  if (!Win32LoadAPI(win32State)) {
6514  // @NOTE(final): Assume that errors are pushed on already.
6515  Win32ReleasePlatform();
6516  return false;
6517  }
6518 
6519 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
6520  // Load XInput
6521  Win32LoadXInput();
6522 
6523  if (win32State.initFlags & InitFlags::Window) {
6524  if (!Win32InitWindow(win32State, initSettings)) {
6525  common::PushError("Failed creating a window with flags '%d' and settings (Width=%d, Height=%d, Video driver=%d)", win32State.initFlags, initSettings.window.windowWidth, initSettings.window.windowHeight, initSettings.video.driverType);
6526  Win32ReleasePlatform();
6527  return false;
6528  }
6529  }
6530 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
6531 
6532 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
6533  // Init audio
6534  if (win32State.initFlags & InitFlags::Audio) {
6535  if (audio::InitAudio(initSettings.audio) != audio::AudioResult::Success) {
6536  common::PushError("Failed initialization audio with settings (Driver=%s, Format=%s, SampleRate=%d, Channels=%d, BufferSize=%d)", audio::GetAudioDriverString(initSettings.audio.driver), audio::GetAudioFormatString(initSettings.audio.deviceFormat.type), initSettings.audio.deviceFormat.sampleRate, initSettings.audio.deviceFormat.channels);
6537  Win32ReleasePlatform();
6538  return false;
6539  }
6540  }
6541 # endif
6542 
6543  appState.isInitialized = true;
6544 
6545  return (true);
6546  }
6547 
6548  } // platform
6549 
6550  //
6551  // Win32 Atomics
6552  //
6553  namespace atomics {
6554  fpl_api void AtomicReadFence() {
6555  FPL_MEMORY_BARRIER();
6556  _ReadBarrier();
6557  }
6558  fpl_api void AtomicWriteFence() {
6559  FPL_MEMORY_BARRIER();
6560  _WriteBarrier();
6561  }
6562  fpl_api void AtomicReadWriteFence() {
6563  FPL_MEMORY_BARRIER();
6564  _ReadWriteBarrier();
6565  }
6566 
6567  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *target, const uint32_t value) {
6568  FPL_ASSERT(target != nullptr);
6569  uint32_t result = _InterlockedExchange((volatile unsigned long *)target, value);
6570  return (result);
6571  }
6572  fpl_api int32_t AtomicExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *target, const int32_t value) {
6573  FPL_ASSERT(target != nullptr);
6574  int32_t result = _InterlockedExchange((volatile long *)target, value);
6575  return (result);
6576  }
6577  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *target, const uint64_t value) {
6578  FPL_ASSERT(target != nullptr);
6579  uint64_t result = _InterlockedExchange((volatile unsigned __int64 *)target, value);
6580  return (result);
6581  }
6582  fpl_api int64_t AtomicExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *target, const int64_t value) {
6583  FPL_ASSERT(target != nullptr);
6584  int64_t result = _InterlockedExchange64((volatile long long *)target, value);
6585  return (result);
6586  }
6587 
6588  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicAddU32(volatile uint32_t *value, const uint32_t addend) {
6589  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
6590  uint32_t result = _InterlockedExchangeAdd((volatile unsigned long *)value, addend);
6591  return (result);
6592  }
6593  fpl_api int32_t AtomicAddS32(volatile int32_t *value, const int32_t addend) {
6594  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
6595  int32_t result = _InterlockedExchangeAdd((volatile long *)value, addend);
6596  return (result);
6597  }
6598  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicAddU64(volatile uint64_t *value, const uint64_t addend) {
6599  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
6600  uint64_t result = _InterlockedExchangeAdd((volatile unsigned __int64 *)value, addend);
6601  return (result);
6602  }
6603  fpl_api int64_t AtomicAddS64(volatile int64_t *value, const int64_t addend) {
6604  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
6605  int64_t result = _InterlockedExchangeAdd64((volatile long long *)value, addend);
6606  return (result);
6607  }
6608 
6609  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange) {
6610  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6611  uint32_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile unsigned long *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6612  return (result);
6613  }
6614  fpl_api int32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange) {
6615  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6616  int32_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile long *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6617  return (result);
6618  }
6619  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange) {
6620  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6621  uint64_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile unsigned __int64 *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6622  return (result);
6623  }
6624  fpl_api int64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange) {
6625  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6626  int64_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange64((volatile long long *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6627  return (result);
6628  }
6629 
6630  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange) {
6631  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6632  uint32_t value = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile unsigned long *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6633  bool result = (value == comparand);
6634  return (result);
6635  }
6636  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange) {
6637  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6638  int32_t value = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile long *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6639  bool result = (value == comparand);
6640  return (result);
6641  }
6642  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange) {
6643  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6644  uint64_t value = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile unsigned __int64 *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6645  bool result = (value == comparand);
6646  return (result);
6647  }
6648  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange) {
6649  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
6650  int64_t value = _InterlockedCompareExchange64((volatile long long *)dest, exchange, comparand);
6651  bool result = (value == comparand);
6652  return (result);
6653  }
6654 
6655  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicLoadU32(volatile uint32_t *source) {
6656  uint32_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile unsigned long *)source, 0, 0);
6657  return(result);
6658  }
6659  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicLoadU64(volatile uint64_t *source) {
6660  uint64_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile unsigned __int64 *)source, 0, 0);
6661  return(result);
6662  }
6663  fpl_api int32_t AtomicLoadS32(volatile int32_t *source) {
6664  int32_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange((volatile long *)source, 0, 0);
6665  return(result);
6666  }
6667  fpl_api int64_t AtomicLoadS64(volatile int64_t *source) {
6668  int64_t result = _InterlockedCompareExchange64((volatile __int64 *)source, 0, 0);
6669  return(result);
6670  }
6671 
6672  fpl_api void AtomicStoreU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t value) {
6673  _InterlockedExchange((volatile unsigned long *)dest, value);
6674  }
6675  fpl_api void AtomicStoreU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t value) {
6676  _InterlockedExchange((volatile unsigned __int64 *)dest, value);
6677  }
6678  fpl_api void AtomicStoreS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t value) {
6679  _InterlockedExchange((volatile long *)dest, value);
6680  }
6681  fpl_api void AtomicStoreS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t value) {
6682  _InterlockedExchange64((volatile __int64 *)dest, value);
6683  }
6684  } // atomics
6685 
6686  //
6687  // Win32 Hardware
6688  //
6689  namespace hardware {
6690  fpl_api uint32_t GetProcessorCoreCount() {
6691  SYSTEM_INFO sysInfo = {};
6692  GetSystemInfo(&sysInfo);
6693  // @NOTE(final): For now this returns the number of logical processors, which is the actual core count in most cases.
6694  uint32_t result = sysInfo.dwNumberOfProcessors;
6695  return(result);
6696  }
6697 
6698  fpl_api MemoryInfos GetSystemMemoryInfos() {
6699  MemoryInfos result = {};
6700  MEMORYSTATUSEX statex = {};
6701  statex.dwLength = sizeof(statex);
6702  ULONGLONG totalMemorySize;
6703  if (GetPhysicallyInstalledSystemMemory(&totalMemorySize) && GlobalMemoryStatusEx(&statex)) {
6704  result.totalPhysicalSize = totalMemorySize * 1024;
6705  result.availablePhysicalSize = statex.ullTotalPhys;
6706  result.usedPhysicalSize = result.availablePhysicalSize - statex.ullAvailPhys;
6707  result.totalVirtualSize = statex.ullTotalVirtual;
6708  result.usedVirtualSize = result.totalVirtualSize - statex.ullAvailVirtual;
6709  result.totalPageSize = statex.ullTotalPageFile;
6710  result.usedPageSize = result.totalPageSize - statex.ullAvailPageFile;
6711  }
6712  return(result);
6713  }
6714 
6715  fpl_api char *GetProcessorName(char *destBuffer, const uint32_t maxDestBufferLen) {
6716  fpl_constant uint32_t CPU_BRAND_BUFFER_SIZE = 0x40;
6717 
6718  if (destBuffer == nullptr) {
6719  common::PushError("Dest buffer parameter are not allowed to be null");
6720  return nullptr;
6721  }
6722  if (maxDestBufferLen < (CPU_BRAND_BUFFER_SIZE + 1)) {
6723  common::PushError("Max dest buffer len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestBufferLen, CPU_BRAND_BUFFER_SIZE + 1);
6724  return nullptr;
6725  }
6726 
6727  // @TODO(final): __cpuid may not be available on other Win32 Compilers!
6728 
6729  int cpuInfo[4] = { -1 };
6730  char cpuBrandBuffer[CPU_BRAND_BUFFER_SIZE] = {};
6731  __cpuid(cpuInfo, 0x80000000);
6732  uint32_t extendedIds = cpuInfo[0];
6733 
6734  // Get the information associated with each extended ID. Interpret CPU brand string.
6735  uint32_t max = FPL_MIN(extendedIds, 0x80000004);
6736  for (uint32_t i = 0x80000002; i <= max; ++i) {
6737  __cpuid(cpuInfo, i);
6738  uint32_t offset = (i - 0x80000002) << 4;
6739  memory::MemoryCopy(cpuInfo, sizeof(cpuInfo), cpuBrandBuffer + offset);
6740  }
6741 
6742  // Copy result back to the dest buffer
6743  uint32_t sourceLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(cpuBrandBuffer);
6744  strings::CopyAnsiString(cpuBrandBuffer, sourceLen, destBuffer, maxDestBufferLen);
6745 
6746  return(destBuffer);
6747  }
6748  } // hardware
6749 
6750  //
6751  // Win32 Console
6752  //
6753  namespace console {
6754  fpl_api void ConsoleOut(const char *text) {
6755  if (text != nullptr) {
6756  fprintf(stdout, text);
6757  }
6758  }
6759  fpl_api void ConsoleFormatOut(const char *format, ...) {
6760  if (format != nullptr) {
6761  va_list vaList;
6762  va_start(vaList, format);
6763  vfprintf(stdout, format, vaList);
6764  va_end(vaList);
6765  }
6766  }
6767  fpl_api void ConsoleError(const char *text) {
6768  if (text != nullptr) {
6769  fprintf(stderr, "%s", text);
6770  }
6771  }
6772  fpl_api void ConsoleFormatError(const char *format, ...) {
6773  if (format != nullptr) {
6774  va_list vaList;
6775  va_start(vaList, format);
6776  vfprintf(stderr, format, vaList);
6777  va_end(vaList);
6778  }
6779  }
6780  }
6781 
6782  //
6783  // Win32 Threading
6784  //
6785  namespace threading {
6786  fpl_internal DWORD WINAPI Win32ThreadProc(void *data) {
6787  ThreadContext *context = (ThreadContext *)data;
6788  FPL_ASSERT(context != nullptr);
6789  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Running);
6790  DWORD result = 0;
6791  if (context->runFunc != nullptr) {
6792  context->runFunc(*context, context->data);
6793  }
6794  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Stopped);
6795  return(result);
6796  }
6797 
6798  fpl_api ThreadContext *ThreadCreate(run_thread_function *runFunc, void *data, const bool autoStart) {
6799  ThreadContext *result = nullptr;
6800  ThreadContext *context = common::GetThreadContext();
6801  if (context != nullptr) {
6802  DWORD creationFlags = 0;
6803  DWORD threadId = 0;
6804  HANDLE handle = CreateThread(nullptr, 0, Win32ThreadProc, context, CREATE_SUSPENDED, &threadId);
6805  if (handle != nullptr) {
6806  context->currentState = ThreadState::Suspended;
6807  context->data = data;
6808  context->id = threadId;
6809  context->internalHandle.win32Thread = handle;
6810  context->runFunc = runFunc;
6811  context->isValid = true;
6812  if (autoStart) {
6813  ResumeThread(handle);
6814  }
6815  result = context;
6816  } else {
6817  common::PushError("Failed creating thread, error code: %d", GetLastError());
6818  }
6819  } else {
6820  common::PushError("All %d threads are in use, you cannot create until you free one", common::MAX_THREAD_COUNT);
6821  }
6822  return(result);
6823  }
6824 
6825  fpl_api void ThreadSleep(const uint32_t milliseconds) {
6826  Sleep((DWORD)milliseconds);
6827  }
6828 
6829  fpl_api bool ThreadSuspend(ThreadContext *context) {
6830  if (context == nullptr) {
6831  common::PushError("Context parameter are not allowed to be null");
6832  return false;
6833  }
6834  if (context->internalHandle.win32Thread == nullptr) {
6835  common::PushError("Thread context handle are not allowed to be null");
6836  return false;
6837  }
6838  HANDLE handle = context->internalHandle.win32Thread;
6839  DWORD err = SuspendThread(handle);
6840  bool result = err != -1;
6841  if (result) {
6842  // @TODO(final): Is this really needed to use a atomic store for setting the thread state?
6843  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Suspended);
6844  }
6845  return(result);
6846  }
6847 
6848  fpl_api bool ThreadResume(ThreadContext *context) {
6849  if (context == nullptr) {
6850  common::PushError("Context parameter are not allowed to be null");
6851  return false;
6852  }
6853  if (context->internalHandle.win32Thread == nullptr) {
6854  common::PushError("Thread context handle are not allowed to be null");
6855  return false;
6856  }
6857  HANDLE handle = context->internalHandle.win32Thread;
6858  DWORD err = ResumeThread(handle);
6859  bool result = err != -1;
6860  if (result) {
6861  // @TODO(final): Is this really needed to use a atomic store for setting the thread state?
6862  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Running);
6863  }
6864  return(result);
6865  }
6866 
6867  fpl_api void ThreadDestroy(ThreadContext *context) {
6868  if (context != nullptr && context->internalHandle.win32Thread != nullptr) {
6869  HANDLE handle = context->internalHandle.win32Thread;
6870  TerminateThread(handle, 0);
6871  CloseHandle(handle);
6872  // @TODO(final): Is this really needed to use a atomic store for setting the thread state?
6873  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Stopped);
6874  *context = {};
6875  }
6876  }
6877 
6878  fpl_api bool ThreadWaitForOne(ThreadContext *context, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6879  if (context == nullptr) {
6880  common::PushError("Context parameter are not allowed to be null");
6881  return false;
6882  }
6883  if (context->internalHandle.win32Thread == nullptr) {
6884  common::PushError("Thread context handle are not allowed to be null");
6885  return false;
6886  }
6887  HANDLE handle = context->internalHandle.win32Thread;
6888  bool result = (WaitForSingleObject(handle, maxMilliseconds < UINT32_MAX ? maxMilliseconds : INFINITE) == WAIT_OBJECT_0);
6889  return(result);
6890  }
6891 
6892  fpl_api bool ThreadWaitForAll(ThreadContext *contexts[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6893  bool result = platform::Win32ThreadWaitForMultiple(contexts, count, true, maxMilliseconds);
6894  return(result);
6895  }
6896 
6897  fpl_api bool ThreadWaitForAny(ThreadContext *contexts[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6898  bool result = platform::Win32ThreadWaitForMultiple(contexts, count, false, maxMilliseconds);
6899  return(result);
6900  }
6901 
6902  fpl_api ThreadMutex MutexCreate() {
6903  ThreadMutex result = {};
6904  InitializeCriticalSection(&result.internalHandle.win32CriticalSection);
6905  result.isValid = true;
6906  return(result);
6907  }
6908 
6909  fpl_api void MutexDestroy(ThreadMutex &mutex) {
6910  if (mutex.isValid) {
6911  DeleteCriticalSection(&mutex.internalHandle.win32CriticalSection);
6912  mutex = {};
6913  }
6914  }
6915 
6916  fpl_api bool MutexLock(ThreadMutex &mutex, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6917  if (!mutex.isValid) {
6918  return false;
6919  }
6920  EnterCriticalSection(&mutex.internalHandle.win32CriticalSection);
6921  return true;
6922  }
6923 
6924  fpl_api bool MutexUnlock(ThreadMutex &mutex) {
6925  if (!mutex.isValid) {
6926  return false;
6927  }
6928  LeaveCriticalSection(&mutex.internalHandle.win32CriticalSection);
6929  return true;
6930  }
6931 
6932  fpl_api ThreadSignal SignalCreate() {
6933  ThreadSignal result = {};
6934  HANDLE handle = CreateEventA(nullptr, FALSE, FALSE, nullptr);
6935  if (handle != nullptr) {
6936  result.isValid = true;
6937  result.internalHandle.win32Event = handle;
6938  }
6939  return(result);
6940  }
6941 
6942  fpl_api void SignalDestroy(ThreadSignal &signal) {
6943  if (signal.internalHandle.win32Event != nullptr) {
6944  HANDLE handle = signal.internalHandle.win32Event;
6945  CloseHandle(handle);
6946  signal = {};
6947  }
6948  }
6949 
6950  fpl_api bool SignalWaitForOne(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal &signal, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6951  if (signal.internalHandle.win32Event == nullptr) {
6952  return false;
6953  }
6954  HANDLE handle = signal.internalHandle.win32Event;
6955  bool result = (WaitForSingleObject(handle, maxMilliseconds < UINT32_MAX ? maxMilliseconds : INFINITE) == WAIT_OBJECT_0);
6956  return(result);
6957  }
6958 
6959  fpl_api bool SignalWaitForAll(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal *signals[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6960  bool result = platform::Win32SignalWaitForMultiple((ThreadSignal **)signals, count, true, maxMilliseconds);
6961  return(result);
6962  }
6963 
6964  fpl_api bool SignalWaitForAny(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal *signals[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds) {
6965  bool result = platform::Win32SignalWaitForMultiple((ThreadSignal **)signals, count, false, maxMilliseconds);
6966  return(result);
6967  }
6968 
6969  fpl_api bool SignalWakeUp(ThreadSignal &signal) {
6970  if (signal.internalHandle.win32Event == nullptr) {
6971  return false;
6972  }
6973  HANDLE handle = signal.internalHandle.win32Event;
6974  bool result = SetEvent(handle) == TRUE;
6975  return(result);
6976  }
6977 
6978  fpl_api bool SignalReset(ThreadSignal &signal) {
6979  if (signal.internalHandle.win32Event == nullptr) {
6980  return false;
6981  }
6982  HANDLE handle = signal.internalHandle.win32Event;
6983  bool result = ResetEvent(handle) == TRUE;
6984  return(result);
6985  }
6986 
6987  } // threading
6988 
6989  //
6990  // Win32 Memory
6991  //
6992  namespace memory {
6993  fpl_api void *MemoryAllocate(const size_t size) {
6994  if (size == 0) {
6995  common::PushError("Size parameter must be greater than zero");
6996  return nullptr;
6997  }
6998  void *result = VirtualAlloc(0, size, MEM_RESERVE | MEM_COMMIT, PAGE_READWRITE);
6999  if (result == nullptr) {
7000  common::PushError("Failed allocating memory of %xu bytes", size);
7001  }
7002  return(result);
7003  }
7004 
7005  fpl_api void MemoryFree(void *ptr) {
7006  if (ptr == nullptr) {
7007  common::PushError("Pointer parameter are not allowed to be null");
7008  }
7009  VirtualFree(ptr, 0, MEM_FREE);
7010  }
7011 
7012  fpl_api void *MemoryStackAllocate(const size_t size) {
7013  if (size == 0) {
7014  common::PushError("Size parameter must be greater than zero");
7015  return nullptr;
7016  }
7017  void *result = _malloca(size);
7018  return(result);
7019  }
7020  } // memory
7021 
7022  //
7023  // Win32 Files
7024  //
7025  namespace files {
7026  fpl_api FileHandle OpenBinaryFile(const char *filePath) {
7027  FileHandle result = {};
7028  if (filePath != nullptr) {
7029  HANDLE win32FileHandle = CreateFileA(filePath, GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, nullptr, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, nullptr);
7030  if (win32FileHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7031  result.isValid = true;
7032  result.internalHandle.win32Handle = (void *)win32FileHandle;
7033  }
7034  }
7035  return(result);
7036  }
7037  fpl_api FileHandle OpenBinaryFile(const wchar_t *filePath) {
7038  FileHandle result = {};
7039  if (filePath != nullptr) {
7040  HANDLE win32FileHandle = CreateFileW(filePath, GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, nullptr, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, nullptr);
7041  if (win32FileHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7042  result.isValid = true;
7043  result.internalHandle.win32Handle = (void *)win32FileHandle;
7044  }
7045  }
7046  return(result);
7047  }
7048 
7049  fpl_api FileHandle CreateBinaryFile(const char *filePath) {
7050  FileHandle result = {};
7051  if (filePath != nullptr) {
7052  HANDLE win32FileHandle = CreateFileA(filePath, GENERIC_WRITE, FILE_SHARE_WRITE, nullptr, CREATE_ALWAYS, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, nullptr);
7053  if (win32FileHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7054  result.isValid = true;
7055  result.internalHandle.win32Handle = (void *)win32FileHandle;
7056  }
7057  }
7058  return(result);
7059  }
7060  fpl_api FileHandle CreateBinaryFile(const wchar_t *filePath) {
7061  FileHandle result = {};
7062  if (filePath != nullptr) {
7063  HANDLE win32FileHandle = CreateFileW(filePath, GENERIC_WRITE, FILE_SHARE_WRITE, nullptr, CREATE_ALWAYS, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, nullptr);
7064  if (win32FileHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7065  result.isValid = true;
7066  result.internalHandle.win32Handle = (void *)win32FileHandle;
7067  }
7068  }
7069  return(result);
7070  }
7071 
7072  fpl_api uint32_t ReadFileBlock32(const FileHandle &fileHandle, const uint32_t sizeToRead, void *targetBuffer, const uint32_t maxTargetBufferSize) {
7073  if (sizeToRead == 0) {
7074  return 0;
7075  }
7076  if (targetBuffer == nullptr) {
7077  common::PushError("Target buffer parameter are now allowed to be null");
7078  return 0;
7079  }
7080  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle == nullptr) {
7081  common::PushError("File handle is not opened for reading");
7082  return 0;
7083  }
7084  uint32_t result = 0;
7085  HANDLE win32FileHandle = (HANDLE)fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7086  DWORD bytesRead = 0;
7087  if (ReadFile(win32FileHandle, targetBuffer, (DWORD)sizeToRead, &bytesRead, nullptr) == TRUE) {
7088  result = bytesRead;
7089  }
7090  return(result);
7091  }
7092 
7093  fpl_api uint32_t WriteFileBlock32(const FileHandle &fileHandle, void *sourceBuffer, const uint32_t sourceSize) {
7094  if (sourceSize == 0) {
7095  common::PushError("Source size parameter must be greater than zero");
7096  return 0;
7097  }
7098  if (sourceBuffer == nullptr) {
7099  common::PushError("Source buffer parameter are now allowed to be null");
7100  return 0;
7101  }
7102  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle == nullptr) {
7103  common::PushError("File handle is not opened for writing");
7104  return 0;
7105  }
7106  uint32_t result = 0;
7107  HANDLE win32FileHandle = (HANDLE)fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7108  DWORD bytesWritten = 0;
7109  if (WriteFile(win32FileHandle, sourceBuffer, (DWORD)sourceSize, &bytesWritten, nullptr) == TRUE) {
7110  result = bytesWritten;
7111  }
7112  return(result);
7113  }
7114 
7115  fpl_api void SetFilePosition32(const FileHandle &fileHandle, const int32_t position, const FilePositionMode mode) {
7116  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7117  HANDLE win32FileHandle = (void *)fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7118  DWORD moveMethod = FILE_BEGIN;
7119  if (mode == FilePositionMode::Current) {
7120  moveMethod = FILE_CURRENT;
7121  } else if (mode == FilePositionMode::End) {
7122  moveMethod = FILE_END;
7123  }
7124  SetFilePointer(win32FileHandle, (LONG)position, nullptr, moveMethod);
7125  }
7126  }
7127 
7128  fpl_api uint32_t GetFilePosition32(const FileHandle &fileHandle) {
7129  uint32_t result = 0;
7130  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7131  HANDLE win32FileHandle = (void *)fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7132  DWORD filePosition = SetFilePointer(win32FileHandle, 0L, nullptr, FILE_CURRENT);
7133  if (filePosition != INVALID_SET_FILE_POINTER) {
7134  result = filePosition;
7135  }
7136  }
7137  return(result);
7138  }
7139 
7140  fpl_api void CloseFile(FileHandle &fileHandle) {
7141  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7142  HANDLE win32FileHandle = (void *)fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7143  CloseHandle(win32FileHandle);
7144  fileHandle = {};
7145  }
7146  }
7147 
7148  fpl_api uint32_t GetFileSize32(const char *filePath) {
7149  uint32_t result = 0;
7150  if (filePath != nullptr) {
7151  HANDLE win32FileHandle = CreateFileA(filePath, GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, nullptr, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, nullptr);
7152  if (win32FileHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7153  DWORD fileSize = GetFileSize(win32FileHandle, nullptr);
7154  result = fileSize;
7155  CloseHandle(win32FileHandle);
7156  }
7157  }
7158  return(result);
7159  }
7160 
7161  fpl_api uint32_t GetFileSize32(const FileHandle &fileHandle) {
7162  uint32_t result = 0;
7163  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7164  HANDLE win32FileHandle = (void *)fileHandle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7165  DWORD fileSize = GetFileSize(win32FileHandle, nullptr);
7166  result = fileSize;
7167  }
7168  return(result);
7169  }
7170 
7171  fpl_api bool FileExists(const char *filePath) {
7172  bool result = false;
7173  if (filePath != nullptr) {
7174  WIN32_FIND_DATAA findData;
7175  HANDLE searchHandle = FindFirstFileA(filePath, &findData);
7176  if (searchHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7177  result = !(findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY);
7178  FindClose(searchHandle);
7179  }
7180  }
7181  return(result);
7182  }
7183 
7184  fpl_api bool FileCopy(const char *sourceFilePath, const char *targetFilePath, const bool overwrite) {
7185  if (sourceFilePath == nullptr) {
7186  common::PushError("Source file path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7187  return false;
7188  }
7189  if (targetFilePath == nullptr) {
7190  common::PushError("Target file path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7191  return false;
7192  }
7193  bool result = (CopyFileA(sourceFilePath, targetFilePath, !overwrite) == TRUE);
7194  return(result);
7195  }
7196 
7197  fpl_api bool FileDelete(const char *filePath) {
7198  if (filePath == nullptr) {
7199  common::PushError("File path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7200  return false;
7201  }
7202  bool result = (DeleteFileA(filePath) == TRUE);
7203  return(result);
7204  }
7205 
7206  fpl_api bool DirectoryExists(const char *path) {
7207  bool result = false;
7208  if (path != nullptr) {
7209  WIN32_FIND_DATAA findData;
7210  HANDLE searchHandle = FindFirstFileA(path, &findData);
7211  if (searchHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7212  result = (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) > 0;
7213  FindClose(searchHandle);
7214  }
7215  }
7216  return(result);
7217  }
7218 
7219  fpl_api bool CreateDirectories(const char *path) {
7220  if (path == nullptr) {
7221  common::PushError("Path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7222  return false;
7223  }
7224  bool result = CreateDirectoryA(path, nullptr) > 0;
7225  return(result);
7226  }
7227  fpl_api bool RemoveEmptyDirectory(const char *path) {
7228  if (path == nullptr) {
7229  common::PushError("Path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7230  return false;
7231  }
7232  bool result = RemoveDirectoryA(path) > 0;
7233  return(result);
7234  }
7235  fpl_internal_inline void Win32FillFileEntry(const WIN32_FIND_DATAA &findData, FileEntry &entry) {
7236  strings::CopyAnsiString(findData.cFileName, strings::GetAnsiStringLength(findData.cFileName), entry.path, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(entry.path));
7237 
7238  entry.type = FileEntryType::Unknown;
7239  if (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) {
7240  entry.type = FileEntryType::Directory;
7241  } else if (
7242  (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL) ||
7243  (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN) ||
7244  (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY) ||
7245  (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE) ||
7246  (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM)) {
7247  entry.type = FileEntryType::File;
7248  }
7249 
7250  entry.attributes = FileAttributeFlags::None;
7251  if (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL) {
7252  entry.attributes = FileAttributeFlags::Normal;
7253  } else {
7254  if (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN) {
7255  entry.attributes |= FileAttributeFlags::Hidden;
7256  }
7257  if (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY) {
7258  entry.attributes |= FileAttributeFlags::ReadOnly;
7259  }
7260  if (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE) {
7261  entry.attributes |= FileAttributeFlags::Archive;
7262  }
7263  if (findData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM) {
7264  entry.attributes |= FileAttributeFlags::System;
7265  }
7266  }
7267  }
7268  fpl_api bool ListFilesBegin(const char *pathAndFilter, FileEntry &firstEntry) {
7269  if (pathAndFilter == nullptr) {
7270  return false;
7271  }
7272  bool result = false;
7273  WIN32_FIND_DATAA findData;
7274  HANDLE searchHandle = FindFirstFileA(pathAndFilter, &findData);
7275  if (searchHandle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7276  firstEntry = {};
7277  firstEntry.internalHandle.win32Handle = searchHandle;
7278  Win32FillFileEntry(findData, firstEntry);
7279  result = true;
7280  }
7281  return(result);
7282  }
7283  fpl_api bool ListFilesNext(FileEntry &nextEntry) {
7284  bool result = false;
7285  if (nextEntry.internalHandle.win32Handle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7286  HANDLE searchHandle = nextEntry.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7287  WIN32_FIND_DATAA findData;
7288  if (FindNextFileA(searchHandle, &findData)) {
7289  Win32FillFileEntry(findData, nextEntry);
7290  result = true;
7291  }
7292  }
7293  return(result);
7294  }
7295  fpl_api void ListFilesEnd(FileEntry &lastEntry) {
7296  if (lastEntry.internalHandle.win32Handle != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
7297  HANDLE searchHandle = lastEntry.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7298  FindClose(searchHandle);
7299  lastEntry = {};
7300  }
7301  }
7302  } // files
7303 
7304  //
7305  // Win32 Path/Directories
7306  //
7307  namespace paths {
7308 # if defined(UNICODE)
7309  fpl_api char *GetExecutableFilePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
7310  if (destPath == nullptr) {
7311  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7312  return nullptr;
7313  }
7314  if (maxDestLen < (MAX_PATH + 1)) {
7315  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, MAX_PATH + 1);
7316  return nullptr;
7317  }
7318  wchar_t modulePath[MAX_PATH];
7319  GetModuleFileNameW(nullptr, modulePath, MAX_PATH);
7320  strings::WideStringToAnsiString(modulePath, strings::GetWideStringLength(modulePath), destPath, maxDestLen);
7321  return(destPath);
7322  }
7323 # else
7324  fpl_api char *GetExecutableFilePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
7325  if (destPath == nullptr) {
7326  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7327  return nullptr;
7328  }
7329  if (maxDestLen < (MAX_PATH + 1)) {
7330  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, MAX_PATH + 1);
7331  return nullptr;
7332  }
7333  char modulePath[MAX_PATH];
7334  GetModuleFileNameA(nullptr, modulePath, MAX_PATH);
7335  strings::CopyAnsiString(modulePath, strings::GetAnsiStringLength(modulePath), destPath, maxDestLen);
7336  return(destPath);
7337  }
7338 # endif // UNICODE
7339 
7340 # if defined(UNICODE)
7341  fpl_api char *GetHomePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
7342  if (destPath == nullptr) {
7343  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7344  return nullptr;
7345  }
7346  if (maxDestLen < (MAX_PATH + 1)) {
7347  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, MAX_PATH + 1);
7348  return nullptr;
7349  }
7350  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &api = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7351  wchar_t homePath[MAX_PATH];
7352  api.shell.shGetFolderPathW(nullptr, CSIDL_PROFILE, nullptr, 0, homePath);
7353  strings::WideStringToAnsiString(homePath, strings::GetWideStringLength(homePath), destPath, maxDestLen);
7354  return(destPath);
7355  }
7356 # else
7357  fpl_api char *GetHomePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
7358  if (destPath == nullptr) {
