7359  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
7360  return nullptr;
7361  }
7362  if (maxDestLen < (MAX_PATH + 1)) {
7363  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, MAX_PATH + 1);
7364  return nullptr;
7365  }
7366  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &api = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7367  char homePath[MAX_PATH];
7368  api.shell.shGetFolderPathA(nullptr, CSIDL_PROFILE, nullptr, 0, homePath);
7369  strings::CopyAnsiString(homePath, strings::GetAnsiStringLength(homePath), destPath, maxDestLen);
7370  return(destPath);
7371  }
7372 # endif // UNICODE
7373  } // paths
7374 
7375  //
7376  // Win32 Timings
7377  //
7378  namespace timings {
7379  fpl_api double GetHighResolutionTimeInSeconds() {
7380  LARGE_INTEGER time;
7381  QueryPerformanceCounter(&time);
7382  double result = time.QuadPart / (double)platform::global__Win32__AppState.performanceFrequency.QuadPart;
7383  return(result);
7384  }
7385  } // timings
7386 
7387  //
7388  // Win32 Strings
7389  //
7390  namespace strings {
7391  fpl_api char *WideStringToAnsiString(const wchar_t *wideSource, const uint32_t maxWideSourceLen, char *ansiDest, const uint32_t maxAnsiDestLen) {
7392  if (wideSource == nullptr) {
7393  common::PushError("Wide source parameter are not allowed to be null");
7394  return nullptr;
7395  }
7396  if (ansiDest == nullptr) {
7397  common::PushError("Ansi dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
7398  return nullptr;
7399  }
7400  uint32_t requiredLen = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen, nullptr, 0, nullptr, nullptr);
7401  if (maxAnsiDestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
7402  common::PushError("Max ansi dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than ''", maxAnsiDestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
7403  return nullptr;
7404  }
7405  WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen, ansiDest, maxAnsiDestLen, nullptr, nullptr);
7406  ansiDest[requiredLen] = 0;
7407  return(ansiDest);
7408  }
7409  fpl_api char *WideStringToUTF8String(const wchar_t *wideSource, const uint32_t maxWideSourceLen, char *utf8Dest, const uint32_t maxUtf8DestLen) {
7410  if (wideSource == nullptr) {
7411  common::PushError("Wide source parameter are not allowed to be null");
7412  return nullptr;
7413  }
7414  if (utf8Dest == nullptr) {
7415  common::PushError("UTF8 dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
7416  return nullptr;
7417  }
7418  uint32_t requiredLen = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen, nullptr, 0, nullptr, nullptr);
7419  if (maxUtf8DestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
7420  common::PushError("Max utf8 dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than ''", maxUtf8DestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
7421  return nullptr;
7422  }
7423  WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen, utf8Dest, maxUtf8DestLen, nullptr, nullptr);
7424  utf8Dest[requiredLen] = 0;
7425  return(utf8Dest);
7426  }
7427  fpl_api wchar_t *AnsiStringToWideString(const char *ansiSource, const uint32_t ansiSourceLen, wchar_t *wideDest, const uint32_t maxWideDestLen) {
7428  if (ansiSource == nullptr) {
7429  common::PushError("Ansi source parameter are not allowed to be null");
7430  return nullptr;
7431  }
7432  if (wideDest == nullptr) {
7433  common::PushError("Wide dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
7434  return nullptr;
7435  }
7436  uint32_t requiredLen = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, ansiSource, ansiSourceLen, nullptr, 0);
7437  if (maxWideDestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
7438  common::PushError("Max wide dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxWideDestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
7439  return nullptr;
7440  }
7441  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, ansiSource, ansiSourceLen, wideDest, maxWideDestLen);
7442  wideDest[requiredLen] = 0;
7443  return(wideDest);
7444  }
7445  fpl_api wchar_t *UTF8StringToWideString(const char *utf8Source, const uint32_t utf8SourceLen, wchar_t *wideDest, const uint32_t maxWideDestLen) {
7446  if (utf8Source == nullptr) {
7447  common::PushError("UTF8 source parameter are not allowed to be null");
7448  return nullptr;
7449  }
7450  if (wideDest == nullptr) {
7451  common::PushError("Wide dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
7452  return nullptr;
7453  }
7454  uint32_t requiredLen = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, utf8Source, utf8SourceLen, nullptr, 0);
7455  if (maxWideDestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
7456  common::PushError("Max wide dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxWideDestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
7457  return nullptr;
7458  }
7459  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, utf8Source, utf8SourceLen, wideDest, maxWideDestLen);
7460  wideDest[requiredLen] = 0;
7461  return(wideDest);
7462  }
7463  fpl_api char *FormatAnsiString(char *ansiDestBuffer, const uint32_t maxAnsiDestBufferLen, const char *format, ...) {
7464  if (ansiDestBuffer == nullptr) {
7465  common::PushError("Ansi dest buffer parameter are not allowed to be null");
7466  return nullptr;
7467  }
7468  if (maxAnsiDestBufferLen == 0) {
7469  common::PushError("Max ansi dest len parameter must be greater that zero");
7470  return nullptr;
7471  }
7472  if (format == nullptr) {
7473  common::PushError("Format parameter are not allowed to be null");
7474  return nullptr;
7475  }
7476  va_list argList;
7477  va_start(argList, format);
7478  // @NOTE(final): Need to clear the first character, otherwise vsnprintf() does weird things... O_o
7479  ansiDestBuffer[0] = 0;
7480  int charCount = vsnprintf(ansiDestBuffer, maxAnsiDestBufferLen, format, argList);
7481  if (charCount < 0) {
7482  common::PushError("Format parameter are '%s' are invalid!", format);
7483  return nullptr;
7484  }
7485  if ((int)maxAnsiDestBufferLen < (charCount + 1)) {
7486  common::PushError("Max ansi dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxAnsiDestBufferLen, (charCount + 1));
7487  return nullptr;
7488  }
7489  va_end(argList);
7490  FPL_ASSERT(charCount > 0);
7491  ansiDestBuffer[charCount] = 0;
7492  char *result = ansiDestBuffer;
7493  return(result);
7494  }
7495  } // strings
7496 
7497  //
7498  // Win32 Library
7499  //
7500  namespace library {
7501  fpl_api DynamicLibraryHandle DynamicLibraryLoad(const char *libraryFilePath) {
7502  DynamicLibraryHandle result = {};
7503  if (libraryFilePath != nullptr) {
7504  HMODULE libModule = LoadLibraryA(libraryFilePath);
7505  if (libModule != nullptr) {
7506  result.internalHandle.win32Handle = libModule;
7507  result.isValid = true;
7508  }
7509  }
7510  return(result);
7511  }
7512  fpl_api void *GetDynamicLibraryProc(const DynamicLibraryHandle &handle, const char *name) {
7513  void *result = nullptr;
7514  if (handle.internalHandle.win32Handle != nullptr && name != nullptr) {
7515  HMODULE libModule = handle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7516  result = (void *)GetProcAddress(libModule, name);
7517  }
7518  return(result);
7519  }
7520  fpl_api void DynamicLibraryUnload(DynamicLibraryHandle &handle) {
7521  if (handle.internalHandle.win32Handle != nullptr) {
7522  HMODULE libModule = (HMODULE)handle.internalHandle.win32Handle;
7523  FreeLibrary(libModule);
7524  handle = {};
7525  }
7526  }
7527  } // library
7528 
7529  //
7530  // Win32 Video
7531  //
7532 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
7533  namespace video {
7534  fpl_api VideoBackBuffer *GetVideoBackBuffer() {
7535  VideoBackBuffer *result = nullptr;
7536  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7537  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7538 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
7539  platform::Win32VideoState &video = state->video;
7540  if (video.activeVideoDriver == VideoDriverType::Software) {
7541  result = &video.software.context;
7542  }
7543 # endif
7544  return(result);
7545  }
7546 
7547  fpl_api VideoDriverType GetVideoDriver() {
7548  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7549  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7550  VideoDriverType result = state->video.activeVideoDriver;
7551  return(result);
7552  }
7553 
7554  fpl_api bool ResizeVideoBackBuffer(const uint32_t width, const uint32_t height) {
7555  bool result = false;
7556  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7557  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7558 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
7559  if (state->video.activeVideoDriver == VideoDriverType::Software) {
7560  Win32ReleaseVideoSoftware(state);
7561  result = Win32InitVideoSoftware(state, width, height);
7562  }
7563 # endif
7564  return (result);
7565  }
7566  } // video
7567 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
7568 
7569 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
7570  //
7571  // Win32 Window
7572  //
7573  namespace window {
7574  fpl_api void WindowFlip() {
7575  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7576  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7577  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7578  platform::Win32VideoState &video = state->video;
7579  switch (video.activeVideoDriver) {
7580 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
7581  case VideoDriverType::Software:
7582  {
7583  WindowSize area = GetWindowArea();
7584  int32_t targetX = 0;
7585  int32_t targetY = 0;
7586  int32_t targetWidth = area.width;
7587  int32_t targetHeight = area.height;
7588  int32_t sourceWidth = video.software.context.width;
7589  int32_t sourceHeight = video.software.context.height;
7590  if (video.software.context.useOutputRect) {
7591  targetX = video.software.context.outputRect.x;
7592  targetY = video.software.context.outputRect.y;
7593  targetWidth = video.software.context.outputRect.width;
7594  targetHeight = video.software.context.outputRect.height;
7595  wapi.gdi.stretchDIBits(state->window.deviceContext, 0, 0, area.width, area.height, 0, 0, 0, 0, nullptr, nullptr, DIB_RGB_COLORS, BLACKNESS);
7596  }
7597  wapi.gdi.stretchDIBits(state->window.deviceContext, targetX, targetY, targetWidth, targetHeight, 0, 0, sourceWidth, sourceHeight, video.software.context.pixels, &video.software.bitmapInfo, DIB_RGB_COLORS, SRCCOPY);
7598  } break;
7599 # endif
7600 
7601 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
7602  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
7603  {
7604  wapi.gdi.swapBuffers(state->window.deviceContext);
7605  } break;
7606 # endif
7607 
7608  default:
7609  break;
7610  }
7611  }
7612 
7613  fpl_api WindowSize GetWindowArea() {
7614  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7615  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7616  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7617  WindowSize result = {};
7618  RECT windowRect;
7619  if (wapi.user.getClientRect(state->window.windowHandle, &windowRect)) {
7620  result.width = windowRect.right - windowRect.left;
7621  result.height = windowRect.bottom - windowRect.top;
7622  }
7623  return(result);
7624  }
7625 
7626  fpl_api void SetWindowArea(const uint32_t width, const uint32_t height) {
7627  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7628  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7629  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7630  RECT clientRect, windowRect;
7631  if (wapi.user.getClientRect(state->window.windowHandle, &clientRect) &&
7632  wapi.user.getWindowRect(state->window.windowHandle, &windowRect)) {
7633  int borderWidth = (windowRect.right - windowRect.left) - (clientRect.right - clientRect.left);
7634  int borderHeight = (windowRect.bottom - windowRect.top) - (clientRect.bottom - clientRect.top);
7635  int newWidth = width + borderWidth;
7636  int newHeight = height + borderHeight;
7637  wapi.user.setWindowPos(state->window.windowHandle, 0, 0, 0, newWidth, newHeight, SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOACTIVATE);
7638  }
7639  }
7640 
7641  fpl_api bool IsWindowResizable() {
7642  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7643  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7644  DWORD style = platform::win32_getWindowLong(state->window.windowHandle, GWL_STYLE);
7645  bool result = (style & WS_THICKFRAME) > 0;
7646  return(result);
7647  }
7648 
7649  fpl_api void SetWindowResizeable(const bool value) {
7650  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7651  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7652  if (!state->currentSettings.window.isFullscreen) {
7653  DWORD style;
7654  DWORD exStyle;
7655  if (value) {
7656  style = platform::Win32ResizeableWindowStyle;
7657  exStyle = platform::Win32ResizeableWindowExtendedStyle;
7658  } else {
7659  style = platform::Win32NonResizableWindowStyle;
7660  exStyle = platform::Win32NonResizableWindowExtendedStyle;
7661  }
7662  platform::win32_setWindowLong(state->window.windowHandle, GWL_STYLE, style);
7663  platform::win32_setWindowLong(state->window.windowHandle, GWL_EXSTYLE, exStyle);
7664  state->currentSettings.window.isResizable = value;
7665  }
7666  }
7667 
7668  fpl_api bool IsWindowFullscreen() {
7669  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7670  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7671  HWND windowHandle = state->window.windowHandle;
7672  DWORD style = platform::win32_getWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_STYLE);
7673  bool result = (style & platform::Win32FullscreenWindowStyle) > 0;
7674  return(result);
7675  }
7676 
7677  fpl_api bool SetWindowFullscreen(const bool value, const uint32_t fullscreenWidth, const uint32_t fullscreenHeight, const uint32_t refreshRate) {
7678  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7679  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7680  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7681  WindowSettings &windowSettings = state->currentSettings.window;
7682  platform::Win32LastWindowInfo *fullscreenState = &state->window.lastFullscreenInfo;
7683 
7684  HWND windowHandle = state->window.windowHandle;
7685 
7686  // Save current window info if not already fullscreen
7687  if (!windowSettings.isFullscreen) {
7688  fullscreenState->isMaximized = !!wapi.user.isZoomed(windowHandle);
7689  if (fullscreenState->isMaximized) {
7690  platform::win32_sendMessage(windowHandle, WM_SYSCOMMAND, SC_RESTORE, 0);
7691  }
7692  fullscreenState->style = platform::win32_getWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_STYLE);
7693  fullscreenState->exStyle = platform::win32_getWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_EXSTYLE);
7694  wapi.user.getWindowPlacement(windowHandle, &fullscreenState->placement);
7695  //wapi.user.getWindowRect(windowHandle, &fullscreenState->rect);
7696  }
7697 
7698  if (value) {
7699  // Enter fullscreen mode or fallback to window mode
7700  windowSettings.isFullscreen = platform::Win32EnterFullscreen(fullscreenWidth, fullscreenHeight, refreshRate, 0);
7701  if (!windowSettings.isFullscreen) {
7702  platform::Win32LeaveFullscreen();
7703  }
7704  } else {
7705  platform::Win32LeaveFullscreen();
7706  windowSettings.isFullscreen = false;
7707  }
7708  return(windowSettings.isFullscreen);
7709  }
7710 
7711  fpl_api WindowPosition GetWindowPosition() {
7712  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7713  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7714  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7715  WindowPosition result = {};
7716  WINDOWPLACEMENT placement = {};
7717  placement.length = sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT);
7718  if (wapi.user.getWindowPlacement(state->window.windowHandle, &placement) == TRUE) {
7719  switch (placement.showCmd) {
7720  case SW_MAXIMIZE:
7721  {
7722  result.left = placement.ptMaxPosition.x;
7723  result.top = placement.ptMaxPosition.y;
7724  } break;
7725  case SW_MINIMIZE:
7726  {
7727  result.left = placement.ptMinPosition.x;
7728  result.top = placement.ptMinPosition.y;
7729  } break;
7730  default:
7731  {
7732  result.left = placement.rcNormalPosition.left;
7733  result.top = placement.rcNormalPosition.top;
7734  } break;
7735  }
7736  }
7737  return(result);
7738  }
7739 
7740  fpl_api void SetWindowTitle(const char *title) {
7741  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7742  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7743  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7744  HWND handle = state->window.windowHandle;
7745 
7746  // @FIXME(final): This is not correct to set a ansi text, in unicode we have to use the Wide version!
7747  wapi.user.setWindowTextA(handle, title);
7748  }
7749 
7750  fpl_api void SetWindowPosition(const int32_t left, const int32_t top) {
7751  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7752  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7753  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7754  WINDOWPLACEMENT placement = {};
7755  placement.length = sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT);
7756  RECT windowRect;
7757  if (wapi.user.getWindowPlacement(state->window.windowHandle, &placement) &&
7758  wapi.user.getWindowRect(state->window.windowHandle, &windowRect)) {
7759  switch (placement.showCmd) {
7760  case SW_NORMAL:
7761  case SW_SHOW:
7762  {
7763  placement.rcNormalPosition.left = left;
7764  placement.rcNormalPosition.top = top;
7765  placement.rcNormalPosition.right = placement.rcNormalPosition.left + (windowRect.right - windowRect.left);
7766  placement.rcNormalPosition.bottom = placement.rcNormalPosition.top + (windowRect.bottom - windowRect.top);
7767  wapi.user.setWindowPlacement(state->window.windowHandle, &placement);
7768  } break;
7769  }
7770  }
7771  }
7772 
7773  fpl_api void SetWindowCursorEnabled(const bool value) {
7774  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7775  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7776  state->window.isCursorActive = value;
7777  }
7778 
7779  fpl_api bool WindowUpdate() {
7780  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7781  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7782  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7783  bool result = false;
7784 
7785  // Poll gamepad controller states
7786  platform::Win32PollControllers(state);
7787 
7788  // Poll window events
7789  if (state->window.windowHandle != 0) {
7790  MSG msg;
7791  while (platform::win32_peekMessage(&msg, nullptr, 0, 0, PM_REMOVE) != 0) {
7792  wapi.user.translateMessage(&msg);
7793  platform::win32_dispatchMessage(&msg);
7794  }
7795  result = state->window.isRunning;
7796  }
7797 
7798  return(result);
7799  }
7800 
7801  fpl_api bool IsWindowRunning() {
7802  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7803  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7804  bool result = state->window.isRunning;
7805  return(result);
7806  }
7807 
7808  fpl_api bool PollWindowEvent(Event &ev) {
7809  platform::EventQueue *eventQueue = platform::global__EventQueue;
7810  FPL_ASSERT(eventQueue != nullptr);
7811  bool result = false;
7812  if (eventQueue->pushCount > 0 && (eventQueue->pollIndex < eventQueue->pushCount)) {
7813  uint32_t eventIndex = atomics::AtomicAddU32(&eventQueue->pollIndex, 1);
7814  ev = eventQueue->events[eventIndex];
7815  result = true;
7816  } else if (eventQueue->pushCount > 0) {
7817  atomics::AtomicExchangeU32(&eventQueue->pollIndex, 0);
7818  atomics::AtomicExchangeU32(&eventQueue->pushCount, 0);
7819  }
7820  return result;
7821  }
7822 
7823  fpl_api char *GetClipboardAnsiText(char *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
7824  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7825  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7826  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7827  char *result = nullptr;
7828  if (wapi.user.openClipboard(state->window.windowHandle)) {
7829  if (wapi.user.isClipboardFormatAvailable(CF_TEXT)) {
7830  HGLOBAL dataHandle = wapi.user.getClipboardData(CF_TEXT);
7831  if (dataHandle != nullptr) {
7832  const char *stringValue = (const char *)GlobalLock(dataHandle);
7833  result = strings::CopyAnsiString(stringValue, dest, maxDestLen);
7834  GlobalUnlock(dataHandle);
7835  }
7836  }
7837  wapi.user.closeClipboard();
7838  }
7839  return(result);
7840  }
7841 
7842  fpl_api wchar_t *GetClipboardWideText(wchar_t *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
7843  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7844  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7845  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7846  wchar_t *result = nullptr;
7847  if (wapi.user.openClipboard(state->window.windowHandle)) {
7848  if (wapi.user.isClipboardFormatAvailable(CF_UNICODETEXT)) {
7849  HGLOBAL dataHandle = wapi.user.getClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT);
7850  if (dataHandle != nullptr) {
7851  const wchar_t *stringValue = (const wchar_t *)GlobalLock(dataHandle);
7852  result = strings::CopyWideString(stringValue, dest, maxDestLen);
7853  GlobalUnlock(dataHandle);
7854  }
7855  }
7856  wapi.user.closeClipboard();
7857  }
7858  return(result);
7859  }
7860 
7861  fpl_api bool SetClipboardText(const char *ansiSource) {
7862  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7863  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7864  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7865  bool result = false;
7866  if (wapi.user.openClipboard(state->window.windowHandle)) {
7867  const uint32_t ansiLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(ansiSource);
7868  const uint32_t ansiBufferLen = ansiLen + 1;
7869  HGLOBAL handle = GlobalAlloc(GMEM_MOVEABLE, (SIZE_T)ansiBufferLen * sizeof(char));
7870  if (handle != nullptr) {
7871  char *target = (char*)GlobalLock(handle);
7872  strings::CopyAnsiString(ansiSource, ansiLen, target, ansiBufferLen);
7873  GlobalUnlock(handle);
7874  wapi.user.emptyClipboard();
7875  wapi.user.setClipboardData(CF_TEXT, handle);
7876  result = true;
7877  }
7878  wapi.user.closeClipboard();
7879  }
7880  return(result);
7881  }
7882 
7883  fpl_api bool SetClipboardText(const wchar_t *wideSource) {
7884  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7885  platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7886  platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions;
7887  bool result = false;
7888  if (wapi.user.openClipboard(state->window.windowHandle)) {
7889  const uint32_t wideLen = strings::GetWideStringLength(wideSource);
7890  const uint32_t wideBufferLen = wideLen + 1;
7891  HGLOBAL handle = GlobalAlloc(GMEM_MOVEABLE, (SIZE_T)wideBufferLen * sizeof(wchar_t));
7892  if (handle != nullptr) {
7893  wchar_t *wideTarget = (wchar_t*)GlobalLock(handle);
7894  strings::CopyWideString(wideSource, wideLen, wideTarget, wideBufferLen);
7895  GlobalUnlock(handle);
7896  wapi.user.emptyClipboard();
7897  wapi.user.setClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT, handle);
7898  result = true;
7899  }
7900  wapi.user.closeClipboard();
7901  }
7902  return(result);
7903  }
7904  } // window
7905 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
7906 
7907  //
7908  // Error state
7909  //
7910  fpl_api const Settings &GetCurrentSettings() {
7911  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
7912  const platform::Win32State *state = platform::global__Win32__State;
7913  return (state->currentSettings);
7914  }
7915 
7916  fpl_api void ReleasePlatform() {
7917  if (!platform::global__Win32__AppState.isInitialized) {
7918  common::PushError("Platform is not initialized");
7919  return;
7920  }
7921  platform::Win32ReleasePlatform();
7922  }
7923 
7924  fpl_api bool InitPlatform(const InitFlags initFlags, const Settings &initSettings) {
7925  if (platform::global__Win32__AppState.isInitialized) {
7926  common::PushError("Platform is already initialized");
7927  return false;
7928  }
7929  bool result = platform::Win32InitPlatform(initFlags, initSettings);
7930  return(result);
7931  }
7932 
7933 } // fpl
7934 
7935 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
7936 
7937 # if defined(UNICODE)
7938 
7939 int WINAPI wWinMain(HINSTANCE appInstance, HINSTANCE prevInstance, LPWSTR cmdLine, int cmdShow) {
7940  fpl::platform::Win32CommandLineUTF8Arguments args = fpl::platform::Win32ParseWideArguments(cmdLine);
7941  int result = main(args.count, args.args);
7942  fpl::memory::MemoryFree(args.mem);
7943  return(result);
7944 }
7945 
7946 # else
7947 
7948 int WINAPI WinMain(HINSTANCE appInstance, HINSTANCE prevInstance, LPSTR cmdLine, int cmdShow) {
7949  fpl::platform::Win32CommandLineUTF8Arguments args = fpl::platform::Win32ParseAnsiArguments(cmdLine);
7950  int result = main(args.count, args.args);
7951  fpl::memory::MemoryFree(args.mem);
7952  return(result);
7953 }
7954 # endif // UNICODE
7955 
7956 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
7957 
7958 #endif // FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
7959 
7960 // ****************************************************************************
7961 //
7962 // POSIX Platform (Linux, Unix)
7963 //
7964 // ****************************************************************************
7965 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_POSIX)
7966 #include <sys/mman.h> // mmap, munmap
7967 #include <sys/types.h> // data types
7968 #include <sys/stat.h> // mkdir
7969 #include <stdlib.h> // wcstombs, mbstowcs
7970 #include <time.h> // clock_gettime, nanosleep
7971 #include <stdio.h> // fopen, fclose, fread, fwrite
7972 #include <dlfcn.h> // dlopen, dlclose
7973 
7974 namespace fpl {
7975  //
7976  // POSIX Atomics
7977  //
7978  namespace atomics {
7979 # if defined(FPL_COMPILER_GCC)
7980  // @NOTE(final): See: https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/_005f_005fsync-Builtins.html#g_t_005f_005fsync-Builtins
7981  fpl_api void AtomicReadFence() {
7982  // @TODO(final): Wrong to ensure a full memory fence here!
7983  __sync_synchronize();
7984  }
7985  fpl_api void AtomicWriteFence() {
7986  // @TODO(final): Wrong to ensure a full memory fence here!
7987  __sync_synchronize();
7988  }
7989  fpl_api void AtomicReadWriteFence() {
7990  __sync_synchronize();
7991  }
7992 
7993  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *target, const uint32_t value) {
7994  uint32_t result = __sync_lock_test_and_set(target, value);
7995  __sync_synchronize();
7996  return(result);
7997  }
7998  fpl_api int32_t AtomicExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *target, const int32_t value) {
7999  int32_t result = __sync_lock_test_and_set(target, value);
8000  __sync_synchronize();
8001  return(result);
8002  }
8003  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *target, const uint64_t value) {
8004  uint64_t result = __sync_lock_test_and_set(target, value);
8005  __sync_synchronize();
8006  return(result);
8007  }
8008  fpl_api int64_t AtomicExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *target, const int64_t value) {
8009  int64_t result = __sync_lock_test_and_set(target, value);
8010  __sync_synchronize();
8011  return(result);
8012  }
8013 
8014  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicAddU32(volatile uint32_t *value, const uint32_t addend) {
8015  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
8016  uint32_t result = __sync_fetch_and_add(value, addend);
8017  return (result);
8018  }
8019  fpl_api int32_t AtomicAddS32(volatile int32_t *value, const int32_t addend) {
8020  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
8021  uint32_t result = __sync_fetch_and_add(value, addend);
8022  return (result);
8023  }
8024  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicAddU64(volatile uint64_t *value, const uint64_t addend) {
8025  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
8026  uint32_t result = __sync_fetch_and_add(value, addend);
8027  return (result);
8028  }
8029  fpl_api int64_t AtomicAddS64(volatile int64_t *value, const int64_t addend) {
8030  FPL_ASSERT(value != nullptr);
8031  uint32_t result = __sync_fetch_and_add(value, addend);
8032  return (result);
8033  }
8034 
8035  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange) {
8036  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8037  uint32_t result = __sync_val_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8038  return (result);
8039  }
8040  fpl_api int32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange) {
8041  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8042  int32_t result = __sync_val_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8043  return (result);
8044  }
8045  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange) {
8046  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8047  uint64_t result = __sync_val_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8048  return (result);
8049  }
8050  fpl_api int64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange) {
8051  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8052  int64_t result = __sync_val_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8053  return (result);
8054  }
8055 
8056  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange) {
8057  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8058  bool result = __sync_bool_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8059  return (result);
8060  }
8061  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange) {
8062  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8063  bool result = __sync_bool_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8064  return (result);
8065  }
8066  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange) {
8067  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8068  bool result = __sync_bool_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8069  return (result);
8070  }
8071  fpl_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange) {
8072  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
8073  bool result = __sync_bool_compare_and_swap(dest, comparand, exchange);
8074  return (result);
8075  }
8076 
8077  fpl_api uint32_t AtomicLoadU32(volatile uint32_t *source) {
8078  uint32_t result = __sync_fetch_and_or(source, 0);
8079  return(result);
8080  }
8081  fpl_api uint64_t AtomicLoadU64(volatile uint64_t *source) {
8082  uint64_t result = __sync_fetch_and_or(source, 0);
8083  return(result);
8084  }
8085  fpl_api int32_t AtomicLoadS32(volatile int32_t *source) {
8086  int32_t result = __sync_fetch_and_or(source, 0);
8087  return(result);
8088  }
8089  fpl_api int64_t AtomicLoadS64(volatile int64_t *source) {
8090  int64_t result = __sync_fetch_and_or(source, 0);
8091  return(result);
8092  }
8093 
8094  fpl_api void AtomicStoreU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t value) {
8095  __sync_lock_test_and_set(dest, value);
8096  __sync_synchronize();
8097  }
8098  fpl_api void AtomicStoreU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t value) {
8099  __sync_lock_test_and_set(dest, value);
8100  __sync_synchronize();
8101  }
8102  fpl_api void AtomicStoreS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t value) {
8103  __sync_lock_test_and_set(dest, value);
8104  __sync_synchronize();
8105  }
8106  fpl_api void AtomicStoreS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t value) {
8107  __sync_lock_test_and_set(dest, value);
8108  __sync_synchronize();
8109  }
8110 # else
8111 # error "This POSIX compiler/platform is not supported!"
8112 # endif
8113  }
8114 
8115  //
8116  // POSIX Timings
8117  //
8118  namespace timings {
8119  fpl_api double GetHighResolutionTimeInSeconds() {
8120  // @TODO(final): Do we need to take the performance frequency into account?
8121  timespec t;
8122  clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &t);
8123  double result = (double)t.tv_sec + ((double)t.tv_nsec * 1e-9);
8124  return(result);
8125  }
8126  }
8127 
8128  //
8129  // POSIX Threading
8130  //
8131  namespace threading {
8132  // @TODO(final): Move internal stuff into "platform" namespace!
8133  fpl_internal bool WaitInPosixThreadWhenSuspended(ThreadContext *context) {
8134  if (context->internalHandle.posixWaitState) {
8135  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Suspended);
8136  pthread_mutex_t *mutex = &context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex;
8137  pthread_cond_t *cond = &context->internalHandle.posixWaitCondition;
8138  pthread_mutex_lock(mutex);
8139  pthread_cond_wait(cond, mutex);
8140  pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex);
8141  }
8142  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Running);
8143  bool result = !context->posixStopState;
8144  return(result);
8145  }
8146  fpl_internal void POSIXResumeThread(ThreadContext *context) {
8147  pthread_mutex_t *mutex = &context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex;
8148  pthread_cond_t *cond = &context->internalHandle.posixWaitCondition;
8149  pthread_mutex_lock(mutex);
8150  context->internalHandle.posixWaitState = 0;
8151  phtread_cond_broadcast(cond);
8152  pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex);
8153  }
8154  fpl_internal void POSIXSuspendThread(ThreadContext *context) {
8155  pthread_mutex_t *mutex = &context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex;
8156  pthread_mutex_lock(mutex);
8157  context->internalHandle.posixWaitState = 1;
8158  pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex);
8159  }
8160  fpl_internal void POSIXStopThread(ThreadContext *context) {
8161  pthread_mutex_t *mutex = &context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex;
8162  pthread_cond_t *cond = &context->internalHandle.posixWaitCondition;
8163  pthread_mutex_lock(mutex);
8164  context->internalHandle.posixWaitState = 0;
8165  context->internalHandle.posixStopState = 1;
8166  phtread_cond_broadcast(cond);
8167  pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex);
8168  }
8169 
8170  void *PosixThreadProc(void *data) {
8171  ThreadContext *context = (ThreadContext *)data;
8172  FPL_ASSERT(context != nullptr);
8173  while (atomics::AtomicLoadU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState) == (uint32_t)ThreadState::Running) {
8174  if (!WaitInPosixThreadWhenSuspended(context)) {
8175  break;
8176  }
8177  // @TODO(final): Use a callback for the run function to wait for suspended state
8178  if (context->runFunc != nullptr) {
8179  context->runFunc(*context, context->data);
8180  }
8181  }
8182  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Stopped);
8183  // @TODO(final): Dynamic linking of pthread!
8184  pthread_cond_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitCondition);
8185  pthread_mutex_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex);
8186  *context = {};
8187  pthread_exit(nullptr);
8188  }
8189 
8190  fpl_api ThreadContext *ThreadCreate(run_thread_function *runFunc, void *data, const bool autoStart) {
8191  // @NOTE(final): pthread does not allow to "suspend" or "resume" any thread, this is totally up to the caller. So we use a mutex and a resume condition.
8192  ThreadContext *result = nullptr;
8193  ThreadContext *context = common::GetThreadContext();
8194  if (context != nullptr) {
8195  // @TODO(final): Dynamic linking of pthread!
8196  context->currentState = ThreadState::Suspended;
8197  context->data = data;
8198  // @TODO(final): Better pthread id!
8199  memory::MemoryCopy(&context->posixThread, FPL_MIN(sizeof(context->id), sizeof(context->posixThread)), &context->id);
8200  context->runFunc = runFunc;
8201  context->isValid = true;
8202  context->internalHandle.posixWaitState = 1;
8203 
8204  int err;
8205 
8206  err = pthread_mutex_init(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex, nullptr);
8207  if (err != 0) {
8208  common::PushError("Failed creating pthread mutex, error code: %d", err);
8209  }
8210  if (err == 0) {
8211  err = pthread_cond_init(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitCondition, nullptr);
8212  if (err != 0) {
8213  pthread_mutex_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex);
8214  common::PushError("Failed creating pthread condition, error code: %d", err);
8215  }
8216  }
8217  if (err == 0) {
8218  err = pthread_create(&context->internalHandle.posixThread, nullptr, PosixThreadProc, (void *)context);
8219  if (err != 0) {
8220  pthread_cond_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitCondition);
8221  pthread_mutex_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex);
8222  common::PushError("Failed creating thread, error code: %d", err);
8223  }
8224  }
8225  if (err == 0) {
8226  result = context;
8227 
8228  if (autoStart) {
8229  POSIXResumeThread(context);
8230  }
8231  } else {
8232  context->currentState = ThreadState::Stopped;
8233  }
8234  } else {
8235  common::PushError("All %d threads are in use, you cannot create until you free one", common::MAX_THREAD_COUNT);
8236  }
8237  return(result);
8238  }
8239 
8240  fpl_api void ThreadSleep(const uint32_t milliseconds) {
8241  uint32_t ms;
8242  uint32_t s;
8243  if (milliseconds > 1000) {
8244  s = milliseconds / 1000;
8245  ms = milliseconds % 1000;
8246  } else {
8247  s = 0;
8248  ms = milliseconds;
8249  }
8250  timespec input, output;
8251  input.tv_sec = s;
8252  input.tv_nsec = ms * 1000000;
8253  nanosleep(&input, &output);
8254  }
8255 
8256  fpl_api bool ThreadSuspend(ThreadContext *context) {
8257  if (context == nullptr) {
8258  common::PushError("Context parameter are not allowed to be null");
8259  return false;
8260  }
8261  if (!context->isValid) {
8262  common::PushError("Thread context is not valid");
8263  return false;
8264  }
8265  bool result = false;
8266  if (!context->internalHandle.posixWaitState) {
8267  POSIXSuspendThread(context);
8268  result = true;
8269  }
8270  return(result);
8271  }
8272 
8273  fpl_api bool ThreadResume(ThreadContext *context) {
8274  if (context == nullptr) {
8275  common::PushError("Context parameter are not allowed to be null");
8276  return false;
8277  }
8278  if (!context->isValid) {
8279  common::PushError("Thread context is not valid");
8280  return false;
8281  }
8282  bool result = false;
8283  if (context->internalHandle.posixWaitState) {
8284  POSIXResumeThread(context);
8285  result = true;
8286  }
8287  return(result);
8288  }
8289 
8290  fpl_api void ThreadDestroy(ThreadContext *context) {
8291  if (context != nullptr && context->internalHandle.isValid) {
8292  // @TODO(final): Test if thread is already terminated, only the release the resources.
8293  pthread_cond_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitCondition);
8294  pthread_mutex_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixWaitMutex);
8295  pthread_destroy(&context->internalHandle.posixThread);
8296  // @TODO(final): Is this really needed to use a atomic store for setting the thread state?
8297  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&context->currentState, (uint32_t)ThreadState::Stopped);
8298  *context = {};
8299  }
8300  }
8301  }
8302 
8303  //
8304  // POSIX Library
8305  //
8306  namespace library {
8307  fpl_api DynamicLibraryHandle DynamicLibraryLoad(const char *libraryFilePath) {
8308  DynamicLibraryHandle result = {};
8309  if (libraryFilePath != nullptr) {
8310  void *p = dlopen(libraryFilePath, RTLD_NOW);
8311  if (p != nullptr) {
8312  result.internalHandle.posixHandle = p;
8313  result.isValid = true;
8314  }
8315  }
8316  return(result);
8317  }
8318 
8319  fpl_api void *GetDynamicLibraryProc(const DynamicLibraryHandle &handle, const char *name) {
8320  void *result = nullptr;
8321  if (handle.internalHandle.posixHandle != nullptr && name != nullptr) {
8322  void *p = handle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8323  result = dlsym(p, name);
8324  }
8325  return(result);
8326  }
8327 
8328  fpl_api void DynamicLibraryUnload(DynamicLibraryHandle &handle) {
8329  if (handle.internalHandle.posixHandle != nullptr) {
8330  void *p = handle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8331  dlclose(p);
8332  handle = {};
8333  }
8334  }
8335  }
8336 
8337 
8338  //
8339  // POSIX Console
8340  //
8341  namespace console {
8342  fpl_api void ConsoleOut(const char *text) {
8343  if (text != nullptr) {
8344  fprintf(stdout, "%s", text);
8345  }
8346  }
8347  fpl_api void ConsoleFormatOut(const char *format, ...) {
8348  if (format != nullptr) {
8349  va_list vaList;
8350  va_start(vaList, format);
8351  vfprintf(stdout, format, vaList);
8352  va_end(vaList);
8353  }
8354  }
8355  fpl_api void ConsoleError(const char *text) {
8356  if (text != nullptr) {
8357  fprintf(stderr, "%s", text);
8358  }
8359  }
8360  fpl_api void ConsoleFormatError(const char *format, ...) {
8361  if (format != nullptr) {
8362  va_list vaList;
8363  va_start(vaList, format);
8364  vfprintf(stderr, format, vaList);
8365  va_end(vaList);
8366  }
8367  }
8368  }
8369 
8370  //
8371  // POSIX Memory
8372  //
8373  namespace memory {
8374  fpl_api void *MemoryAllocate(const size_t size) {
8375  // @NOTE(final): MAP_ANONYMOUS ensures that the memory is cleared to zero.
8376 
8377  // Allocate empty memory to hold the size + some arbitary padding + the actual data
8378  size_t newSize = sizeof(size_t) + sizeof(uintptr_t) + size;
8379  void *basePtr = mmap(nullptr, newSize, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_PRIVATE | MAP_ANONYMOUS, -1, 0);
8380 
8381  // Write the size at the beginning
8382  *(size_t *)basePtr = newSize;
8383 
8384  // The resulting address starts after the arbitary padding
8385  void *result = (uint8_t *)basePtr + sizeof(size_t) + sizeof(uintptr_t);
8386  return(result);
8387  }
8388 
8389  fpl_api void MemoryFree(void *ptr) {
8390  // Free the base pointer which is stored to the left at the start of the size_t
8391  void *basePtr = (void *)((uint8_t *)ptr - (sizeof(uintptr_t) + sizeof(size_t)));
8392  size_t storedSize = *(size_t *)basePtr;
8393  munmap(basePtr, storedSize);
8394  }
8395  }
8396 
8397  //
8398  // POSIX Strings
8399  //
8400  namespace strings {
8401  fpl_api char *WideStringToAnsiString(const wchar_t *wideSource, const uint32_t maxWideSourceLen, char *ansiDest, const uint32_t maxAnsiDestLen) {
8402  if (wideSource == nullptr) {
8403  common::PushError("Wide source parameter are not allowed to be null");
8404  return nullptr;
8405  }
8406  if (ansiDest == nullptr) {
8407  common::PushError("Ansi dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
8408  return nullptr;
8409  }
8410  uint32_t requiredLen = wcstombs(nullptr, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen);
8411  if (maxAnsiDestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
8412  common::PushError("Max ansi dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than ''", maxAnsiDestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
8413  return nullptr;
8414  }
8415  wcstombs(ansiDest, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen);
8416  ansiDest[requiredLen] = 0;
8417  return(ansiDest);
8418  }
8419  fpl_api char *WideStringToUTF8String(const wchar_t *wideSource, const uint32_t maxWideSourceLen, char *utf8Dest, const uint32_t maxUtf8DestLen) {
8420  if (wideSource == nullptr) {
8421  common::PushError("Wide source parameter are not allowed to be null");
8422  return nullptr;
8423  }
8424  if (utf8Dest == nullptr) {
8425  common::PushError("UTF8 dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
8426  return nullptr;
8427  }
8428  // @TODO(final): UTF-8!
8429  uint32_t requiredLen = wcstombs(nullptr, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen);
8430  if (maxUtf8DestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
8431  common::PushError("Max utf8 dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than ''", maxUtf8DestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
8432  return nullptr;
8433  }
8434  wcstombs(utf8Dest, wideSource, maxWideSourceLen);
8435  utf8Dest[requiredLen] = 0;
8436  return(utf8Dest);
8437  }
8438  fpl_api wchar_t *AnsiStringToWideString(const char *ansiSource, const uint32_t ansiSourceLen, wchar_t *wideDest, const uint32_t maxWideDestLen) {
8439  if (ansiSource == nullptr) {
8440  common::PushError("Ansi source parameter are not allowed to be null");
8441  return nullptr;
8442  }
8443  if (wideDest == nullptr) {
8444  common::PushError("Wide dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
8445  return nullptr;
8446  }
8447  uint32_t requiredLen = mbstowcs(nullptr, ansiSource, ansiSourceLen);
8448  if (maxWideDestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
8449  common::PushError("Max wide dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxWideDestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
8450  return nullptr;
8451  }
8452  mbstowcs(wideDest, ansiSource, ansiSourceLen);
8453  wideDest[requiredLen] = 0;
8454  return(wideDest);
8455  }
8456  fpl_api wchar_t *UTF8StringToWideString(const char *utf8Source, const uint32_t utf8SourceLen, wchar_t *wideDest, const uint32_t maxWideDestLen) {
8457  if (utf8Source == nullptr) {
8458  common::PushError("UTF8 source parameter are not allowed to be null");
8459  return nullptr;
8460  }
8461  if (wideDest == nullptr) {
8462  common::PushError("Wide dest parameter are not allowed to be null");
8463  return nullptr;
8464  }
8465  // @TODO(final): UTF-8!
8466  uint32_t requiredLen = mbstowcs(nullptr, utf8Source, utf8SourceLen);
8467  if (maxWideDestLen < (requiredLen + 1)) {
8468  common::PushError("Max wide dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxWideDestLen, (requiredLen + 1));
8469  return nullptr;
8470  }
8471  mbstowcs(wideDest, utf8Source, utf8SourceLen);
8472  wideDest[requiredLen] = 0;
8473  return(wideDest);
8474  }
8475  fpl_api char *FormatAnsiString(char *ansiDestBuffer, const uint32_t maxAnsiDestBufferLen, const char *format, ...) {
8476  if (ansiDestBuffer == nullptr) {
8477  common::PushError("Ansi dest buffer parameter are not allowed to be null");
8478  return nullptr;
8479  }
8480  if (maxAnsiDestBufferLen == 0) {
8481  common::PushError("Max ansi dest len parameter must be greater that zero");
8482  return nullptr;
8483  }
8484  if (format == nullptr) {
8485  common::PushError("Format parameter are not allowed to be null");
8486  return nullptr;
8487  }
8488  va_list argList;
8489  va_start(argList, format);
8490  // @NOTE(final): Need to clear the first character, otherwise vsnprintf() does weird things... O_o
8491  ansiDestBuffer[0] = 0;
8492  int charCount = vsnprintf(ansiDestBuffer, maxAnsiDestBufferLen, format, argList);
8493  if (charCount < 0) {
8494  common::PushError("Format parameter are '%s' are invalid!", format);
8495  return nullptr;
8496  }
8497  if ((int)maxAnsiDestBufferLen < (charCount + 1)) {
8498  common::PushError("Max ansi dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxAnsiDestBufferLen, (charCount + 1));
8499  return nullptr;
8500  }
8501  va_end(argList);
8502  FPL_ASSERT(charCount > 0);
8503  ansiDestBuffer[charCount] = 0;
8504  char *result = ansiDestBuffer;
8505  return(result);
8506  }
8507  }
8508 
8509  //
8510  // POSIX Files
8511  //
8512  namespace files {
8513  fpl_api FileHandle OpenBinaryFile(const char *filePath) {
8514  FileHandle result = {};
8515  if (filePath != nullptr) {
8516  FILE *posixFileHandle = fopen(filePath, "rb");
8517  if (posixFileHandle != nullptr) {
8518  result.isValid = true;
8519  result.internalHandle.posixHandle = posixFileHandle;
8520  }
8521  }
8522  return(result);
8523  }
8524  fpl_api FileHandle OpenBinaryFile(const wchar_t *filePath) {
8525  FileHandle result = {};
8526  if (filePath != nullptr) {
8527  char utf8FilePath[1024] = {};
8528  strings::WideStringToAnsiString(filePath, strings::GetWideStringLength(filePath), utf8FilePath, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(utf8FilePath));
8529  result = OpenBinaryFile(utf8FilePath);
8530  }
8531  return(result);
8532  }
8533 
8534  fpl_api FileHandle CreateBinaryFile(const char *filePath) {
8535  FileHandle result = {};
8536  if (filePath != nullptr) {
8537  FILE *posixFileHandle = fopen(filePath, "wb");
8538  if (posixFileHandle != nullptr) {
8539  result.isValid = true;
8540  result.internalHandle.posixHandle = posixFileHandle;
8541  }
8542  }
8543  return(result);
8544  }
8545  fpl_api FileHandle CreateBinaryFile(const wchar_t *filePath) {
8546  FileHandle result = {};
8547  if (filePath != nullptr) {
8548  char utf8FilePath[1024] = {};
8549  strings::WideStringToAnsiString(filePath, strings::GetWideStringLength(filePath), utf8FilePath, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(utf8FilePath));
8550  result = CreateBinaryFile(utf8FilePath);
8551  }
8552  return(result);
8553  }
8554 
8555  fpl_api uint32_t ReadFileBlock32(const FileHandle &fileHandle, const uint32_t sizeToRead, void *targetBuffer, const uint32_t maxTargetBufferSize) {
8556  if (sizeToRead == 0) {
8557  return 0;
8558  }
8559  if (targetBuffer == nullptr) {
8560  common::PushError("Target buffer parameter are now allowed to be null");
8561  return 0;
8562  }
8563  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle == nullptr) {
8564  common::PushError("File handle is not opened for reading");
8565  return 0;
8566  }
8567  uint32_t result = 0;
8568  FILE *posixFileHandle = fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8569  size_t bytesRead = fread(targetBuffer, sizeToRead, 1, posixFileHandle);
8570  result = (uint32_t)bytesRead;
8571  return(result);
8572  }
8573 
8574  fpl_api uint32_t WriteFileBlock32(const FileHandle &fileHandle, void *sourceBuffer, const uint32_t sourceSize) {
8575  if (sourceSize == 0) {
8576  common::PushError("Source size parameter must be greater than zero");
8577  return 0;
8578  }
8579  if (sourceBuffer == nullptr) {
8580  common::PushError("Source buffer parameter are now allowed to be null");
8581  return 0;
8582  }
8583  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle == nullptr) {
8584  common::PushError("File handle is not opened for writing");
8585  return 0;
8586  }
8587  uint32_t result = 0;
8588  FILE *posixFileHandle = fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8589  size_t bytesWritten = fwrite(sourceBuffer, sourceSize, 1, posixFileHandle);
8590  result = (uint32_t)bytesWritten;
8591  return(result);
8592  }
8593 
8594  fpl_api void SetFilePosition32(const FileHandle &fileHandle, const int32_t position, const FilePositionMode mode) {
8595  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle != nullptr) {
8596  FILE *posixFileHandle = fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8597  int origin = SEEK_SET;
8598  if (mode == FilePositionMode::Current) {
8599  origin = SEEK_CUR;
8600  } else if (mode == FilePositionMode::End) {
8601  origin = SEEK_END;
8602  }
8603  fseek(posixFileHandle, position, origin);
8604  }
8605  }
8606 
8607  fpl_api uint32_t GetFilePosition32(const FileHandle &fileHandle) {
8608  uint32_t result = 0;
8609  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle != nullptr) {
8610  FILE *posixFileHandle = fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8611  uint32_t result = ftell(posixFileHandle);
8612  }
8613  return(result);
8614  }
8615 
8616  fpl_api void CloseFile(FileHandle &fileHandle) {
8617  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle != nullptr) {
8618  FILE *posixFileHandle = fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8619  fclose(posixFileHandle);
8620  fileHandle = {};
8621  }
8622  }
8623 
8624  fpl_api uint32_t GetFileSize32(const char *filePath) {
8625  uint32_t result = 0;
8626  if (filePath != nullptr) {
8627  FILE *posixFileHandle = fopen(filePath, "rb");
8628  if (posixFileHandle != nullptr) {
8629  fseek(posixFileHandle, 0, SEEK_END);
8630  result = ftell(posixFileHandle);
8631  fclose(posixFileHandle);
8632  }
8633  }
8634  return(result);
8635  }
8636 
8637  fpl_api uint32_t GetFileSize32(const FileHandle &fileHandle) {
8638  uint32_t result = 0;
8639  if (fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle != nullptr) {
8640  FILE *posixFileHandle = fileHandle.internalHandle.posixHandle;
8641  long int curPos = ftell(posixFileHandle);
8642  fseek(posixFileHandle, 0, SEEK_END);
8643  result = ftell(posixFileHandle);
8644  fseek(posixFileHandle, curPos, SEEK_SET);
8645  }
8646  return(result);
8647  }
8648 
8649  fpl_api bool FileExists(const char *filePath) {
8650  bool result = false;
8651  if (filePath != nullptr) {
8652  // @IMPLEMENT(final): POSIX File Exists
8653  }
8654  return(result);
8655  }

8660  return false;
8661  }
8662  if (targetFilePath == nullptr) {
8663  common::PushError("Target file path parameter are not allowed to be null");
8664  return false;
8665  }
8666  bool result = false;
8667  // @IMPLEMENT(final): POSIX Copy File
8668  return(result);
8669  }

8678  return(result);
8679  }

8706  }

8719  }
