8735 // ****************************************************************************
8736 //
8737 // Linux Platform
8738 //
8739 // ****************************************************************************
8740 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX)
8741 # include <unistd.h> // sysconf
8742 # include <ctype.h> // isspace
8743 
8744 namespace fpl {
8745  fpl_api bool InitPlatform(const InitFlags initFlags, const Settings &initSettings) {
8746  return true;
8747  }
8748 
8749  fpl_api void ReleasePlatform() {
8750  }
8751 
8752  // Linux Hardware
8753  namespace hardware {
8754  fpl_api uint32_t GetProcessorCoreCount() {
8755  uint32_t result = sysconf(_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN);
8756  return(result);
8757  }
8758 
8759  fpl_api char *GetProcessorName(char *destBuffer, const uint32_t maxDestBufferLen) {
8760  if (destBuffer == nullptr) {
8761  common::PushError("Dest buffer parameter are not allowed to be null");
8762  return nullptr;
8763  }
8764  if (maxDestBufferLen == 0) {
8765  common::PushError("Max dest buffer len parameter '%d' must be greater than zero");
8766  return nullptr;
8767  }
8768  char *result = nullptr;
8769  FILE *fileHandle = fopen("/proc/cpuinfo", "rb");
8770  if (fileHandle != nullptr) {
8771  char buffer[256];
8772  char line[256];
8773  const size_t maxBufferSize = FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(buffer);
8774  int32_t readSize = maxBufferSize;
8775  int32_t readPos = 0;
8776  bool found = false;
8777  int bytesRead = 0;
8778  while ((bytesRead = fread(&buffer[readPos], readSize, 1, fileHandle)) > 0) {
8779  char *lastP = &buffer[0];
8780  char *p = &buffer[0];
8781  while (*p) {
8782  if (*p == '\n') {
8783  int32_t len = p - lastP;
8784  FPL_ASSERT(len > 0);
8785  if (strings::IsStringEqual(lastP, 10, "model name", 10)) {
8786  strings::CopyAnsiString(lastP, len, line, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(line));
8787  found = true;
8788  break;
8789  }
8790  lastP = p + 1;
8791  }
8792  ++p;
8793  }
8794  if (found) {
8795  break;
8796  }
8797 
8798  int32_t remaining = &buffer[maxBufferSize] - lastP;
8799  FPL_ASSERT(remaining >= 0);
8800  if (remaining > 0) {
8801  // Buffer does not contain a line separator - copy back to remaining characters to the line
8802  strings::CopyAnsiString(lastP, remaining, line, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(line));
8803  // Copy back line to buffer and use a different read position/size
8804  strings::CopyAnsiString(line, remaining, buffer, maxBufferSize);
8805  readPos = remaining;
8806  readSize = maxBufferSize - remaining;
8807  } else {
8808  readPos = 0;
8809  readSize = maxBufferSize;
8810  }
8811  }
8812  if (found) {
8813  char *p = line;
8814  while (*p) {
8815  if (*p == ':') {
8816  ++p;
8817  // Skip whitespaces
8818  while (*p && isspace(*p)) {
8819  ++p;
8820  }
8821  break;
8822  }
8823  ++p;
8824  }
8825  if (p != line) {
8826  strings::CopyAnsiString(p, destBuffer, maxDestBufferLen);
8827  result = destBuffer;
8828  }
8829  }
8830  fclose(fileHandle);
8831  }
8832  return(result);
8833  }
8834 
8835  fpl_api MemoryInfos GetSystemMemoryInfos() {
8836  MemoryInfos result = {};
8837  return(result);
8838  }
8839  }
8840 
8841 }
8842 #endif // FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX
8843 
8844 // ****************************************************************************
8845 //
8846 // Audio Drivers
8847 //
8848 // ****************************************************************************
8849 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
8850 # include <mmreg.h>
8851 # include <dsound.h>
8852 #endif
8853 namespace fpl {
8854  namespace drivers {
8855 
8856 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
8857  //
8858  // DirectSound
8859  //
8860 # define FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_CREATE(name) HRESULT WINAPI name(const GUID* pcGuidDevice, LPDIRECTSOUND *ppDS8, LPUNKNOWN pUnkOuter)
8861  typedef FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_CREATE(func_DirectSoundCreate);
8862 # define FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_ENUMERATE_A(name) HRESULT WINAPI name(LPDSENUMCALLBACKA pDSEnumCallback, LPVOID pContext)
8863  typedef FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_ENUMERATE_A(func_DirectSoundEnumerateA);
8864 
8865  static const GUID FPL_IID_IDirectSoundNotify = { 0xb0210783, 0x89cd, 0x11d0, {0xaf, 0x08, 0x00, 0xa0, 0xc9, 0x25, 0xcd, 0x16} };
8866 
8867  fpl_constant uint32_t FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS = 4;
8868 
8869  struct DirectSoundState {
8870  HMODULE dsoundLibrary;
8871  LPDIRECTSOUND directSound;
8872  LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER primaryBuffer;
8873  LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER secondaryBuffer;
8874  LPDIRECTSOUNDNOTIFY notify;
8875  HANDLE notifyEvents[FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS];
8876  HANDLE stopEvent;
8877  uint32_t lastProcessedFrame;
8878  bool breakMainLoop;
8879  };
8880 
8881  struct DirectSoundDeviceInfos {
8882  uint32_t foundDeviceCount;
8883  AudioDeviceID *devices;
8884  uint32_t maxDeviceCount;
8885  };
8886 
8887  fpl_internal BOOL CALLBACK GetDeviceCallbackDirectSound(LPGUID lpGuid, LPCSTR lpcstrDescription, LPCSTR lpcstrModule, LPVOID lpContext) {
8888  (void)lpcstrModule;
8889 
8890  DirectSoundDeviceInfos *infos = (DirectSoundDeviceInfos *)lpContext;
8891  FPL_ASSERT(infos != nullptr);
8892  if (infos->devices != nullptr) {
8893  uint32_t index = infos->foundDeviceCount++;
8894  if (index < infos->maxDeviceCount) {
8895  AudioDeviceID *deviceId = infos->devices + index;
8896  *deviceId = {};
8897  strings::CopyAnsiString(lpcstrDescription, deviceId->name, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(deviceId->name));
8898  if (lpGuid != nullptr) {
8899  memory::MemoryCopy(lpGuid, sizeof(deviceId->dshow), &deviceId->dshow);
8900  }
8901  return TRUE;
8902  }
8903  }
8904  return FALSE;
8905  }
8906 
8907  fpl_internal uint32_t GetDevicesDirectSound(DirectSoundState &dsoundState, AudioDeviceID *devices, uint32_t maxDeviceCount) {
8908  uint32_t result = 0;
8909  func_DirectSoundEnumerateA *directSoundEnumerateA = (func_DirectSoundEnumerateA *)GetProcAddress(dsoundState.dsoundLibrary, "DirectSoundEnumerateA");
8910  if (directSoundEnumerateA != nullptr) {
8911  DirectSoundDeviceInfos infos = {};
8912  infos.maxDeviceCount = maxDeviceCount;
8913  infos.devices = devices;
8914  directSoundEnumerateA(GetDeviceCallbackDirectSound, &infos);
8915  result = infos.foundDeviceCount;
8916  }
8917  return(result);
8918  }
8919 
8920  fpl_internal bool ReleaseDirectSound(const audio::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
8921  if (dsoundState.dsoundLibrary != nullptr) {
8922  if (dsoundState.stopEvent != nullptr) {
8923  CloseHandle(dsoundState.stopEvent);
8924  }
8925 
8926  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < commonAudio.internalFormat.periods; ++i) {
8927  if (dsoundState.notifyEvents[i]) {
8928  CloseHandle(dsoundState.notifyEvents[i]);
8929  }
8930  }
8931 
8932  if (dsoundState.notify != nullptr) {
8933  dsoundState.notify->Release();
8934  }
8935 
8936  if (dsoundState.secondaryBuffer != nullptr) {
8937  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Release();
8938  }
8939 
8940  if (dsoundState.primaryBuffer != nullptr) {
8941  dsoundState.primaryBuffer->Release();
8942  }
8943 
8944  if (dsoundState.directSound != nullptr) {
8945  dsoundState.directSound->Release();
8946  }
8947 
8948  FreeLibrary(dsoundState.dsoundLibrary);
8949  dsoundState = {};
8950  }
8951 
8952  return true;
8953  }
8954 
8955  fpl_internal audio::AudioResult InitDirectSound(const AudioSettings &audioSettings, audio::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
8956  // Load direct sound library
8957  dsoundState.dsoundLibrary = LoadLibraryA("dsound.dll");
8958  func_DirectSoundCreate *directSoundCreate = (func_DirectSoundCreate *)GetProcAddress(dsoundState.dsoundLibrary, "DirectSoundCreate");
8959  if (directSoundCreate == nullptr) {
8960  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8961  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8962  }
8963 
8964  // Load direct sound object
8965  const GUID *deviceId = nullptr;
8966  if (strings::GetAnsiStringLength(audioSettings.deviceID.name) > 0) {
8967  deviceId = &audioSettings.deviceID.dshow;
8968  }
8969  if (!SUCCEEDED(directSoundCreate(deviceId, &dsoundState.directSound, nullptr))) {
8970  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8971  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8972  }
8973 
8974  // Setup wave format ex
8975  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE wf = {};
8976  wf.Format.cbSize = sizeof(wf);
8977  wf.Format.wFormatTag = WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE;
8978  wf.Format.nChannels = (WORD)audioSettings.deviceFormat.channels;
8979  wf.Format.nSamplesPerSec = (DWORD)audioSettings.deviceFormat.sampleRate;
8980  wf.Format.wBitsPerSample = audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(audioSettings.deviceFormat.type) * 8;
8981  wf.Format.nBlockAlign = (wf.Format.nChannels * wf.Format.wBitsPerSample) / 8;
8982  wf.Format.nAvgBytesPerSec = wf.Format.nBlockAlign * wf.Format.nSamplesPerSec;
8983  wf.Samples.wValidBitsPerSample = wf.Format.wBitsPerSample;
8984  if ((audioSettings.deviceFormat.type == AudioFormatType::F32) || (audioSettings.deviceFormat.type == AudioFormatType::F64)) {
8985  wf.SubFormat = KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT;
8986  } else {
8987  wf.SubFormat = KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM;
8988  }
8989 
8990  // Get either local window handle or desktop handle
8991  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__Win32__State != nullptr);
8992  HWND windowHandle = nullptr;
8993 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
8994  if (platform::global__Win32__State->initFlags & InitFlags::Window) {
8995  windowHandle = platform::global__Win32__State->window.windowHandle;
8996  }
8997 #endif
8998  if (windowHandle == nullptr) {
8999  windowHandle = platform::global__Win32__API__Functions.user.getDesktopWindow();
9000  }
9001 
9002  // The cooperative level must be set before doing anything else
9003  if (FAILED(dsoundState.directSound->SetCooperativeLevel(windowHandle, (audioSettings.preferExclusiveMode) ? DSSCL_EXCLUSIVE : DSSCL_PRIORITY))) {
9004  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9005  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9006  }
9007 
9008  // Create primary buffer
9009  DSBUFFERDESC descDSPrimary = {};
9010  descDSPrimary.dwSize = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
9011  descDSPrimary.dwFlags = DSBCAPS_PRIMARYBUFFER | DSBCAPS_CTRLVOLUME;
9012  if (FAILED(dsoundState.directSound->CreateSoundBuffer(&descDSPrimary, &dsoundState.primaryBuffer, nullptr))) {
9013  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9014  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9015  }
9016 
9017  // Set format
9018  if (FAILED(dsoundState.primaryBuffer->SetFormat((WAVEFORMATEX*)&wf))) {
9019  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9020  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9021  }
9022 
9023  // Get the required size in bytes
9024  DWORD requiredSize;
9025  if (FAILED(dsoundState.primaryBuffer->GetFormat(nullptr, 0, &requiredSize))) {
9026  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9027  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9028  }
9029 
9030  // Get actual format
9031  char rawdata[1024];
9032  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE* pActualFormat = (WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE*)rawdata;
9033  if (FAILED(dsoundState.primaryBuffer->GetFormat((WAVEFORMATEX*)pActualFormat, requiredSize, nullptr))) {
9034  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9035  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9036  }
9037 
9038  // Set internal format
9039  AudioDeviceFormat internalFormat = {};
9040  if (IsEqualGUID(pActualFormat->SubFormat, KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT)) {
9041  if (pActualFormat->Format.wBitsPerSample == 64) {
9042  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::F64;
9043  } else {
9044  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::F32;
9045  }
9046  } else {
9047  switch (pActualFormat->Format.wBitsPerSample) {
9048  case 8:
9049  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::U8;
9050  break;
9051  case 16:
9052  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S16;
9053  break;
9054  case 24:
9055  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S24;
9056  break;
9057  case 32:
9058  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S32;
9059  break;
9060  case 64:
9061  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S64;
9062  break;
9063  }
9064  }
9065  internalFormat.channels = pActualFormat->Format.nChannels;
9066  internalFormat.sampleRate = pActualFormat->Format.nSamplesPerSec;
9067 
9068  // @NOTE(final): We divide up our playback buffer into this number of periods and let directsound notify us when one of it needs to play.
9069  internalFormat.periods = 2;
9070  internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames = audio::GetAudioBufferSizeInFrames(internalFormat.sampleRate, audioSettings.bufferSizeInMilliSeconds);
9071  internalFormat.bufferSizeInBytes = internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames * internalFormat.channels * audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(internalFormat.type);
9072 
9073  commonAudio.internalFormat = internalFormat;
9074 
9075  // Create secondary buffer
9076  DSBUFFERDESC descDS = {};
9077  descDS.dwSize = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
9078  descDS.dwFlags = DSBCAPS_CTRLPOSITIONNOTIFY | DSBCAPS_GLOBALFOCUS | DSBCAPS_GETCURRENTPOSITION2;
9079  descDS.dwBufferBytes = (DWORD)internalFormat.bufferSizeInBytes;
9080  descDS.lpwfxFormat = (WAVEFORMATEX*)&wf;
9081  if (FAILED(dsoundState.directSound->CreateSoundBuffer(&descDS, &dsoundState.secondaryBuffer, nullptr))) {
9082  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9083  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9084  }
9085 
9086  // Notifications are set up via a DIRECTSOUNDNOTIFY object which is retrieved from the buffer.
9087  if (FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->QueryInterface(FPL_IID_IDirectSoundNotify, (void**)&dsoundState.notify))) {
9088  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9089  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9090  }
9091 
9092  // Setup notifications
9093  uint32_t periodSizeInBytes = internalFormat.bufferSizeInBytes / internalFormat.periods;
9094  DSBPOSITIONNOTIFY notifyPoints[FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS];
9095  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < internalFormat.periods; ++i) {
9096  dsoundState.notifyEvents[i] = CreateEventA(nullptr, false, false, nullptr);
9097  if (dsoundState.notifyEvents[i] == nullptr) {
9098  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9099  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9100  }
9101 
9102  // The notification offset is in bytes.
9103  notifyPoints[i].dwOffset = i * periodSizeInBytes;
9104  notifyPoints[i].hEventNotify = dsoundState.notifyEvents[i];
9105  }
9106  if (FAILED(dsoundState.notify->SetNotificationPositions(internalFormat.periods, notifyPoints))) {
9107  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9108  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9109  }
9110 
9111  // Create stop event
9112  dsoundState.stopEvent = CreateEventA(nullptr, false, false, nullptr);
9113  if (dsoundState.stopEvent == nullptr) {
9114  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9115  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9116  }
9117 
9118  return audio::AudioResult::Success;
9119  }
9120 
9121  fpl_internal_inline void StopMainLoopDirectSound(DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9122  dsoundState.breakMainLoop = true;
9123  SetEvent(dsoundState.stopEvent);
9124  }
9125 
9126  fpl_internal bool GetCurrentFrameDirectSound(const audio::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState, uint32_t* pCurrentPos) {
9127  FPL_ASSERT(pCurrentPos != nullptr);
9128  *pCurrentPos = 0;
9129 
9130  FPL_ASSERT(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer != nullptr);
9131  DWORD dwCurrentPosition;
9132  if (FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->GetCurrentPosition(nullptr, &dwCurrentPosition))) {
9133  return false;
9134  }
9135 
9136  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.channels > 0);
9137  *pCurrentPos = (uint32_t)dwCurrentPosition / audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(commonAudio.internalFormat.type) / commonAudio.internalFormat.channels;
9138  return true;
9139  }
9140 
9141  fpl_internal uint32_t GetAvailableFramesDirectSound(const audio::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9142  // Get current frame from current play position
9143  uint32_t currentFrame;
9144  if (!GetCurrentFrameDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState, &currentFrame)) {
9145  return 0;
9146  }
9147 
9148  // In a playback device the last processed frame should always be ahead of the current frame. The space between
9149  // the last processed and current frame (moving forward, starting from the last processed frame) is the amount
9150  // of space available to write.
9151  uint32_t totalFrameCount = commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames;
9152  uint32_t committedBeg = currentFrame;
9153  uint32_t committedEnd;
9154  committedEnd = dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame;
9155  if (committedEnd <= committedBeg) {
9156  committedEnd += totalFrameCount;
9157  }
9158 
9159  uint32_t committedSize = (committedEnd - committedBeg);
9160  FPL_ASSERT(committedSize <= totalFrameCount);
9161 
9162  return totalFrameCount - committedSize;
9163  }
9164 
9165  fpl_internal uint32_t WaitForFramesDirectSound(const audio::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9166  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.sampleRate > 0);
9167  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.periods > 0);
9168 
9169  // The timeout to use for putting the thread to sleep is based on the size of the buffer and the period count.
9170  DWORD timeoutInMilliseconds = (commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames / (commonAudio.internalFormat.sampleRate / 1000)) / commonAudio.internalFormat.periods;
9171  if (timeoutInMilliseconds < 1) {
9172  timeoutInMilliseconds = 1;
9173  }
9174 
9175  // Copy event handles so we can wait for each one
9176  unsigned int eventCount = commonAudio.internalFormat.periods + 1;
9177  HANDLE pEvents[FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS + 1]; // +1 for the stop event.
9178  memory::MemoryCopy(dsoundState.notifyEvents, sizeof(HANDLE) * commonAudio.internalFormat.periods, pEvents);
9179  pEvents[eventCount - 1] = dsoundState.stopEvent;
9180 
9181  while (!dsoundState.breakMainLoop) {
9182  // Get available frames from directsound
9183  uint32_t framesAvailable = GetAvailableFramesDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9184  if (framesAvailable > 0) {
9185  return framesAvailable;
9186  }
9187 
9188  // If we get here it means we weren't able to find any frames. We'll just wait here for a bit.
9189  WaitForMultipleObjects(eventCount, pEvents, FALSE, timeoutInMilliseconds);
9190  }
9191 
9192  // We'll get here if the loop was terminated. Just return whatever's available.
9193  return GetAvailableFramesDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9194  }
9195 
9196  fpl_internal bool StopDirectSound(DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9197  FPL_ASSERT(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer != nullptr);
9198  if (FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Stop())) {
9199  return false;
9200  }
9201  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->SetCurrentPosition(0);
9202  return true;
9203  }
9204 
9205  fpl_internal audio::AudioResult StartDirectSound(const audio::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9206  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.channels > 0);
9207  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.periods > 0);
9208  uint32_t audioSampleSizeBytes = audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(commonAudio.internalFormat.type);
9209  FPL_ASSERT(audioSampleSizeBytes > 0);
9210 
9211  // Before playing anything we need to grab an initial group of samples from the client.
9212  uint32_t framesToRead = commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames / commonAudio.internalFormat.periods;
9213  uint32_t desiredLockSize = framesToRead * commonAudio.internalFormat.channels * audioSampleSizeBytes;
9214 
9215  void* pLockPtr;
9216  DWORD actualLockSize;
9217  void* pLockPtr2;
9218  DWORD actualLockSize2;
9219  if (SUCCEEDED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Lock(0, desiredLockSize, &pLockPtr, &actualLockSize, &pLockPtr2, &actualLockSize2, 0))) {
9220  framesToRead = actualLockSize / audioSampleSizeBytes / commonAudio.internalFormat.channels;
9221  audio::ReadAudioFramesFromClient(commonAudio, framesToRead, pLockPtr);
9222  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Unlock(pLockPtr, actualLockSize, pLockPtr2, actualLockSize2);
9223  dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame = framesToRead;
9224  if (FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Play(0, 0, DSBPLAY_LOOPING))) {
9225  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9226  }
9227  } else {
9228  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9229  }
9230  return audio::AudioResult::Success;
9231  }
9232 
9233  fpl_internal void DirectSoundMainLoop(const audio::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9234  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.channels > 0);
9235  uint32_t audioSampleSizeBytes = audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(commonAudio.internalFormat.type);
9236  FPL_ASSERT(audioSampleSizeBytes > 0);
9237 
9238  // Make sure the stop event is not signaled to ensure we don't end up immediately returning from WaitForMultipleObjects().
9239  ResetEvent(dsoundState.stopEvent);
9240 
9241  // Main loop
9242  dsoundState.breakMainLoop = false;
9243  while (!dsoundState.breakMainLoop) {
9244  // Wait until we get available frames from directsound
9245  uint32_t framesAvailable = WaitForFramesDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9246  if (framesAvailable == 0) {
9247  continue;
9248  }
9249 
9250  // Don't bother grabbing more data if the device is being stopped.
9251  if (dsoundState.breakMainLoop) {
9252  break;
9253  }
9254 
9255  // Lock playback buffer
9256  DWORD lockOffset = dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame * commonAudio.internalFormat.channels * audioSampleSizeBytes;
9257  DWORD lockSize = framesAvailable * commonAudio.internalFormat.channels * audioSampleSizeBytes;
9258  {
9259  void* pLockPtr;
9260  DWORD actualLockSize;
9261  void* pLockPtr2;
9262  DWORD actualLockSize2;
9263  if (FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Lock(lockOffset, lockSize, &pLockPtr, &actualLockSize, &pLockPtr2, &actualLockSize2, 0))) {
9264  // @TODO(final): Handle error
9265  break;
9266  }
9267 
9268  // Read actual frames from user
9269  uint32_t frameCount = actualLockSize / audioSampleSizeBytes / commonAudio.internalFormat.channels;
9270  audio::ReadAudioFramesFromClient(commonAudio, frameCount, pLockPtr);
9271  dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame = (dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame + frameCount) % commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames;
9272 
9273  // Unlock playback buffer
9274  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Unlock(pLockPtr, actualLockSize, pLockPtr2, actualLockSize2);
9275  }
9276  }
9277  }
9278 # endif //FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND
9279 
9280  } // drivers
9281 } // fpl
9282 
9283 // ****************************************************************************
9284 //
9285 // Platform Independent (Audio)
9286 //
9287 // The audio system is based on a stripped down version of "mini_al.h" by David Reid.
9288 // See: https://github.com/dr-soft/mini_al
9289 //
9290 // ****************************************************************************
9291 namespace fpl {
9292 
9293 //
9294 // Audio
9295 //
9296 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
9297  namespace audio {
9298  enum class AudioDeviceState : uint32_t {
9299  Uninitialized = 0,
9300  Stopped,
9301  Started,
9302  Starting,
9303  Stopping,
9304  };
9305 
9306  struct AudioState {
9307  CommonAudioState common;
9308 
9309  threading::ThreadMutex lock;
9310  threading::ThreadContext *workerThread;
9311  threading::ThreadSignal startSignal;
9312  threading::ThreadSignal stopSignal;
9313  threading::ThreadSignal wakeupSignal;
9314  volatile AudioDeviceState state;
9315  volatile AudioResult workResult;
9316 
9317  AudioDriverType activeDriver;
9318  uint32_t periods;
9319  uint32_t bufferSizeInFrames;
9320  uint32_t bufferSizeInBytes;
9321  bool isAsyncDriver;
9322 
9323  union {
9324 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9325  drivers::DirectSoundState dsound;
9326 # endif
9327  };
9328  };
9329 
9330  fpl_globalvar AudioState global__Audio__State = {};
9331 
9332  fpl_internal void AudioDeviceStopMainLoop(AudioState &audioState) {
9333  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9334  switch (audioState.activeDriver) {
9335 
9336 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9337  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9338  {
9339  StopMainLoopDirectSound(audioState.dsound);
9340  } break;
9341 # endif
9342 
9343  default:
9344  break;
9345  }
9346  }
9347 
9348  fpl_internal bool AudioReleaseDevice(AudioState &audioState) {
9349  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9350  bool result = false;
9351  switch (audioState.activeDriver) {
9352 
9353 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9354  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9355  {
9356  result = ReleaseDirectSound(audioState.common, audioState.dsound);
9357  } break;
9358 # endif
9359 
9360  default:
9361  break;
9362  }
9363  return (result);
9364  }
9365 
9366  fpl_internal bool AudioStopDevice(AudioState &audioState) {
9367  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9368  bool result = false;
9369  switch (audioState.activeDriver) {
9370 
9371 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9372  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9373  {
9374  result = StopDirectSound(audioState.dsound);
9375  } break;
9376 # endif
9377 
9378  default:
9379  break;
9380  }
9381  return (result);
9382  }
9383 
9384  fpl_internal AudioResult AudioStartDevice(AudioState &audioState) {
9385  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9386  AudioResult result = AudioResult::Failed;
9387  switch (audioState.activeDriver) {
9388 
9389 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9390  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9391  {
9392  result = StartDirectSound(audioState.common, audioState.dsound);
9393  } break;
9394 # endif
9395 
9396  default:
9397  break;
9398  }
9399  return (result);
9400  }
9401 
9402  fpl_internal void AudioDeviceMainLoop(AudioState &audioState) {
9403  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9404  switch (audioState.activeDriver) {
9405 
9406 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9407  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9408  {
9409  DirectSoundMainLoop(audioState.common, audioState.dsound);
9410  } break;
9411 # endif
9412 
9413  default:
9414  break;
9415  }
9416  }
9417 
9418  fpl_internal_inline bool IsAudioDriverAsync(AudioDriverType audioDriver) {
9419  switch (audioDriver) {
9420  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9421  return false;
9422  default:
9423  return false;
9424  }
9425  }
9426 
9427  fpl_internal_inline void AudioSetDeviceState(AudioState &audioState, AudioDeviceState newState) {
9428  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&audioState.state, (uint32_t)newState);
9429  }
9430 
9431  fpl_internal_inline AudioDeviceState AudioGetDeviceState(AudioState &audioState) {
9432  AudioDeviceState result = (AudioDeviceState)atomics::AtomicLoadU32((volatile uint32_t *)&audioState.state);
9433  return(result);
9434  }
9435 
9436  fpl_internal_inline bool IsAudioDeviceInitialized(AudioState *audioState) {
9437  if (audioState == nullptr) {
9438  return false;
9439  }
9440  AudioDeviceState state = AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState);
9441  return(state != AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized);
9442  }
9443 
9444  fpl_internal_inline bool IsAudioDeviceStarted(AudioState *audioState) {
9445  if (audioState == nullptr) {
9446  return false;
9447  }
9448  AudioDeviceState state = AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState);
9449  return(state == AudioDeviceState::Started);
9450  }
9451 
9452  fpl_internal void AudioWorkerThread(const threading::ThreadContext &context, void *data) {
9453  AudioState *audioState = (AudioState *)data;
9454  FPL_ASSERT(audioState != nullptr);
9455  FPL_ASSERT(audioState->activeDriver != AudioDriverType::None);
9456 
9457 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9458  platform::global__Win32__API__Functions.ole.coInitializeEx(nullptr, 0);
9459 # endif
9460 
9461  for (;;) {
9462  // Stop the device at the start of the iteration always
9463  AudioStopDevice(*audioState);
9464 
9465  // Let the other threads know that the device has been stopped.
9466  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Stopped);
9467  threading::SignalWakeUp(audioState->stopSignal);
9468 
9469  // We wait until the audio device gets wake up
9470  threading::SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->wakeupSignal);
9471 
9472  // Default result code.
9473  audioState->workResult = AudioResult::Success;
9474 
9475  // Just break if we're terminating.
9476  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized) {
9477  break;
9478  }
9479 
9480  // Expect that the device is currently be started by the client
9481  FPL_ASSERT(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Starting);
9482 
9483  // Start audio device
9484  audioState->workResult = AudioStartDevice(*audioState);
9485  if (audioState->workResult != AudioResult::Success) {
9486  threading::SignalWakeUp(audioState->startSignal);
9487  continue;
9488  }
9489 
9490  // The audio device is started, mark it as such
9491  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Started);
9492  threading::SignalWakeUp(audioState->startSignal);
9493 
9494  // Enter audio device main loop
9495  AudioDeviceMainLoop(*audioState);
9496  }
9497 
9498  // Signal to stop any audio threads, in case there are some waiting
9499  threading::SignalWakeUp(audioState->stopSignal);
9500 
9501 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9502  platform::global__Win32__API__Functions.ole.coUninitialize();
9503 # endif
9504  }
9505 
9506  fpl_api AudioResult StopAudio() {
9507  AudioState *audioState = &global__Audio__State;
9508 
9509  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized) {
9510  return AudioResult::DeviceNotInitialized;
9511  }
9512 
9513  AudioResult result = AudioResult::Failed;
9514  MutexLock(audioState->lock);
9515  {
9516  // Check if the device is already stopped
9517  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopping) {
9518  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9519  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStopped;
9520  }
9521  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopped) {
9522  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9523  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStopped;
9524  }
9525 
9526  // The device needs to be in a started state. If it's not, we just let the caller know the device is busy.
9527  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) != AudioDeviceState::Started) {
9528  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9529  return AudioResult::DeviceBusy;
9530  }
9531 
9532  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Stopping);
9533 
9534  if (audioState->isAsyncDriver) {
9535  // Asynchronous drivers (Has their own thread)
9536  AudioStopDevice(*audioState);
9537  } else {
9538  // Synchronous drivers
9539 
9540  // The audio worker thread is most likely in a wait state, so let it stop properly.
9541  AudioDeviceStopMainLoop(*audioState);
9542 
9543  // We need to wait for the worker thread to become available for work before returning.
9544  // @NOTE(final): The audio worker thread will be the one who puts the device into the stopped state.
9545  SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->stopSignal);
9546  result = AudioResult::Success;
9547  }
9548  }
9549  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9550 
9551  return result;
9552  }
9553 
9554  fpl_api AudioResult PlayAudio() {
9555  AudioState *audioState = &global__Audio__State;
9556 
9557  if (!IsAudioDeviceInitialized(audioState)) {
9558  return AudioResult::DeviceNotInitialized;
9559  }
9560 
9561  AudioResult result = AudioResult::Failed;
9562  MutexLock(audioState->lock);
9563  {
9564  // Be a bit more descriptive if the device is already started or is already in the process of starting.
9565  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Starting) {
9566  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9567  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStarted;
9568  }
9569  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Started) {
9570  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9571  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStarted;
9572  }
9573 
9574  // The device needs to be in a stopped state. If it's not, we just let the caller know the device is busy.
9575  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) != AudioDeviceState::Stopped) {
9576  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9577  return AudioResult::DeviceBusy;
9578  }
9579 
9580  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Starting);
9581 
9582  if (audioState->isAsyncDriver) {
9583  // Asynchronous drivers (Has their own thread)
9584  AudioStartDevice(*audioState);
9585  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Started);
9586  } else {
9587  // Synchronous drivers
9588  SignalWakeUp(audioState->wakeupSignal);
9589 
9590  // Wait for the worker thread to finish starting the device.
9591  // @NOTE(final): The audio worker thread will be the one who puts the device into the started state.
9592  SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->startSignal);
9593  result = audioState->workResult;
9594  }
9595  }
9596  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9597 
9598  return result;
9599  }
9600 
9601  fpl_internal void ReleaseAudio() {
9602  AudioState *audioState = &global__Audio__State;
9603 
9604  if (!IsAudioDeviceInitialized(audioState)) {
9605  return;
9606  }
9607 
9608  if (IsAudioDeviceStarted(audioState)) {
9609  // Wait until the audio device is started
9610  while (StopAudio() == AudioResult::DeviceBusy) {
9611  threading::ThreadSleep(1);
9612  }
9613  }
9614 
9615  // Putting the device into an uninitialized state will make the worker thread return.
9616  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized);
9617 
9618  // Wake up the worker thread and wait for it to properly terminate.
9619  SignalWakeUp(audioState->wakeupSignal);
9620  ThreadWaitForOne(audioState->workerThread);
9621  ThreadDestroy(audioState->workerThread);
9622 
9623  // Release signals and thread
9624  threading::SignalDestroy(audioState->stopSignal);
9625  threading::SignalDestroy(audioState->startSignal);
9626  threading::SignalDestroy(audioState->wakeupSignal);
9627  threading::MutexDestroy(audioState->lock);
9628 
9629  // Release audio device
9630  AudioReleaseDevice(*audioState);
9631 
9632  *audioState = {};
9633 
9634 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9635  platform::global__Win32__API__Functions.ole.coUninitialize();
9636 # endif
9637  }
9638 
9639  fpl_internal AudioResult InitAudio(const AudioSettings &audioSettings) {
9640  AudioState *audioState = &global__Audio__State;
9641 
9642  if (audioState->activeDriver != AudioDriverType::None) {
9643  return AudioResult::Failed;
9644  }
9645 
9646  if (audioSettings.deviceFormat.channels == 0) {
9647  return AudioResult::Failed;
9648  }
9649  if (audioSettings.deviceFormat.sampleRate == 0) {
9650  return AudioResult::Failed;
9651  }
9652  if (audioSettings.bufferSizeInMilliSeconds == 0) {
9653  return AudioResult::Failed;
9654  }
9655 
9656  *audioState = {};
9657  audioState->common.clientReadCallback = audioSettings.clientReadCallback;
9658  audioState->common.clientUserData = audioSettings.userData;
9659 
9660 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9661  platform::global__Win32__API__Functions.ole.coInitializeEx(nullptr, 0);
9662 # endif
9663 
9664  // Create mutex and signals
9665  audioState->lock = threading::MutexCreate();
9666  if (!audioState->lock.isValid) {
9667  ReleaseAudio();
9668  return AudioResult::Failed;
9669  }
9670  audioState->wakeupSignal = threading::SignalCreate();
9671  if (!audioState->wakeupSignal.isValid) {
9672  ReleaseAudio();
9673  return AudioResult::Failed;
9674  }
9675  audioState->startSignal = threading::SignalCreate();
9676  if (!audioState->startSignal.isValid) {
9677  ReleaseAudio();
9678  return AudioResult::Failed;
9679  }
9680  audioState->stopSignal = threading::SignalCreate();
9681  if (!audioState->stopSignal.isValid) {
9682  ReleaseAudio();
9683  return AudioResult::Failed;
9684  }
9685 
9686  // Prope drivers
9687  AudioDriverType propeDrivers[] = {
9688  AudioDriverType::DirectSound,
9689  };
9690  uint32_t driverCount = FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(propeDrivers);
9691  AudioResult initResult = AudioResult::Failed;
9692  for (uint32_t driverIndex = 0; driverIndex < driverCount; ++driverIndex) {
9693  AudioDriverType propeDriver = propeDrivers[driverIndex];
9694 
9695  initResult = AudioResult::Failed;
9696  switch (audioSettings.driver) {
9697 
9698 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9699  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9700  {
9701  initResult = drivers::InitDirectSound(audioSettings, audioState->common, audioState->dsound);
9702  if (initResult != AudioResult::Success) {
9703  drivers::ReleaseDirectSound(audioState->common, audioState->dsound);
9704  }
9705  } break;
9706 # endif
9707 
9708  default:
9709  break;
9710  }
9711  if (initResult == AudioResult::Success) {
9712  audioState->activeDriver = propeDriver;
9713  audioState->isAsyncDriver = IsAudioDriverAsync(propeDriver);
9714  break;
9715  }
9716  }
9717 
9718  if (initResult != AudioResult::Success) {
9719  ReleaseAudio();
9720  return initResult;
9721  }
9722 
9723  if (!audioState->isAsyncDriver) {
9724  // Create and start worker thread
9725  audioState->workerThread = threading::ThreadCreate(AudioWorkerThread, audioState, true);
9726  if (audioState->workerThread == nullptr) {
9727  ReleaseAudio();
9728  return AudioResult::Failed;
9729  }
9730  // Wait for the worker thread to put the device into the stopped state.
9731  SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->stopSignal);
9732  } else {
9733  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Stopped);
9734  }
9735 
9736  FPL_ASSERT(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopped);
9737 
9738  return(AudioResult::Success);
9739  }
9740 
9741  fpl_api const AudioDeviceFormat &GetAudioHardwareFormat() {
9742  AudioState *audioState = &global__Audio__State;
9743  return audioState->common.internalFormat;
9744  }
9745 
9746  fpl_api void SetAudioClientReadCallback(AudioClientReadFunction *newCallback, void *userData) {
9747  AudioState *audioState = &global__Audio__State;
9748  if (audioState->activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto) {
9749  if (AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopped) {
9750  audioState->common.clientReadCallback = newCallback;
9751  audioState->common.clientUserData = userData;
9752  }
9753  }
9754  }
9755 
9756  fpl_api uint32_t GetAudioDevices(AudioDeviceID *devices, uint32_t maxDeviceCount) {
9757  if (devices == nullptr) {
9758  return 0;
9759  }
9760  if (maxDeviceCount == 0) {
9761  return 0;
9762  }
9763  uint32_t result = 0;
9764  AudioState *audioState = &global__Audio__State;
9765  if (audioState->activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto) {
9766  switch (audioState->activeDriver) {
9767 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9768  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9769  {
9770  result = drivers::GetDevicesDirectSound(audioState->dsound, devices, maxDeviceCount);
9771  } break;
9772 # endif
9773  }
9774  }
9775  return(result);
9776  }
9777  } // audio
9778 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
9779 
9780  //
9781  // Error State
9782  //
9783  fpl_api const char *GetPlatformError() {
9784  const char *result = "";
9785  const common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
9786 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
9787  if (errorState.count > 0) {
9788  size_t index = errorState.count - 1;
9789  result = GetPlatformError(index);
9790  }
9791 # else
9792  result = errorState.errors[0];
9793 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES
9794  return (result);
9795  }
9796 
9797  fpl_api const char *GetPlatformError(const size_t index) {
9798  const char *result = "";
9799  const common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
9800 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
9801  if (index > -1 && index < (int32_t)errorState.count) {
9802  result = errorState.errors[index];
9803  } else {
9804  result = errorState.errors[errorState.count - 1];
9805  }
9806 # else
9807  result = errorState.errors[0];
9808 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES
9809  return (result);
9810  }
9811 
9812  fpl_api size_t GetPlatformErrorCount() {
9813  size_t result = 0;
9814  const common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
9815  result = errorState.count;
9816  return (result);
9817  }
9818 
9819  fpl_api void ClearPlatformErrors() {
9820  common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
9821  memory::MemoryClear(&errorState, sizeof(errorState));
9822  }
9823 
9824 } // fpl
9825 
9826 #endif // FPL_IMPLEMENTATION && !FPL_IMPLEMENTED
